description:
Service is excellent here. Came for the bottomless mimosas and brunch on a Sunday and it was a great time. 
My glass was never empty. Staff was very charming and friendly. The place is pretty small so get there early or late to find seating. 

Super laid back environment and the food was pretty good. The breakfast totchos were delicious. The chicken and waffles were a little dry but will definitely come back for the environment and specials
author: Kendra C.

description:
Ooof. Awful experience.

Came in last Friday night for a friends birthday and wanted to immediately leave. The place was elbow to elbow packed.

Then there was that one employee...

The guy who clears the tables took our drinks away before we were done. We politely let him know we weren't finished, to which he replied "I know what an empty glass looks like" before proceeding to try to fight 3 of the guys in our group. They ignored his instigating attempts but he stood there in the corner, watching our table with this look of crazy in his eyes like I've never seen before. Perhaps management should screen their employees a bit better because I 100% did not feel safe in there.

Will. Never. Go. Back.
author: Priyanka C.

description:
When? Sunday Brunch
What? Chicken and waffles-- both so dry they were dusty.  Server was amazing and offered another option. The Home fries and bacon were good. Breakfast tots which were jalapeño based with eggs over easy were good.  Mimosas were hot.  Jell-O shots weren't ready by noon.  
Server made the experience but won't be back.
author: Tad H.

description:
Had a great time here with bottomless mimosas for my birthday girl!!!!! 
Awesome staff, crowd, and fun vibe. Great place to watch the game
author: Anna A.

description:
This bar was fantastic!! Definitely exceeded my expectations. 
We came with the Groupon for brunch. As you walk in, I did not think they would have good brunch quality meals as it mainly looked like a bar scene. Don't ever judge a book by its cover! I ordered a breakfast sandwich (eggs any style, bacon, avocado, cheese on a brioche bun) with tater-tots and it was scrumptious. My husband ordered the lumberjack breakfast which came with french toast sticks. It's more like a french toast loaf! It looked so good and it was still warm, I had to try it. I am glad I did! It was the best thing ever! 

We had the moscow mule jello shot. Very creative jello shot - tasted great and good amount of alcohol. Their mimosa's were great, and the fact that they were bottomless didn't hurt either. Staff always come by with a pitcher to fill it up :) 

Our waitress was super friendly and attended to us well!

Highly recommend and would come back any time!
author: Isabel D.

description:
Enjoy my bottomless mimosa brunch at Bullitt. 

Found this place on groupon - $30ish for bottomless mimosas, two entrees and two Jell-O shots. Definitely got my money's worth. 

I ordered the blt-a Benny and my boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles. Both were really good, I just wished my food was a bit warmer. My boyfriend thought the chicken was kinda dry. No big deal tho
The mimosas were greaaaat and were constantly topped off by the staff. 


This place definitely had a great vibe. The staff were fun and the music was dope. Get there early - by 11:30am all the tables were taken!

Will definitely come back next time I'm in town
author: Sarina S.

description: Taco Tuesday! If you've been to Teeth in the mission they are owned by the same people! Which means awesome $1 tacos and 2-4-1 margs on Tuesday! Here you can get them "loaded" with guac and sour cream for 25 cents! Pretty normal tacos but $1 you really can't ask for better then that in SF! The margs however are amazing! It was $21 for 2 margaritas but they give you the entire pour and a glass with ice which is more like 2-3 margaritas per person for $21 woohoo I'm in! Great place, cool music, and always have the latest sports games on!
author: Megan M.

description:
Great find in central SF! This is the ultimate place for boozey brunch lovers. We started off brunch with 1 jello shots each, and need I mention that they also have bottomless mimosas?? 

Each entree comes with super crispy tater tots (and as someone particular about their tots, this place certainly gets my thumbs up). And to top it all off, the prices are quite reasonable! Will definitely be back.
author: Nancy W.

description:
I adore wings. When I realized I'd never done Wing Wednesday at Bullitt, I organized a get together for Wednesday, October 18th. There were seven of us, so two in our party showed up early, around 5pm, to grab a table. Due to work, I joined everyone around 6pm. We had a table in the back behind the bar.

*$0.25 wings: Buffalo, Sweet Chili Habanero, BBQ, Wasabi Miso Ginger, Carolina Reaper Death Wings of Destruction / Atomic ($0.25) x82
*Truffle Tots ($12.50)
*Totchos: tater tot nachos ($11)
*Old Fashioned on Draft: bourbon, butters, simple syrup, garnished with orange peel & cherry ($10.58) x3
*Shot & a Beer: Jameson & any bottled beer ($10.58), Maike it a 40oz (+$4)
*The Cloak and Dagger: whiskey, fresh blackberries, fresh lemon, mint ($10.58) x2
*The Day Breaker: vodka, aperol, fresh strawberries, fresh lemon, seltzer ($11)
*Bud Light 40: St Louis MO, ABV 4.2%, served in a brown paper bag with a condom ($9.13)
*Standard Deviant Calista Pale Ale: San Francisco CA, ABV 5.9% ($6.25) x2
*Stella Artois Lager: Belgium, ABV 5% ($6.25) x4
*Magnolia Proving Ground IPA: San Francisco CA, ABV 7% ($6.25) x2
*Oban ($17.11) x3
*Laphroaig ($12.54)
*Casamigos Reposado ($8.65)

So a few of us tried the atomic wings. These are definitely not for the faint of heart. I was the only one able to eat two of them, but it burned! Make sure to try the other wings before you try these or else your taste buds will be blown. Aside from the melt my face off wings, I enjoyed the habanero wings. Good balance of sweet and spicy. The tots were delish! Though I do have a weakness for tater tots. They remind me of childhood. I ended up drinking many beers and pours of oban. And ended the night with the jameson and 40.

Our waitress Ariel was an absolute sweetheart! I know wing wendnesday can get a little crazy with everyone ordering a million wings at a time, but she managed to stay friendly and attentive. Especially since we had everyone showing up at different times and were ordering throughout the night.

Looking through our check and the menu, I did notice some items are listed as less and some more. I guess in the end it all evens out, but if you are a stickler in terms of math, I'd double check your bill before you leave. 

Fun spot for $0.25 wings. You really can't beat that deal. Especially when they are normally 8 for $10, 12 for $14, or 24 for $24. Since I am a wing addict, I will most likely be back. I'll just make sure to show up early as it gets packed.
author: Elena N.

description: Went for brunch and had a great time! The place was 100% full after only an hour of being open. The food was amazing and came out quickly. We had breakfast tater tots which were perfectly crispy and had so many fun different toppings and a egg sandwich with tomato soup. So good!!!!! My bottomless mimosa was never empty and never felt rushed to leave. This would be a great place to have a party.
author: Amanda J.

description: Love how Wednesday has 25 cent wings (Two drink minimum)! I love coming here, just hate how packed it gets. You gotta come here early and reserve seats. It usually gets less crowded around 8-10pm. Also, if there is a game .. it definitely is more crowded. LOVE THIS PLACE!!! MY GO TO EVERY WEDNESDAY!!
author: Foodie Sushi Q.

description:
So....sometimes you see something and hear people talk about it but you still don't believe it. I really had to visit "Bullitt" and see if the "40oz in the brown bag" was really something they serve and guess what....Yup it's indeed true (As if I didn't know already) but I'm very stubborn and sometimes have to see something for myself to know that it's what it is, and it was just that a "40oz in a brown paper bag" oh and a condom. Here is my review.

Tuesday March 6th, 2018
Location: Bullit San Francisco, Ca
People: 1 Adult

Story:
Oh after a very long absence from my home away from home it was time for me to go home. I have made a pact with myself, whenever I go to SF to visit somewhere new and discover what the city has to offer and see what others are "Yelping" and Raving about. I been on a mission to check off my SF bookmarks and what better place than "Bullitt" to start with. It's near all my "North Beach" hangouts and it also happened to "Taco Tuesday" as well so it was a no brainier.

Service/Hospitality:
A great first impression, that's what I got from the bartender here. I felt welcomed from the moment I stepped in. The bartender (sorry I forgot his name) gave me a rundown of the offering on the menu, the specials of the day and even chuckled when I asked about the "40oz in the brown paper bag".. with a condom. The people that was there that day was friendly and it happen to be a warriors game day. All around I felt welcomed here and the service was top notch.

Food/Cleanliness:
This place is very chic and perfect for dates and casual hanging out with friends (Sidenote) it was very clean and tidy in here even the restroom was clean and we'll maintained. It was nice to visit a "North Beach" bar that was all around clean and not just a usual "Divebar" when it came to cleanliness. Now on to the food, it was "Taco Tuesday" and they had 3 choices for the evening, Steak, Chicken and Fish. I went with the Steak and fish $1.00 each with guacamole and crema $.50 for each taco bringing the order to $3.00 for these two. They were okay, rather basic tacos with not much flavor to them to be honest. Pretty skimpy on the protein, but then again I didn't expect much. Next up the "Tatchos" I put these in parentheses because they were the bomb! Nachos but instead of chips they used tater tots, your usual (depending on person) toppings, and a great portion. My only grip I feel for the $13.00 price, is that some sort of protein (ground beef) should of been standard with this dish. I washed it down with a "Brown Bagless 40oz" with a condom $9.13 of Bud Light as they ran out of the other beer options. So my grand total with the $.93 SF Employee Mandate and tax $2.05 came out to $27.11

Overall:
I feel "Bullitt" is a pretty cool place for drinks and the occasional light bite and for that alone I can see myself visiting this place on occasions. I don't feel like their prices are the most competitive, but I do like the overall vibe and atmosphere of this place and that alone I feel is what makes this place trendy. I say if you're in SF and looking for something new and different from your normal bar/pub crawl, I would recommend this place totally.
author: Tre S.

description:
I went to Bullitt for Wing Wednesday 25 cent wing special and went through a roller coaster of emotions., but ended up at 5 stars :)

My boyfriend and I walked in at around 8:30 PM and I was immediately shocked at how crowded the place was. It's quite small so people were standing around everywhere. This was our first time at Wing Wednesday and we quickly realized that it was first come first serve. Everyone was watching everyone like hawks. About 20 minutes and 1 beer later we eyed up 2 girl who were leaving and took their seats. It was almost 9 PM and I was starving at this point!

We had to close our tab at the bar because you cant transfer it to the table and it is not included in the 2 drink per person minimum! (KEEP THI S IN MIND) 

We ordered a dozen hot wings and 8 mango habanero to start off and 2 more drinks! The wings were saucy and delicious! If you like a kick, mango habanero is for you. If you enjoy regular old spicy wings go for the hot. We finished the first batch so quickly since we were quite hungry and ordered the second round, more hot and some honey bbq. Once again the wings were saucy and delicious. They came right from the frier. 

Overall, great wings and a good deal. I wouldn't go back to eat food here on a regular day since 8 wings are $10, but wing Wednesday .. I'll be there for sure!
author: Inci A.

description: Good price to product ratio for brunch. The bottomless mimosas were really bottomless, music was good and totchos were a perfect hangover breakfast. Just don't order the huevos rancheros, they were sad to look at. Service was great, you can see the small staff of three (including bartender and barback) working as a team taking care of everyone.
author: Alberto P.

description: The service was terrible. We had a groupon deal and my bf and I were excited to try their food. When we arrived, there was nobody to sit us down. We were confused on who the workers were. Eventually a guy who came out of no where had to ID check us told us to just sit ourselves down. We then were waiting for 20 minutes for the waitress to even notice us. And she did not interact with us. She just gave us the menus and left. She was so concerned about her tips she was receiving from closing out peoples checks. I dont know her name but she had short colored hair. And it was just not professional on how she was working. We were so angry at this point we didnt even want to stay anymore. It was already 30 minutes in and she did not pay attention at all. I believe this place shouldnt be serving food in such a loud environment when the workers were so concerned for people only wanting drinks and not serving people who wanted to order food. We ended up leaving. I would not recommend this place to dine in. Maybe to drink but the service was so bad. Ive never experienced such rude customer service. If I could give this place a 0 star I would.
author: Samantha W.

description:
This review is for the Endless Mimosa Brunch/ Groupon! My friends and I came early Saturday morning (aka before they opened at 10am) to wait for a table, but were told that their tables were all reserved for birthday parties and larger parties. We opted for the bar seating, which had about 12-15 seats. That was a little unexpected, but we should've known considering the price haha. Overall great atmosphere with smiley, helpful bartenders. Friends and I had a good time, and thought the experience was above average for the price and the drinks. We left feeling very good and were only down about $25/ person ($15.5 base + $4.5 tax + $5 tip)

Tips: 
- Come early if your small party is without a reservation. You won't get a seat otherwise lol. 
- Lotsa street parking, but you gotta come early ~
- Your Groupon doesn't come with tax or tip, and this amount will be charged after your meal. Tax was based on original price, which was around $40 - it's suggested that you tip with this in mind as well.
author: Vy T.

description: What happened to this place? It took them 10 minutes to take my order -- it's a Sunday, the bar is half empty, and I ordered directly at the bar before taking a table. My Moscow Mule came in a glass. My server told me she would bring me some napkins for my wings, then never came back. This was one-star service, but I'm recording two in case today was a fluke.
author: Cisco R.

description:
I'm a girl that loves brunch because I love waking up late. However, it is very hard to wake up late for Bullitt because there is quite a long wait. Reason being... unlimited mimosas and a Groupon deal combined. If you get the Groupon (and why wouldn't you?), note that it is only valid on weekends from 10am-3pm. The wait can vary and can go up to an hour or more but you can put your name down with your phone number and they'll text or call you when it's almost time to get seated so you can go around the block to explore. Probably best to come before 1 PM 'cause the last time we try to come at that time, we weren't able to get a table before they ended brunch.

Groupon deal is brunch for two: two brunch entrees, two shots of Fireball, and bottomless mimosas. We bought two Groupons for my party of four.

WAKE & BACON GRILLED CHEESE 
Comes with roasted tomato soup and mixed greens. I love grilled cheese and tomato soup and the grilled cheese was perfectly grilled.

LUMBERJACK BREAKFAST
Your basic breakfast of eggs, bacon, ham, toast, and.... french toast stick. Also comes with tater tots or homefries. 

FRIED CHICKEN & WAFFLES
Comes with Jameson whipped cream and fresh berry compote. The chicken is like chicken tenders. The waffles are fluffy Belgian waffles and it comes pre-cut in four pieces. Definitely easy to share dish since everything is cut out for you.

BLT + A
Eggs benedict (BLT style). Comes with tater tots or homefries. 
 
Big filling portions. Music was actually good (those 90s hits!). Mimosas kept coming. Had to go to the bathroom twice. Was so full that we almost forgot about the Fireballs that came at the end. We didn't so we took that last shot. Left slightly buzzed but happy. Definitely would come back for boozy brunch if we can ever wake up early enough to make the cut off for a table.
author: Diana C.

description:
I've only been to Bullitt for taco Tuesday's and I'd give it a 3.5.

It can get pretty crowded depending on the time you show up, so I suggest you get there early. It also dies down around 10/11pm. The two nights I went the DJ was great; especially if you are more into the hip-hop scene. It is definitely one of those places where you either go with a group of friends and make the most out of the happy hour deal, or you go with someone and know that you are there for the 1$ Tacos.

Anyways, it is a chill environment and I definitely enjoy the fact that they have different happy hours every day of the week! I would definitely check it out!
author: Kassie E.

description:
Met up SB for Wing Wednesdays at her favorite wings spot.  I got there around 5:30 and the place was half packed but luckily I scored seats.  Wings are $0.25 each, you pay by the wing, with a two drink minimum.  

Wasabi Ginger - I'm not a fan of wasabi but it was very subtle and the ginger was non existent
BBQ - saucy 
Sweet Chili Habanero - sweet, right amount of heat 
Buffalo - good balance of tang and heat
Regular tots - our portion was a lot smaller compared to others.  Not crispy

I was a bit hesitant with some of the flavors of the wings but they were all surprisingly really good.  Fun place to watch a game.  Good service
author: Linda N.

description:
Awesome service and great food!! My sister and I went last Sunday for brunch. The waitress was super friendly, and amazing! We did not get her name, bartenders also hands on and refilling drinks. We will definitely be back again! Super cozy feel, definitely a neighborhood bar. We were able to explore the neighborhood and had a a great time!!!
This was a groupon , bottomless mimosas, entrees and Jell-O shots, $30 great deal
author: Janine R.

description:
THIS IS A HAPPY HOUR REVIEW. 

I came here with friends for Wednesday $0.25 chicken wings. What a steal for the price, but the catch is that you have to get 2 drinks in order to get that special price. Fair enough ;) For some reason, it was pretty packed the day I went. My friend who comes here all time said this rarely happened on Wednesday. Anyway, we were lucky to grab 4 seats for our group. 

Wasabi Ginger - Can't taste wasabi, minimal ginger taste. Not sure how I feel about this. I guess I was looking forward to more wasabi taste.
BBQ - very very sauce-y but nothing special.
Buffalo - for a non-spicy eater, this is very spicy. So my non-spicy fellows, don't try it. In terms of the taste, I have no idea because I was trying to cool my tongue down.

Slider - patty was super dry, not recommended.
Tots - Surprisingly very good!
Hot Cheetos Cheese Stick (not sure the name) - you know, cheese stick fried with hot cheetos covered... taste like it sounds like. yep. 

I guess for $0.25 chicken wings, I really can't ask too much. I won't come back from chicken wings, that's for sure. Overall, I'd give the food 2.5 stars. 

2017019
author: Leslie C.

description:
These wings are pretty fire and the bartenders will banter with you.

Our particular bartender smacked talked us into finishing our food which I thank him for. 

Also, the only knock is the refills. I hate when I get refilled with out asking. If you don't like asking, this place will fill you when your half way done.
author: Andres M.

description:
Pros- cheap drinks, place gets wild on weekend nights, loud music, attracrive crowd

Cons- food isnt good, music is too loud if you are not in full on rage mode, often super crowded.

I would give this place 4 stars if i was still 24.
author: Geraud G.

description:
If you're looking for cheap yet awesome wings, then you should definitely come to Bullitt for their Wednesday deal! Wings cost 0.25 cents each, as long as you get 2 drinks; or a pitcher, if you're with a group. 

The place can get pretty packed, but my friends and I have never had an issue with finding a table. We come here at around midnight, so that might be a factor. We've never had an issue with parking, either. 

I definitely recommend their truffle tater tots. It's a bit pricey at $12, but it's worth it. Me and my coworkers are obsessed with them. I also love their classic margarita.
author: Jackie Lou B.

description:
I came to Bullitt with a few friends tonight and felt super inclined to compliment the place. The bartender Tommy was incredibly attentive and sweet- went out of his way to make sure me and my homies had everything we needed and more. 

The music was super on point and the vibe was everything we needed for a casual Monday. 

100% will be back!
author: Margaret S.

description:
I had Bullitt delivered, and what followed was so bad it was almost comical. I was going to order Chinese, but i thought bullitt had some creative-sounding dishes worth a shot. Creative-sounding. I thought it meant they were doing some interesting flavor experimentation, but in hindsight it was more like a bunch of high school kids got way too high and tried to think of things that would taste good together. Spoiler alert: they didn't. 

Anyway, I went with the chicken tenders, got the chicken burrito, a buffalo slider, and ordered sweet potato waffle fries, too. 

Have you ever order chicken tenders at a snack bar at a kids little league game? Well, they're better than what I got from Bullitt. They were tough, they lacked flavor, and ... look, I don't have the most sophisticated palate in the world -- I ordered chicken tenders, after all, so for me to review such a simple food so negatively should tip you off to the quality. 

The fries were somehow stale and chewy. 

The burrito had French fries in it, and it was incredibly dry. It tasted like someone wrapped a baked potato in a tortilla and then threw a little pico de gallo on top. 

The slider was ok. It was the only thing we finished. But that was only because it was drenched in buffalo sauce and only because we were hungry. 

I hate to give one star, but this sh*^ was so bad I feel it is my civic duty to do this. Sorry.
author: Michael G.

description:
It's one of my favorite bars in the city. I like the people, drinks and food. Fun during game days and weekends. Love their happy hour!! 

Tuesdays - $1 Tacos
Wednesday - 25 cent Wings
Thursday - $5 dollars Tachos.
author: Sandy B.

description:
This review is for strictly the bottomless Mimosa brunch.

In short, it was everything you want in a bottomless Mimosa brunch. I had the chicken and waffles and my husband had the breakfast burrito. The chicken was a fillet fried chicken-parm style... but delicious never-the-less and complimented by thick waffles.
The portions were plentiful and the Mimosa's were indeed bottomless - the server would top our Mimosa glasses off before we saw the bottom. Service was also fast and friendly. 

Granted, this 5 star review might be due to the Mimosa's, but you should definitely go and try it yourself.
author: Yvette M.

description: I had a fantastic time here! Memo and Jaret were amazing servers/bartenders. Great atmosphere, great music, great food
author: Sara D.

description:
Found this spot thanks to Groupon!! If it's still going (and even it's not!!) DO. IT!!

We loved our bartender/server Esther!! Although the food was amazing, it's the service that'll keep me coming back!! She definitely kicked our Sunday Funday off!! 

Thanks, Esther!! Can't wait to do this again!!
author: Sara D.

description: Came here for wing Wednesday and it was great!  They have a good amount of flavors and it's a good atmosphere to come out with your friends and enjoy the wings.  Pro tip: get here early on a Wednesday to get a table, or have one friend stand at one end and another stand near the door to get twice the coverage!
author: Maurice O.

description: This place is seriously the absolute best! I highly recommend the classic eggs Benedict. Not only was our waiter super hot but he was also really nice. He let us try all kinds of samples. I haven't had Jell-O shots since college so having that selection was great. Even though the place was really loud and busy all the staff was really attentive to us. I know I'll be back soon!
author: Alison J.

description: We came here for an after work nightcap, met Melissa who is my female bartender unicorn. She has turned me on to another bar which I will review after. It was nice meeting and drinking from someone who knows their stuff as well as can balance the knowledge a bartender should give about purveying there area of work.
author: M U.

description:
We got here around 7pm on wed night and found a seat around 30min later. 

Pros: 25 cent wings every wed night
Cons: having to wait and strategize to get a seat in a bar crowded with hungry people.  (But it was worth the wait) 

Wings were delish I tried all 4 of their flavor and they all had a good unique flavor.  I also tried their Carolina reaper wings and they are hot.  Took me about 15 min to eat just 2.
author: Dan O.

description:
My friend and I came in on Mother's Day around brunch time and it was surprisingly not as crowded as I expected it to be! I found this spot thanks to Groupon, which turned out to be well worth it. We got there at 11am and all the tables were taken so we just sat at the bar, which we didn't mind since there were cute bartenders that were going to be refilling our mimosas periodically :') It started getting quite crowded around 1pm, but I'm not sure if they take reservations or not. There was just street parking but it's on Polk which has a lot of other restaurants too so it would've been hard to find parking. 

SETTING: It was nice for my friend and I to kick back and enjoy the Giant's game. It definitely had a warm and inviting vibe to it. The ceilings are quite high so it didn't get too loud despite the amount of people that were there. There aren't too many tables and I think it would've been hard to accommodate a big group here. The atmosphere is great, I'd come back just to chill. There's a full bar and bar seating as well as tables around it. There's also many TVs surrounding the exterior of the room. Also, the restaurant has free wifi! 

SERVICE: The bartender that served us was so friendly and kind, I wish I got his name because he was cute :^) It was my friend and I's first time trying out bottomless mimosas and they made it an enjoyable experience. We had to wait a few times for our mimosas to be refilled and even when we finished our food, they told us we were welcome to stay and watch the game while we sipped on mimosas. I also had to remind our bartender that our groupon came with two shots of fireball, which he apologized about forgetting about and served that up right away. 

FOOD: 
- My friend and I wanted to try something sweet and savory so we decided on the Classic Eggs Benedict ($9.50) and the French Toast Sticks. The eggs Benedict came with two poached eggs on an English muffin, Canadian bacon and hollandaise sauce, and we chose tater tots as a side. I would've liked the yolk to be a little more runny because it didn't have my desired egg porn shot :'( Other than that, it was pretty solid! 
- The french toast sticks came with 4 large sticks of challah bread had a cinnamon sugar coating. It also came with whipped cream, a berry compote, and maple syrup so that you could dip your french toast sticks in them! We split the two plates and they were very filling. 

The Groupon that I bought was $27 thanks to the honey app (it originally would have been $40) for two entrees, two shots of fireball, and bottomless mimosas! Keep in mind that the Groupon doesn't come without tax and tip, which my friend and I added $30 for those alone for the good service.
author: Anne P.

description:
Got chicken and waffles with bottomless mimosas. Very yummy!

Younger crowd, small intimate space
author: Rommel G.

description: Atmosphere was really good but the prices of this place is ridiculously high and their food doesn't match the prices at all. I was disappointed.
author: Garima K.

description:
Decided to come back for Taco Tuesday and good thing I did because it was perfection. $1 tacos ALL NIGHT and 2-for-1 margs! 

My friend and I each got FOUR tacos. That's right. They are tiny! So if you are going for dinner and get anything less than four, i might judge you. There is an option for chicken, beef, veggie, and fish. Didn't try the veggie but got one chicken, one fish, and 2 beef. They were delicious! They each come with a bunch of goodies on them (including sour cream and guac which is always a necessity for me). Not sure if they change weekly since this was my first time but they were really yummy. We also each got a double marg and chips and guac/salsa. 

Our server rocked! not sure her name but she was super friendly, helpful, attentive, and cool. Love the low key vibe here (she was wearing a bart simpson shirt). I was actually pretty surprised this bar wasn't more crowded considering the unreal taco deals. I would highly recommend this place for taco tuesday, especially if you're looking for somewhere where you can actually sit down (vs Nicks nearby where it is pretty much standing room only). 

Will definitely be back!
author: Ilana B.

description: 2 of us used a Groupon on a Sat afternoon. We were excited to try this place. Unfortunately our server mixed up the orders on three different sets of customers. We were seated (after a 30 min wait) at a common (group) table with several other customers right by the front window. The server told me to eat the wrong item since it was already delivered to my table. I didn't order the Chicken n Waffles! I ordered an item based on HER recommendation. She attempted to move the incorrect plate to the proper customer but I told her not to serve it to someone else since it already sat on the table untouched for several minutes. Food looked good but I wouldn't know the taste since I didn't get to eat what I ordered. I'll work with Groupon for a refund. We won't be back to Bullitt and neither will anyone I know.
author: Matthew B.

description: Good place for watching warriors and good for weekend brunch!!!! Had amazing time with friends and met new friends there too!  We used Groupon for the Sunday brunch !!it is a good deal!!!
author: Roxy T.

description: You can't go wrong with a place that serves tachos! This place definitely attracts a younger, more rowdy crowd, so don't come for a quiet evening out. Bullit is a Polk staple and always a great stop any night out. Bartenders are friendly and they always have solid music playing. Great place to check out for wing Wednesday as well!
author: Lacey L.

description: Only got   because of customer service.  The food was horrible... Drink was pretty cool... Will not be eating here again.
author: Pierre K.

description:
The atmosphere is terrific, food quite tasty and Esther the bartender... ON POINT!

We Groupon'd, we ate, we CHILLED and vow to be back!

Definitely a fav brunch spot even with the mass crowds!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Of course I'm going to talk about wings and beer, what else is there to talk about!?!? Get them hot, BBQ or wasabi. Actually, get them all! Order them not all at once so your order is hot. Scarf them down and then re-order. Calories don't count if the meat falls off the bone!
author: Megan N.

description:
Was charged the wrong price, chastised by the owner for calling him out on it. He has poor choice in insults, told me I was a nerd for asking for my $11 back.  If you're in the mood to subsidize this guy's unaccredited comedy school you should go here. 

Xoxo
Your favorite nerd
author: Robert B.

description:
Found this brunch place by Groupon & totally loved the atmosphere
Food is great too.
I will def be coming back here
author: Tania M.

description: This place is a sham. The owner has prices on the menu that low, and then the real charge on the check is higher than what it says on the menu. Also, he is a dickhead and some asshole puked on his floor and he didn't even clean it up. Don't go to this place ever.
author: John Reid P.

description:
I bought a Groupon that included two brunch entrees, two shots of Fireballs, and bottomless mimosas + $8 in tax + tips = AWESOME EXPERIENCE!

Note that the Groupon is only valid weekends from 10 am - 2 pm.

Also, be aware of the long list. We waited about 20 minutes.

ATMOSPHERE:
I loved the atmosphere here! As soon as we entered, they were pumping great music. They played mainstream pop, hip-hop, rap music just in case you were wondering.

FOOD & DRINKS:
I ordered a breakfast burrito which I devoured almost instantly when it came out. I also got my burrito with potatoes which was flavorful!

Honestly, I never the bottom of my glass because the bartender kept refilling my mimosa! It was great and I was drunk by the end of our brunch.

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Our bartender was on point and he was friendly.

I definitely would come back here again!
author: Aj C.

description:
Found this place through Groupon and totally love it!
Good and atmosphere are great!
Definitely coming back here for brunch.
author: Nichole L.

description: We had an awesome Groupon - brunch and bottomless mimosas for $20 which is a steal especially in this city. Food was overall pretty good, but it felt more like a sports bar than a brunch spot. Music was pretty loud and intense for a Saturday afternoon. But it's probably a good place for a night drink. Overall a good deal.
author: Sara A.

description:
Bottomless mimosas.
No lines.
Optional breezy seats outside or by an open window inside.
Meaty options to feed the beast.

All brunch boxes checked.
author: Amy J.

description: Delicious burgers (with tater tots!) and great staff!  I couldn't resist the 2 for 1 margaritas on a Tuesday... oops :)
author: Danielle B.

description:
Dogs in food establishments. I was at bullit and someone brought their dog. Not a service animal because the dog wandered around freely. I saw the dog go into the kitchen and be petted by the cook! Totally disgusting.
Let's see how the health department views the photo I took of the dog in the kitchen.
author: joe r.

description:
Came here last night and they had well priced drinks, 2 for 1 margaritas and tacos were $1 for  Taco Tuesday and they were delicious.
Our waitress, Ariel, was super nice and attentive and they played a good mix of throwback music (ex. Gin and Juice, Roses by Outkast). Will definitely be returning in the future!
author: Kris T.

description: Good brunch spot. I ordered the grilled cheese with over medium egg inside, with tomato soup and salad on the side. I don't know how they make this sandwich so good... it's daydream worthy! Also, bottomless mimosas are yummy and free flowing.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Bullitt is a delightfully trashy, sporty dive bar that my girlfriends and I typically try to avoid.  But, for some unknown, magical reason we come back and have seriously fun times here!  

Now, I would certainly consider this a dive bar, but perhaps since it's located in Russian Hill the place isn't creepy or unsafe.  The crowd gets a little "bridge and tunnel" on weekends, but overall the crowd is fun.  The bartenders are helpful and my friends never have a shortage of drinks!  Heck, my crazy girlfriends even got the cooperative bartender to whip up pickleback shots (whiskey and pickle juice!)  After the shots we had a fun dance party to the rad 90's hits playing on the stereo and the bartenders tossed napkins on us like confetti!  Woohoo!  Way to get the party started, Bullitt!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Came here to get boozy brunch with a friend! We were able to use the group on deal that we bought. We got there early to beat the line, but it never ended up getting super full though it was a saturday.

They don't take reservations so it is first come, first serve.

They were slow on service, especially refilling the bottomless mimosas, but the food was delicious and the music was great! A mix of late 90's early 00's pop. My friend and I were having a blast just listening and goofing to the music. I got the breakfast platter and couldn't even finish since the helping was so large!

Really enjoyed my time here and would definitely come back.
author: Bori B.

description: Cool vibe. Good food. Legit music. Their awesome barback recommended the froze  5 stars for their guy Gore
author: Gloria Z.

description: This place is sick. The owner has prices that are accurate. Also, he is a sweetheart and some asshole puked on the ground and he cleaned it up.  Go to this place ASAP!
author: Cody T.

description:
Came here for brunch to use the Groupon deal for 2 people and bottomless mimosas. Great deal, but not exactly impressive, and the food was only mediocre. 

I'd revisit this place maybe at night instead. It's a bar vibe, trying to be a brunch spot, and it's not quite fitting. 

At least they play good music. Service was decent. 

However, be warned that there is a $44 "puke" fee.
author: Lizzie L.

description:
downgraded to another sh** polk st bar. cocktails super overpriced and small, food is awful. 

bf and i thought we'd be funny and get the burger that uses grilled cheese sandwiches as buns... what came out was a lukewarm pile of mostly bread and one sad burger patty. there was no sauce or fixings provided to dress the dry yet greasy burger. 

i had a beer but my friend ordered a cocktail made with vodka/lemonade/strawberry puree. the cocktail was as much as our burger, small, and lacking in both vodka and strawberry puree. 

service is fairly prompt but lacking in effort and personality
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
Brunch is always a good way to start your day and Bullitt hit the spot. I was looking for a brunch that had endless mimosas and was recommended to come here. 

It had an energetic vibe with EDM music playing, it's typically a bar a night but is also open for brunch. We sat at one of the last open tables and were glad to not have to wait. Our server came over after a few minutes and let us know of a current groupon promotion they had, so of course we purchased it! I was thankful that she let us know about it! She brought us back mimosas right away and kept filling them throughout brunch, my glass was never empty. 

The menu had traditional and American cuisine entrees to chose from. I ordered the fried chicken and waffles, which were good but not amazing. The chicken seemed to be friend in panko crumbs and just taken out of a freezer. When you added it to a fresh waffle with syrup it hit the spot. I was full at the end of brunch and definitely had my share of mimosas. 

The brunch was decent if you are looking for something to eat with mimosas. The servers were friendly and I would recommend it for a casual brunch.
author: Christine A.

description: While my food was decent, I've never had worse service. I waited for almost two hours for this sub par establishment. The bottomless mimosas ended at three ,  and even though we were not sat for almost two hours (after claiming we had two hours to drink) decided to cut us off. I drank three mimosas for their bottomless price. Honestly this is the worst place ever. I will never go back. They comped the tax but decided we didn't get all of the Groupon deal. Don't get their Groupon deal unless you want to deal with a bunch of terrible attitude bartenders and waitresses (especially the waitress named Tymani).
author: Alexis S.

description: Food was not good not sure about the drinks but the paninis were cold and the fries were not impressive. Would not recommend or eat there again
author: Aida D.

description:
Oh Bullit, your totchos are too much! No literally. Plus the deafening bro-chatter during packed nights/weekends are just impossible but with $5 Mondays, all is well with the world again in Russian Hill. 

Who can resist fried spuds that is then doused with melted cheese right? The totchos from the tater tot bar are fine but they definitely get very repetitive fast. I split it with just one other friend so definitely recommend sharing this with a larger group. In the end, think I would have much preferred the taters on their own. It feels like there's a big store-bought component to the dish which perhaps suggests why it's so heavy. On the flip side, I've been by late during $5 Monday and had The Ranger fried chicken sandwich and I was honestly quite impressed. That is one well-balanced and thought out sandwich. I mean fried chicken, applewood bacon, and cheddar? The avocado and sprouts were a nice touch to lighten up the sandwich. 

 Service is typically good although it can get spotty when it's packed. If all you want is some comfort bar grub, Bullit is your place. Lots of specials during the week like $0.25 wing Wednesday bring in crowds, but is manageable later in the evening. Bullit might not be my bar but with a kitchen that closes past midnight, it can easily become a dependable late night, post-drinking, spot to grab some nosh.
author: Jon L.

description:
We did a fundraiser here for our Cycle for Survival team. We put a couple of our teammates behind the bar for a few hours, gathered our friends, and held a raffle for some fun prizes. At the end of the night, we raised a ton of money in tips and raffle ticket sales that all went to rare cancer research at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.

Our team had a blast and I cannot thank the guys at Bullitt enough for all their help and support!

It's a fun atmosphere and their bar food is pretty good, too!
author: Leana L.

description:
the totchos. are amazing. cheesy and hearty, with a healthy dollop of guac! SO YUM! i could eat a whole plate..

came here for taco tuesday and was amaze! 2 for 1 margaritas and $1 tacos - also got wings (yummmy!) and the service was super friendly. i havent been to bullit in YEARS but need to start frequenting apparently!
author: Christina L.

description:
Bullitt isn't trying to be anything it is not. First, they have tons of TVs. This is a prime spot for sports but can get crowded so come early for big games. Second, they have tachos. Um what is that?? Heaven. Tatertots + nachos...I know just stop reading this and go now. Thursday's are tacho Thursday sooo if you cheap go then for 5 dollars. Wednesday is Wing Wednesday so do that too. Tuesday is Taco Tuesday. Probably should have done the week in order but we got there. Third, it's a bar so obviously drinks are good and a thing they have. 

Fourth, TALLY is the absolute best waitress. She is super friendly even though it is always a mad house. She makes you feel so welcomed. She is just awesome and I hope if you go she serves you. Yes the fourth needed to be separated to prove the point. 

Okay, see you there!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Here for the brunch and the bottomless mimosas. So good!! It's a great upbeat atmosphere to start the day and the drinks are great. Food comes in delicious and generous portions. As a morning person this is the perfect hangout spot for a weekend brunch time!
author: Katie D.

description: Wing Wednesday is amazing but it gets packed FAST!! Dont try the spicy wing challenge UNLESS youre ready!! Overall experience is phenomenal!!! Highly recommend.
author: Victoria M.

description: You can't go wrong with totchos! It was a 1/3 to 1/4 full on a friday night which made getting a table easy. Split the burger and chicken sandwich with a friend. Not happy the cocktails are $13 but it was good. It was kentucky mule on tap. The beers on tap were a fine selection. I'm a fan, it can be fun at night and just has solid food. The fact that the bartender is a Dodgers fan is kind of lame though haha.
author: Marty J.

description: Worst customer experience ever! We were told our wait was going to be 45 minutes and we ended up waiting over an hour and a half! To make matters worse, they gave our table away to another party because they had 1 more person then we did so they wanted to accommodate that group first. Our server Tymani had the worst attitude! She was a total b*tch and was rude to us the whole time. The food was okay but again, their customer service sucks!
author: JayJay A.

description: Calm place during the day. Gets busier as the night goes on. Great food choices, music and prices. The Bartenders are very friendly
author: Rasheed M.

description:
Very fun vibe and cool spot in Russian Hill. Polk Street and Vallejo/Larkin location. A lot of fun places to go and I liked the atmosphere inside. Super small and cramped however. And do not order champagne. It was a "brut" apparently, but it was super gaggy sweet and wayyyyy wayyyy flat. It was my birthday and I was looking to celebrate with a glass of champagne. I was very disappointed in the selection there. 

That being said, even though the moscow mule was served from a tap, it had really great flavors and my husband enjoyed it. 

Service was good, and even thought we didn't order any food, due to heading to dinner around the corner elsewhere, we were eying the food being brought out to the other guests and it looked and smelled GREAT. 

Probably would stop by for another visit if ever in the area again.
author: Tanya C.

description: Such a wonderful experience for Sunday brunch we were able to use our Groupons with endless mimosas the food was great I ordered the nachos we didn't have to flag or hunt our server down for more drinks they work consisted attentive to her needs our drinks were automatically refilled and the music was great the seating was great the service was great I look forward to going back I highly recommend them
author: Tee A.

description:
Bullitt has been on my radar for quite awhile and finally checked it out recently.  Nestled among the rows and rows of bars in the Polk-Gulch area, Bullitt is a true gem.  The bar from the outside looks like it might be a bit of a dive, but if you walk in it is clean and cozy.  The bar takes up just about one wall of the place and then some little high tops surround the other wall.  Great for groups, date night, or catching up with friends. 

My fiance and I grabbed two seats at a fairly empty bar on a weekend and were immediately greeted by the friendly bartender.  Good selection of house cocktails and beers at reasonable prices for the area. (bottle beers are $5, drafts are $6.50 and cocktails ~$11 +).  We both went for the "El Ron" a spicy twist on a margarita with tequila, Serrano Chilies and fresh grapefruit. A nice wake you up cocktail with a good kick from the chilies.  For food we shared the Tofu Banh-Mi with housecut fries.  The fries were the standout of this dish, crispy, lightly salted and a masssssive portion.  The Banh-Mi was just meh. I thought the whole sandwich was just... soft. I usually like the Banh-mi from local sandwich shops with the crispy bread so soak up all the goodness, but this was was on a super soft roll and combined with the kinda mushy tofu it was just a bit of a miss. But, overall decent flavors I am just not sure if that would be my pick next time. The real hi-light on the menu appeared to be the 'totchos' (which are only $5 on Thursday all night). 

In all, a great experience at Bullitt.  Friendly and attentive bartender, good selection of drinks and a nice price for the area.  I will be back to dabble in some tater tots and more delicious cocktails.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Came with a friend a while back on a lonely Thursday night. Couple of other people in the bar but not much.

The drinks here are cool and their moscow mules are really good. Also liked their adios drink, wings and fries me and my friend ordered were really good and fresh. 

I'd come back.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
You can't beat Wings Wednesdays!  You can sauce it up in different flavors.  I thought that their wings were good and you can't beat the deal of 25 cents!

As it came closer to peak hours, a buildup of a crowd eventually situated and I couldn't hear myself.  I felt like I needed to shout or stretch my lungs!  Their ceilings are not high enough for the volume to holdup and it is too small of a bar to accommodate a big crew!  Well, it wasn't pleasant.

Besides the ambiance, their wings were good and they had adequate staffing.  

It just took an extra effort to hear myself speaking and hear others talking out loud!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Alright, I hit my Rhianna quota for 2014.  Top 40 was bah-lasting which had the potential to drive me to claw my own face off but the bartenders were quick to change the station before that happened. (Tater Tots would fly if that Swift chick came on)  There is a great upbeat vibe here and the staff look like they are happy to be here.  Dancing behind the bar, singing, pretty fun stuff.  

There is a perfect bar food menu.  We ordered 8 Cheese Burger Sliders, Classic Mac & Cheese, and Sweet Potato Tater Tots.  From the point of order until it was on the table must have been no more than 5 minutes.  Love that!   

Usually cheap food is synonymous with mediocre but not here.  Sliders were medium rare, salted, and topped with sharp cheddar.  That is really all you need for a great tasting burger.  The Mac & Cheese was fantastic and the best I have had in a while.  The mini mountain of Sweet Potato Tater Tots were a nice addition to our other two items.

Cheap and fast food, good music, and drinks are the kind of stuff that rock socks!
author: Melissa R.

description: Searched for a brunch place near my home and this place came up as the best brunch in SF.  It did not disappoint.  I ordered the lumberjack and with all breakfast I always take a little taste of the eggs first to see how much salt I need.  None was needed.  These were seasoned perfectly.  Also had the bottomless mimosas.  Most places I've been to you have to flag some one down for a refill, but here we didn't have to.  Most of the time they were refilled before we even finished.  While we were there, I noticed all the tables around us had a shot with their bottomless mimosas, when asked, the waitress said it was from a groupon deal they were having.  She then brought us a shot on her.  Everyone was friendly and service was top notch. Now I'm thinking about going back tonight to see how their dinner is.
author: Victor E.

description: Great bar, great wings and great staff.  Mind the transplant techie workers that try to poach your group table while waiting for your other friends to show up #beatit
author: Geno B.

description: Divey! Bad Service. Mediocre food and cocktails. They must get by 'cause of the game day crowd or inebriated patrons but...
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Met some friends from out of town in Russian Hill. Stopped at the place to grab some food and I am super glad we stopped here. We ordered the chipotle steak lettuce cups. They were really great. Also ordered the tochos, they were really good as well
author: Jen H.

description:
like many others, i bought a groupon that was all inclusive of entrees, a shot of fireball, and bottomless mimosas for two people. all i had to do at the end was pay for tax which was about $8. came in on a sunday and the wait was about an hour, so we ended up putting our names down and left to kill time.

food is mediocre. the grilled cheese and tomato soup entree was probably one of their better entrees. i got a benedict and it was meh. the table next to ours barely even touched their food. however, their tatchos are pretty amazing so even though it's not part of the brunch entree options, it's worth paying extra and trying if you want some decent food in your belly to soak up the alcohol!

idk if i would come back for brunch without the groupon deal - but overall not too shabby!
author: Ava F.

description: Bottomless mimosas and an amazingly friendly staff! Great way to spend "Sunday Funday" with your significant other or with a group. My boyfriend and I just went here and one of the girls had asked us about their AMAZING Groupon: 2 shots of Fireball, 2 bottomless mimosas, AND 2 entrees, all for $35! Definitely, can't wait to come back!
author: Kasandra S.

description: We live in the neighborhood and frequent Bullitt often. The staff here are so amazing and always friendly and welcoming. Drinks and food are always amazing as well. Special shout out to MATT who brings the thunder and helped us invent a brand new holiday cocktail today. He's just amazing and works there every Saturday - don't miss out.
author: Stefanie B.

description: Great food, great atmosphere (young, hip, but not trendy), excellent staff. Our waitress...black hair and tattoos was awesome. My co-worker and I found this place through Yelp. We were in San Fran briefly and wanted to find a chill place with comfort food. We definitely hit the nail on the head here. I highly recommend it. The only downside is, I was the oldest person there by about 15 years. Haha. Reminder to my waitress: Don't forget to check out Sound of Silence by Disturbed.  :-)
author: Dennis H.

description: Found this spot on Groupon. Excellent service and food. Bottomless Mimosas are awesome.
author: Cassy J.

description:
I am in LOVE with this place!

Came here tonight with a few friends to grab some food & drinks & let me start off by saying that this place was super packed by the time I had gotten there (9:45pm) there was only standing room, luckily my friends came earlier than me & got a small table in the back. 

I ordered their vodka gimlet & it was super strong but I loved it, especially after a long day! I also ordered their bar grilled cheese sandwich with bacon & tomatoes ($8.95) & instead of mixed greens (which is included) I asked for tots instead, oh & there is a small bowl of tomato soup that came with the order.

The sandwich was sooo good! The bread was nice & crunchy with some softness still added to it, the bacon slices were thick, which I loved & there was just the perfect amount of cheese & tomato. The soup that came along was delicious as well! Perfect for dipping the grilled cheese into it.

As for the tots that I asked for instead of the mixed green was like almost every other tots I have had except they tasted less greasy & I couldn't stop eating them! I also didn't feel like crap after eating them as well & trust me I ATE the hell out of them haha. They also are very generous when giving you tots too, which I love!

After a certain time the bar/restaurant turns into like a mini dive, they move the tables out of the way so there's more standing room.

Overall I give this place 5 stars. Definitely coming back! Oh & our server was super attentive & kept coming back to see if we needed anything else, yay!
author: Phoebe T.

description:
When I walked in, I had NO IDEA how much I would love this place. It looks like a bar, but they have a big menu selection, which was great because I was starving. A bartender at a place nearby actually recommended Bullit to me and my out-of-town friends because he saw I was ready to pass out. 

I ordered a beer, a chicken with bacon sandwich, and beer battered pickles. I had only tried battered pickles about a month before while in Boston, and was not impressed. I LOVE pickles, so I was pleasantly surprised at how incredible these were. Please, try them. I'm not joking...

Our server was very attentive and made sure that we had drinks the whole time. The food came out quickly as well. It was a great place to chill after driving around the insane San Francisco streets. I would definitely come back.
author: Karen G.

description:
Great environment for a younger crowd (21-30). Fun, friendly servers, sports on seven TVs, and loud, modern music. 

Pretty simple bar setup with slightly more than just the basics as far as drinks go (they didn't carry a wide variety of brands). They had a pretty interesting seasonal wheat beer brewed with watermelon. The beer itself was light with a subtle taste of watermelon - not something I would buy a six pack of but definitely something casual to try. 

They had much better food than I was expecting for a bar. Awesome chicken nachos, with great ingredients and lots of them. I suggest the truffle tater tots if you're looking for an easy, shareable appetizer. They also had totchos (nachos with tater tots) that sounded very intriguing, but we weren't quite adventurous enough to try them that day.
author: Erin E.

description:
Came here with a group of 10, all of which were using the Groupon offer. The staff were super accommodating and made sure that we had everything we needed, even with such an overwhelming group! Dennis at the door let us start our bottomless mimosas before our table was ready and before the rest of our party got there (thanks!) and Thai made sure that we were never on empty once we sat down.

For sure coming back to this place! Great service & great music (food was sort of lacking, but our main goal was to enjoy our bottomless deal - and we definitely did!!)
author: Ashley R.

description: Somewhere read a recent review by someone else which said, the food and table service was slow but the food was excellent. It was quite busy and crowded very cozy but loud. Was pleasantly greeted by one of the friendly bartenders whom we asked about putting our names down for a table for two which was no longer than 10 mins wait for a table to open up for us. All the food had arrived at our table shortly after placing the order with the wait staff. Well, the food was very mediocre at best. The portions were small and the waffle was so dry and solid hard that it didn't taste anything like a waffle so wasn't sure what they had done with the waffle if it was precooked and sitting around or what were the ingredients use to make the waffle batter very disappointing.
author: J H.

description: I usually LOVE this bar, but tonight the bathroom was neglected. I had to complain TWICE about the cleanliness of the bathroom and I felt bad for doing so because I love this bar. This is absurd for a bathroom to be in this condition within 2 complaints at 1.5 hours apart.
author: Lucie S.

description: Bartender was really rude told me to "shut up" when I asked for a drink...definitely don't go here
author: Francesca C.

description:
Had the totchos - they were good and different!!
I'm not sure if it was a grand opening or what but a lot of random people kept going behind the bar. The menu is simple 
It was busy! 
Cute place and plays sports!
author: Danielle B.

description:
Came here with three friends for brunch last Saturday. I've been to Bullit many times for drinks and dinner but this was the first brunch. The mimosa's were great and the vibe was fun, but our waitress had the absolute worst attitude. 

Two of our entrees came out completely wrong (she denied this, yet there were ingredients in both that made no culinary sense and weren't described on the menu). The other two meals were fine but not great. However, her overall annoyed, "I don't want to be here"  attitude made our whole table hesitant to ask for anything we needed: water, ketchup, napkins, etc.

Word to the wise: If you're looking to go to Bullit, lower your expectations, or throw caution to the wind and get used to "bugging" your waitress for your most basic dining needs.
author: Brittany B.

description:
$25 cent wings Wednesday...enough said!

I can't speak to how the rest of the nights are but I recommend coming here for their wing Wednesday specials and drinks. My friend and I ordered about 90 wings between 6 of us; the flavors included buffalo, original, and chili lime. The wings were pretty good and hit the spot. Ordering 90 wings though...probably a little excessive but much needed for a mid-week pick me up. Also ordered the totchos (tater tots + nacho toppings)...soooooooo good!
author: Jeff T.

description:
$5 totcho Thursdays all night long. 
25 cent wing Wednesdays all night long. 

I live in the neighborhood and come here frequently. I came here last Thursday night with some friends from high school. We were here from about 12 - 2 am. Keep in mind, we're all natives and graduated from Galileo (about 5 blocks down Polk). We thrive off hip hop feels especially bay hyphy ish. We requested if they could play some e-40 and yung joc. Bartender played the slaps. Bouncer knew how to get. it. 

All in all, a great Thursday night and my group of friends will def be back :)
author: Kayla O.

description: Meh, this bar gets the job done. I'd probably enjoy it a bit more if I were 5 - 10 years younger since it's typically a fairly young crowd. The drinks are fine but more expensive than dive bar prices for a divey-ish bar. They offer some "fun" foods like tatchos (tater tots covered in nacho goodness) but so do a lot of other bars in SF (mostly those that are owned by the same owners as Bullitt). If I'm out on this part of Polk Street and someone insists on Bullitt, I won't refuse to go in though I'd likely choose somewhere else if it were up to me!
author: Meghan P.

description: We came on a Wednesday for their special wings detail. The night was great until they decided they could take advantage of our inebriation. Don't charge full price for a drink that you pour lightly. Treat your patrons with respect.
author: Trent D.

description: The drinks are fine but periodically throwing napkins in the air is ridiculous for a couple of reasons. 1.) incredibly wasteful and unsustainable 2.) having napkins all over your shoes is not at all cute 3.) the horrible attitude of the manager. She was the one throwing them, and was incredibly rude to me. Her reaction was to throw more napkins in the air. I'm not sure what the benefit of throwing napkins in the air is, but I won't be coming back to find out.
author: Margot K.

description:
This place is pretty fun to go to and M-F they have a different special each day including their happy hour 4-6pm. 
I always come here for the tatchoes. Tater tot nachos. You heard that right. They're absolutely delicious. Honestly anything on their menu is pretty on point when it comes to the food. 
And whiskey on tap? Hell yeah. The only downfall of the area is it is a major pain to find any parking.
author: Joy S.

description:
Came into the city for and early-birthday Sunday brunch with my girlfriends. One of the ladies lives in the city and says this is a great spot to just chill out with friends, eat and drink for hours.  She was 100% correct.

Started out with the Bottomless Mimosas served by one of the nicest waitresses I've dealt with in years! We shared the "Totchos"- because Tater Tot Nachos, yes please!  Then we each got a breakfast plate. I was several mimosas in, so don't recall what my friends got, but I got the Benedict and enjoyed it.

As my friend predicted, we hung out for hours just drinking and chatting. Mimosas turned into a few shots, and we had a really great time here. If I'm meeting friends for a fun brunch in the city, I'll be back without a doubt.  Thanks Bullitt for a fun day!
author: Danae K.

description:
I have come here a few times for drinks and snacks with a bunch of friends. On Mondays, this place does $5 everything. Literally, everything. All food & drinks (top shelf, too). It makes sense because who really goes out on a Monday?! 

I had their truffle Mac and cheese (yummy and oh so great for my non-existent diet lol). My friend had their truffle tater tots- also really good- and their chicken wings (he loved them). I've had their grilled cheese before, which was delish. I wish they had more seafood options, especially for their salads and sandwiches. 

Service was good. Crowd was good. Loved how they had sports playing on many TV's. Also, I found parking right out front - amazing! I'll definitely be back!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Looking for a place that offers zero SF uniqueness with its fair share of generic "stamped out formula" of loud hip-hop, groove music with flat panel TVs showing what ever the bartenders like to watch, this is your place!

Here's a little contest:

Count the number of guys who wear their baseball hat backwards and baggy pants and the number of girls with sunglasses and attitude.

Like I said, no San Francisco originality!
author: Seth G.

description:
Stopped by here for a Friday night farewell. It is very much a sports bar and gets extremely crowded later in the night. 
Standard drinks and really pushing to get service but then again, my expectations weren't too high for this place. 
They take away tables and high top chairs later in the night too to make space for more patrons.
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
25 cent Wing Wednesdays, all night. A well known deal at their sister bar "Dr Teeth & the Electric Mayhem" yet while recently visiting I noticed a lot of people weren't here for it. Mostly neighborhood bros & people out to drink.

Bullitt is part of the The Tonic Group's multitude of restaurants throughout the city that offer themed bars with great happy hours and daily specials. You can find Wing Wednesdays at Bullitt, Lightning, and Dr Teeth. For a way smaller bar with an attached kitchen, I was surprised to find it less crowded compared to Dr Teeth which is usually overfilled with people eager for wings, this could just be the difference in crowds found at Russian Hill vs the Mission.

Either way, The Tonic Group has a consistent menu that spans their various bars with great bar centric food & cocktails. Bullitt is a bit different from the others since it lacks the themed decor and feels more like an upscale bar, but I'm a fan of smaller bars to begin with so it's cool with me.
author: Steven C.

description:
From morning to night I love Bullit and its entirety. 

Let's start out with breakfast...Chicken and Waffles, need i say more? That's right, big juicy fried chicken tenders on top of a savory fluffy waffle with syrup, fruit and a side of tots all for $8.95. Add bottomless or a spicy bloody mary and you've got yourself the real deal. If you aren't the chicken and waffle type then go for the tomato soup and breakfast grilled cheese- surely not to disappoint. 

Happy hour here is nice too, I find that it's usually most crowded in the morning or at night, but come here on a Thursday after work and you're good to go. I really like the cucumber jalapeno margarita- but they have a variety of different drinks as well. 

Come here at night and it is just as fun as it is all other hours of the day- just add dancing. They move the tables out of the way and everyone is dancing away and having a good time. 

A plus Bullit.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Sorry, but I'm never going here for brunch again. 

In all fairness, we received a groupon for an awesome brunch deal and it felt like it was packed with everyone who bought the voucher. 
The food was mediocre and three out of six meals were incorrect. Our waitress was super sweet, but we asked for glasses of water three times and the bus boy took our bucket of silverware before our meal arrived. I think they were unprepared for the amount of people who showed up. 

I gave this place 2 stars, because I think this place has some potential in other times of the day. Hope they can work out the kinks before I visit again.
author: Sydney G.

description:
At first I was taken aback by the hour wait early on a Sunday Morning.  It actually ended up stretching to two full hours.  Luckily, we were able to put down a phone number and go about our errands.  

It turns out that the two hour wait is because the Groupon bottomless mimosas deal has a two hour max, and these guys really deliver value for the first two hours.  Often with Groupon you get second-tier service or hidden costs. These guys actually seemed happy to accommodate and made the whole experience fun and pleasant.

The place is definitely a scene.  It's odd seeing folks bumpin and grinding at 11:30 in the morning, but after 3 mimosas, you don't mind at all.  The vibe is energetic and easygoing.  Definitely a place worth checking out. Especially if you can get a deal.
author: Mikhail B.

description:
It's hard for me to give Bullitt 3 stars because Wing Wednesday at Bullitt gets 5 stars - 25 cent wings (buffalo & bbq) and totchos!! Love it!

The trouble with the place for me is the small space and weird set-up. If you don't get there early enough for Wing Wednesday, you're screwed. It's hard to get around if there's a full bar and tables.

On the weekends, I don't like how crowded and sweaty and stinky it is, and until my most recent visit, our servers were never very friendly, although the waitress we had last night, Caitlin, was great! She was super nice and thoughtful (brought extra napkins at the right time, checked in on us at perfect frequency, etc.)!

So 25 cent wings, totchos, and Caitlin give 5 stars, but overall Bullitt gets 3. I've heard brunch is good with bottomless mimosas, but I'll have to get back to you on that.
author: MaryKate M.

description:
This place is amazing! 

I am visiting from LA and had to trust that the reviews were honest. And I am super happy I came!

It looks like a chill dive bar on the inside but the food was AMAZING! The waitress made sure to continue pouring the bottomless mimosas to the last minute. The music and people were super friendly and great! I would recommend this place to anyone!!! 

The waitress was even nice enough to write down places to go and the bartender came to our table to show us how to get there!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Food was better than expected. Drinks were pricey (sparkling water at $4??).
Service was pretty awful.
author: Christine E.

description:
Always been coming here on Wednesdays because they have quarter wings Wednesday's specials, (yes, I am talking about $0.25 wings) and on the top of that they are incredibly delicious!!!

Also I tried their Tator tots "nachos" which I believe are called  Tachos...... pretty damn delicious. 

The crowd is always busy during night time but again, for great service and food, the wait to find your seat is worth it. 

And the best part is when you walk in and your bartender knows your drink. Thumbs up:)
author: Anna K.

description:
One word: AHHHMMMAAZZZZIIINNGGG 
soundtrack: check 
Bartenders: check 
Ambiance:check 
I love you bullitt
author: Adrianna P.

description:
This is the first time that I realized that bottomless mimosas can indeed have a bottom. We ordered two bottomless mimosas on Sunday, but they stop pouring at 3pm. A minor detail that was not mentioned to us. We got in a good bit before 3pm but that was the first time I saw an end to pouring. It was definitely a life lesson...Perhaps it was God telling us to stop drinking? It may or may not have been our 4th consecutive day...

Our server accidentally forgot to put in our order but luckily, we were distracted by our said mimosas. When it finally dawned on us that our food wasn't there yet (that moment probably happened when our mimosas ran out), our server was very apologetic and completely did not charge us for our meals. They get an extra star for this. It's so refreshing to see that customer service is not dead. AND she even threw in a beer. I wish businesses would realize that the psychology of one free shot or beer will have me coming back for more and more and I will probably spend double the money that I intended on just because I feel so warm and fuzzy inside. 

They have great tacos, amazing margaritas, and good service! My favorite dish was the scramble. Even though there is no meat, the flavor is such a perfect medley. You can always order a side of sausage or something. 

It is located in Russian Hill and the scene is pretty cool. The seating arrangements are great, especially if you are watching sports.
author: Leena B.

description:
Too crowded. Typical D-bag bar. Simply horrible. 

Some asshole who was provably broke took my drink out of my hand.

Not coming back.
author: JUSTINE M.

description:
Came with my bestie and her friends for some day time weekday drinking and lunch. Don't get me wrong, I'm all for raunchy dive bars (no judgement) however this place was just awkward. 

The have 4 beers on draft and were out of 2 of them! uhm ok.. The tatchos were fine (tator tots as nachos! What's not to love) I ordered the grilled cheese and  the ONE server/waiter/busgirl got it wrong. I get it, you have 3 jobs to do so I didn't complain but my plate was way too salty!!

After it died down the 3 in 1 server started checking her facebook page at the register computer,  which is fine if my group wasn't trying to leave!

Overall, skip this place if its a regular day time drinking day. But might be worth checking out for bottomless mimosas!
author: Veronica R.

description:
Stopped here to get a drink and appetizer before dinner reservations at stones throw. There were a lot of TVs with sports on so we stopped in thinking the Mariners v. A's game might be on (we are visiting from Seattle). Unfortunately it wasn't but there were other games and the place had a nice ambiance. 

Just ordered simple drinks but they were made well and quickly, our waitress was attentive but not overbearing. We ordered the chicken nachos and were very impressed. The usually chip to topping ratio leaves you with leftover chips, but these were the opposite. Ended up with a pile of nacho toppings and only a few chips left when all was said and done. The chicken was prepared well and flavorful, and overall they were very good. 

The only knock here was the bouncer very thoroughly looking my girlfriend up and down as he checked her ID and then telling us we were quite the cute "couple". I have a feeling he wasn't talking about me.
author: Troy C.

description:
Popped in the other day with my friend to have a couple of drinks and get caught up.

First impression: It's about 1 step up from dive bar status.

There's dust on the shelves, tears in the bench seating, napkins on the ground, napkins on the wall shelves......   I asked our waitress about them and she said the crowd gets animated on Friday and Saturday nights and they throw napkins in the air.  While I don't care that people do that, I do care that the owner/mgmt doesn't clean the place - especially considering you can see the napkins all over.

From the point of interior design, there is no design.  It's just a hodge-podge of nothing.  The lamp shades are completely inappropriate.  The bulbous orbs are completely out of step with the rest of the bar.  Then there are metal rods protruding from the top that hold the lights.  That is at odds with the screwed in wood planks (and I'm not even sure that is real wood.)

My friend and I popped in for Happy Hour and we were hungry.  We ordered chicken nuggets, onion rings, and 3 sliders = 2 bbq brisket and 1 chicken.  These sliders are really small.  My chicken slider's meat was so thin that it was literally the size of 2 nickels together.  Flavor-wise, they were ok.  With the chicken nuggets, here's where it all clicked and went down hill for me.  The "Dino Nuggets" are the same frozen ones you purchase at Safeway for children!  They are serving microwaved food!!!!  Nothing is fresh at all!  It's sad that the owner/mgr doesn't know that it's cheaper to sell fresh food than packaged frozen items.  Also the quality is better!  Just AVOID the food altogether.  With so many restaurants in the area, there's no reason to come here and eat.  If you want to watch sports and have a few beers with friends, then fine - that's all it's good for.

Our waitress was nice.

With their awful frozen food and visually inconsistent, underwhelming, dirty interior, I don't recommend this place at all.
author: Shaun W.

description: This place is a damn good time! Walking down Polk St after the Warriors win and Bullitt was the only spot celebrating in style... Enjoyed dancing here and socializing for hours on a Tuesday night. Props to Bullitt!
author: Kerry G.

description: The food is good, but the service done killed everything ! The female server was nothing, but rude. I couldn't even wait till the end of my meal to post, so I'm here eating my food while posting this. Didn't get her name, but the minute we sat down, she only gave us one menu. We're at the point to think she's plain racist because she would look at us, the look away. Not even giving us time to waive her down. We ordered the bottomless mimosas and she always walked past our table with the pitcher, refilled every other tables, but ours ! We waived another waiter down who was super attentive and sweet. He lifted my ranch cup up while he was at the bar, he came back with another one right away ! I guess he told the girl we complained, so she came to our table with lots of attitude and asked what we needed and if we were calling her. I said yeah, we were trying to get your attention for a while now. She responded with "I was busy" REALLY? I'm sure all her coworkers were too. She then walked away, and placed our checks on our table. WE DID NOT ASK FOR THE DAMN CHECK. WE WERE BARELY HALF WAY DONE WITH OUR FOOD. But, Ben, you are the man for trying to apologize and take the blame for her !
author: S M.

description:
I find that people either LOVE Bullitt or HATE Bullitt - no in betweens. 

Bullitt is a casual bar that feels a bit divey at times right in the heart of Polk St. It's got a fun, laid-back vibe with a variety of different clientele - you've got your marina bros, hipsters, financiers, tech nerds, etc. I love it.

I always love ending the night at Bullitt with their mojito, tochos and fireball shots. The totchos is seriously amazing - tater tot nachos basically. It makes for the best late night snacking to satisfy all drunken cravings. 

I haven't tried any of the other bar food here but my friends seem to really like their burgers as well. So on your next bar hopping spree on Polk, definitely include Bullitt as a prime stop!

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
Last night was $5 everything. If the drink was $3 it cost you $5 and if the drink was $18 it cost you $5. All the food, $5. I wish I knew that otherwise I would have had dinner there. I'm not sure if this is a weekly thing on Monday nights but among all the bars on Polk Street this one sure had the most happening action...probably for that reason.

I grabbed a seat at the bar and threw down on a few vodka and OJs. I could have easily gone for some crazier drinks but given that I was in unchartered territory I had to be careful... I normally go for beer but why pay $5 for something that would cost three or four bucks? One of the bartenders hooked me up with a shot that wasn't but tasted like a whiskey. At that point I had to simmer down.

I like the crowd of this place. It was a mix of people in their 20s and 30s enjoying a few drinks after work. Most likely I will be back during my stay here in SF.
author: Xerxes N.

description:
