I went for the 25 cent wings--I think this occurs on Wednesdays. I would verify that before going and expecting 25 cent wings on a Wednesday. This place has the same owners as Dr. Teeth and The Electric Mayhem (in the Mission district), which is the other place I go to for 25 cent wings (on Wednesdays for sure).

The wings were good and cheap (for anyone who makes more than $1/hour). When is a 25 cent wing not good? It's like a free T-shirt. What was good and not cheap though was all the fernet and beer my friends and I bought. Bullitt is an ideal place for a weekday food/EtOH session where the hardness level is limited to about 6 out of 10.

Our bartender was very nice. She is planning to be a dentist. I thought she was some sort of Southeast Asian but her ancestors are from Kazakhstan. I forgot what her name was. I've never met a dentist from Kazakhstan.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Bullitt, you are really something. This was the first stop and then the last stop during a supremely long night of bar hopping for my best friend's birthday. If you end up here and your group wants to stay, my advice is to drink...heavily. 

As the night goes on and they stop serving food, they move the tables out of the way. Your options for seating are limited to a long, wall spanning wooden bench or a stool at the bar. There's no decor or really anything memorable about this place. Over the few hours spent here, I had a vodka pineapple and two Makers on the rocks. Impossible to screw up. The birthday girl wasn't so lucky as she was given a gratis "coffee flavored thing" with whipped cream on top. She paid the price for it later. 

Like most dive bars, when this place gets packed, it gets 10 times as gross. As people get drunker, they get sloppier. Think sweaty people dancing awkwardly in a cramped space, incessant spilling of drinks, having no choice but to rub against strangers to exit due to the lack of room. Whoever is responsible for the playlist needs to expand their horizons immediately. I can only hear so many terrible Zedd remixes on a crackling PA before my hands start forming into fists. The clientele is varied, but has a serious bro contingent. Lots of man tanks, hair product, and self importance. Let's just say you are definitely not going to meet your soul mate here. 

Pro tip: If you are waiting for your wasted friends and want to have a good laugh, sit on the bench outside right before closing time. 

Two stars for the amiable door guy and the generous pours of Makers.
author: Ruby G.

description:
Their breakfast burritos are YUMMY! After we had ordered, we noticed we totally skipped over their tots choices (totchos - tots + nachos, YES PLEASE)! My friends and I had bottomless mimosas and omg, it was really all alcohol and a splash of juice. I guess it was worth it to help me start my day as I continued on my buzz for a few hours afterwards haha. 

What my friends and I really loved was the atmosphere and the music!!! The playlist was amazing... thank you for taking us back to our younger years with your music (I believe his name was Mario?). Service was great and friendly- our cups were constantly refilled with mimosas.
author: Faye F.

description:
We shared the huevos rancheros and eggs benedict. This is the first time that I've ever had huevos rancheros and it was pretty good. The eggs were cooked just right and the beans and salsa added great flavor. The eggs benedict was good, but not amazing. The potatoes on the side were basically fried, and you know what that means -- deliciousness! 

I would give the place four stars except the waitress was HORRIBLE!! She had this permanent constipated look on her face, never smiled and did not acknowledge us every time we thanked her. Maybe she was just pissed to be the only waitress but that type of attitude is unacceptable. She treated us like we killed her puppy or something. Totally ruined the dinning experience.
author: Alice W.

description: 5 stars from me on just about every level... This is perfect for a boozy brunch and fun filled atmosphere... Everyone was singing some people we're grooving and it just put us in the best mood! Staff is constantly on the move, very attentive, our bottomless mimosas were always filled to the rim! If I lived in the Bay Area I could imagine I being my go to weekend brunch spot.. I got the lumberjack breakfast, everything was fantastic except the bacon.. I didn't know it's possible for bacon to be bad lol but it tasted like the grill like pure SMOKE, neither my boyfriend or I could eat it! (They still get 5 stars because everything else was a plus and I was beyond full with half my plate still unfinished) ..they don't go cheap on their mimosas either, I swear it was 80% or more champagne and got us feeling just perfect on a Saturday afternoon. My boyfriend got the chicken and waffles, I kept eating them because they were so perfectly seasoned and the crunchy texture was just right! Ty was our server, and she was so pleasant always smiling and checking In!!! Will return on our next SF trip! Also shout out to the owner, I called to ask some questions and it was an automatic machine, minutes later HE TEXTED ME BACK to see if I needed help or anything. Very impressed all around for such a casual spot.
author: Diana B.

description:
Used to be great when it was a locals bar. Now it is filled with chads and trixies. Food is mediocre. Seats are ripped, dirty floor, no lock on the bathroom door. 

This place turned into a dump after mark left.
author: Lloyed C.

description:
We LOVE grabbing food here. The Bullitt burger is amazing. I usually get it with grilled chicken and swiss cheese. Their curly fries are also great. All that with a bottle of PBR to down it with. Amazing! 

Note: Their taco Tuesdays get crowded!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
This place gets 5 stars because of the amazing customer service that Memo provided!

Stopped in for brunch because my boyfriend had found a Groupon for Bullitt and it did not disappoint! The place was packed with a line, which was nice to see for a place we had never been to before. There were several TV's for watching the games and the music playlist for during the halftimes/commercial breaks was great as well! 

We got the grilled cheese and chicken and waffles off of the brunch menu, as well as the bottomless mimosas. All were delicious! 

I really cannot emphasize how awesome of a host/bartender/front of house Memo was today! They were down a staff member, but he was so great about keeping our drinks filled, asking if we needed anything, chatting with us here and there, as well as basically making sure the rest of the bar/restaurant was good to go. We ended up tipping him more than we paid for our groupon - he definitely deserved it! 

We will definitely be returning!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I was visiting the city with a girlfriend and was recommended to go here.
Went in for the dinner but stayed a lot longer than we planned. Thank you to Jared for taking care of the guy who keep drinking from the water pitcher. That guy was so drunk and obnoxious!!!
The place is really loud and he was louder. 
The burgers we got were excellent. the mimosa's were flowing. the girls were all happy tonight! Traffic and parking is horrible and the wait was ok but later on....there was a huge long line!
author: Brianna J.

description: Bartender tried to take advantage and charge me $10 for a bud light. When I called her out she had lots of attitude and took 10 mins to give me my change.
author: Mike M.

description: Went in for the all day Tuesday Happy Hour of 2 for 1 margaritas ($11 for a shaker  which pours about 4 small glasses- good deal!) and $1 tacos. The margaritas were tasty, we got one shaker (or 2 margaritas) each, and a bunch of tacos. We started with 3 tacos each but were still hungry so each got 2 more. Definitely more of an appetizer because they are super small and we were still hungry after. We are meat and veggie eaters but we all preferred the veggie taco. Good, quick service.
author: Kristen R.

description:
This place is one of the hit spots when my friends and I do a Polk street bar crawl.

Honestly, this place is a hit or miss for me.  Then again, isn't every venue.  You can never predict the crowds.

I've had some good times here and some boring times here. 

Nice but SUPER small brunch spot!

Tochos and Wake and bacon!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Johnny. What can I say. Nothing. Because thats about all I got when you keep brining sexy back with every mimosa. #canwetalkaboutthis bullitt is a total time warp of amazing. I still have no idea what a "bottom" is or what "bottomless" means. #sorryaboutit #johnnysismymainman 

So now that we have our baselines covered and your still reading, if your sf weird and looking for a dope ass bar, TRY IT. #getweird

On all seriousness this is a place to take anyone. Fuddy duddies, guys, girlfriends, neighbors. . Anyone whos looking to get weird on a sunday. #happysunday
author: Kristina B.

description: You think this is a normal brunch spot until you realize they r playing juvenile at 11am!!!!!!!!  ion even care about the food/drinks cuz the jamz are fire.  Fireeee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Anna D.

description: How does one write a review when there are no words to properly describe this place?  I love all the bars under the Tonic Nightlife Group umbrella, but this has to be my favorite.  I mean, everything goes.  Jump on the benches?  Ok.  Dance on the bar?  Sure.  Throw napkins at the ceiling fan?  Only if you throw ALL of them.  Black out and embarrass yourself and everyone around you?  Absolutely and please come back tomorrow.
author: Jessica F.

description:
If I had to think of a theme song for this place, it would be - 

"I came to dance, dance, dance, dance, 
I hit the floor 'cause that's my, plans, plans, plans, plans,
I'm wearing all my favorite brands, brands, brands, brands,
Give me space for both my hands, hands, hands, hands"

If you're ever looking for something fun to do on any night of the week that consists of - 

Dancing (on the table, on the bar, on the floor, in the upstairs room, in the bathroom line)
Tater Tots (Nachos Style, Sweet potatoes...)
Mac n Cheese (any way you want it)
Burgers (I've never tried these, but have heard good things)
Brunch
Scorpion bowls (Tiki style bowls with fire in the middle)
Fun crowds (read: drunks)

This is the place to be.
author: Anoo L.

description: Stopped here on an impromptu bar crawl! The wings and tater tots are so good! The staff is super friendly! The security guard let me try some of his wings before I ordered my own! Brenda the bartender makes amazing drinks! Can't wait to come back! They also play awesome old school hip hop songs! The vibe is awesome!
author: Nia R.

description:
Went here for a party on Saturday and i wasn't disappointed. 

Has a great upstairs room for private parties and a solid stocked bar for your guests. ( i can't lie, the stripper pole was a plus) 

fantastic bartender too.

Getting in and out however took some effort. This place was packed (as would be expected on a Saturday) but it really has very little room to walk between the tables and the bar (see pictures) which makes it a challenge. 

PS: Compared to a few blocks down on Polk Street, VAST improvement in clientele's hotness quotient.
author: Mike V.

description:
Love this local joint.  Try their tater tots, burgers and corn dog which is really good. Affordable drinks , great tasting food and fun, mixed crowd, what more can you ask for, right????
Now, they have separated the male and female bathroom which is awesome.
Parking is rough in this neighborhood, so take a cab or MUNI.
This place will and always be close to my heart.
I heart you BULLITT!!!!
author: Claudine V.

description: Very friendly staff and awesome happy hour drinks and eats (you mustn't leave without trying the totchos). I wish I would have remembered our servers name; she was amazing and even let us borrow this awesome phone charger block while we had drinks! I'll be back!
author: Samantha L.

description: Awful!!!!!   We waited over an hour (more like an hour and 20 mins) to get our food... We were told the kitchen was backed up.  We had reservations at 11 Ben had called the night before to ask us to come at 10 and they could accommodate us.  We were there at 10 and no reservations were under our party's name.  So squished at a table.  Food came out wrong, waitress came by but didn't ask us if we needed anything else. We had to ask her.  We give a good tip but it wasn't worth it.  And not to sound old, but does the music need to be that loud?!?!   Many had hangovers.
author: Jodi B.

description:
Wow, this place is a real gem!  The bar and food menus are very creative and fun...the "Totchos" (a divine compilation of tater tots + nacho toppings...NOM) and the beef aus jus sliders are a definite MUST TRYS!!!

My bartender James was awesome; very friendly and knowledgeable - he gave us the low down on the go downs here...which include a pretty phenomenal sounding Monday night drink and food special.  I am excited to come back for that very soon!  

In addition to the food, I loved the vibe, the lighting and atmosphere; it was very low key but well designed with sturdy looking industrial and natural materials...I'm pretty sure Thomas Edison would be proud to call this place his local watering hole as well as the rest of the local industry crowd.

Will be back soon!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Beware of credit card fraud!!!

This is a third card that gets cancelled after using it at Bullit. It is not a coincidence, not 3 tines!! And though I don't get charged it is annoying! Its been several months since my first 2 cards were stolen, weeks within each other both were only used to pay tab at Bullitt. So I go to bullit again with a new card. And guess what?! Week later that new card is again fraudulently used somewhere somehow. Somebody is stealing card numbers at Bullitt.

Bullitt-  get your shit together figure put who is responsible,  your patrons are getting their card information stolen after using cards at your bar.
author: Try E.

description:
Not to sound dramatic but I would take a Bullitt for you.....

This place is pretty damn cool.  I don't personally care for the Totchos but I think they make a mean burger and have cool shit on the menu.  It is a definite grub hall and I will be back again and again.  

Note to the chef:  I have had a burger both times I have been in here.  Both times they were slightly undercooked.  You can still have a juicy burger if you cook it medium.
author: Brian S.

description:
Long overdue for a review on this place, but this spot, just like the others the owners have in the city can make your dreams come true with one order--totchos. yup. Tater tots made into nachos. Smothered with cheese and jalapenos and sour cream and guac, they are perfect for those slightly slow hangover like mornings, and they pair pretty great with their bottomless mimosa deal too. Don't expect quality OJ in those mimosas or quality champagne either--it really does look much more like tang or something along those lines, but hey, it definitely had alcohol in it and it was bottomless. 

This place is not the biggest, and I hear it gets super crowded at night too, so if you want to come here for sunday fun day then you should try and get here on the earlier side. The bathrooms are also a little strange too, but oh well. The service is also hit or miss, since they were so nice while we were there, but often would not come around to refill our mimosas as quickly as we needed. If they are bottomless, just leave us a pitcher :-) Saves everyone time and energy.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Came here on a Saturday. It's a chill place with high ceilings and bottomless mimosas until 3pm for $15 a person! Great slaps getting people to dance a little in the middle of their drinks/food at like 1pm. Can get loud though. Kind of have to yell to talk.

Bartenders are all very friendly. One of them grabbed napkins and threw it into the air a couple times. If only it was money. Make it rain. Felt magical, but more confused than anything. She koo tho. Solid experience. Great time with my bestest :D
author: C. C.

description: This place is amazing. Memo puts on sweet jams and the bottomless mimosas are on point. Every Sunday should be spent here; definitely their number 1 fan.
author: Jennie W.

description:
Came here at 9pm Saturday night while the Warriors were playing the Clippers and was pleasantly surprised. They had a lot of tables and I definitely enjoyed the decor. Laid back but classy. 

They started taking the tables away as it got closer to 10 and they started cranking up the music, which by the way was fantastic, it was definitely getting me pumped to go out dancing. 

Ordered an Irish coffee to help me pull through the night, they had run out of coffee and were attentive enough to brew some up for me! 

Definitely going to hit up this place again
author: Yolanda M.

description: Memo's jams on Sunday are gold. Reason I come here. Best Sunday Funday in SF. Great vibes, good folks, strong drinks. Bring friends, grab a table, have a good time.
author: Joe D.

description:
Pros: The food was good, able to find a table quickly.

Cons: Servers/wait staff were rude, accused my friends of not leaving a tip when I left early (though I had left enough money for my drinks/food and a tip. Let the staff know the restroom was out of everything (soap, toilet paper, seat covers) and when my friend went to the restroom a few minutes later nothing had been restocked. Maybe I'm overestimating, but when there is no soap OR toilet paper, that seems like a priority.

Overall, it was an underwhelming experience. I'd rather go to Dr. Teeth for wings and drinks on a Wednesday.
author: Megan L.

description: Two words...WING WEDNESDAY! Also, there are two other words, TACO TUESDAY. There is just no beating the deals here for those two days. You would be hard pressed to find better tasting wings that you can seriously lose your mind on (i get about 25 every time) and walk out and pay $10 after ordering a accompanying beer.
author: Robert W.

description:
$5 Mondays is why I like this place!
Everything from the food to the beer to the jameson is only 5 bucks on mondays. Some cool regulars come by on mondays which always makes a place that much better when the regulars come out to play. 
The only reason why I gave this place 4 store instead of 5 is because the crowds on the more popular days are not my type of crowd. It gets super packed and starts to remind me of the marina after a while.
But those 5 buck mondays are awesome.
author: Cescilia A.

description: Besides the layout of the bar (SUPER narrow, one way in one way out type of layout), this place is a chill spot to hang out at. Music is good, the crowd is friendly, and the drinks are decent. Not sure if it's a "thing" at this bar, but they like to grab a pile of napkins and throw them in the air like confetti. First time I've seen this, but it was kind of fun.
author: Marissa C.

description: Great Groupon! OMG that was fun. Memo was a great host, truly charming individual. We faded, still chillin. Will do this again and again.
author: Aleister C.

description:
just when i thought bullitt couldnt get any better...

tuesdays.

DOLLAR TACOS

2 FOR ONE BIG ASS MARGARITAS

mind blown yet?
author: Ryan L.

description:
I want to start out by saying Yes to Bullitt!

I went in for santa con for the first time and it was like every other bar in the city,  full of d-bags in santa suits... cant hold it against them.

I returned a few days later and it was amazing. I went for a mushroom burger and got tater tots in my mac and cheese at the waitress's suggestion. It was amazing.

Free beer w/ any shot too, any beer, any shot.
author: Max S.

description: $1 yes ONE DOLLAR! Taco Tuesdays and they are pretty big filled tacos! Oh and you can't forget the Totchos! yes tater tot nachos. rinsed it all down with some vodka tonic..ZUMBA was calling my name the next day to burn all those delicious calories off! Wait staff and bartender was nice and the place wasn't crowded like on the weekends, a good thing.
author: Karen T.

description:
I came here with some friends for bottomless mimosas for brunch because one of my friends really likes the place and its environment.

I personally thought the environment was decent -- it's like a small dive bar-ish place with a bar and some other small tables. The tables are small and the seats are high and not very comfortable, but I can deal with that.

Instead of being like orange-ish like normal mimosas, these were so diluted and looked lemonade-colored. We asked what type of champagne was used and the waitress said she didn't know. Not a good sign! But also not a big deal because they are bottomless. But this is just an FYI.

The food was actually decent, but was also really greasy and oily. The omelette had a layer of fat I felt really guilty eating it. The thing that is probably worth getting here is the tater-tot-nachos (or something like that) where they use tater-tots instead of nachos but with all the same topping. Those were pretty unique.

The pricing was definitely more than I would have liked. $15 for a bottomless mimosa and $10-11 for food like burgers and omelettes.

Overall, I'd say it's a good place to try, but I wouldn't say it's worth my money for the quality of the food :( At least half of my friends liked it! While the other half are in the same boat as me :)
author: Eric S.

description: Had a good 2-4-1 margarita that was tasty and had a good kick. Also had a couple of the happy hour tacos. The carne asada was not my fav as the beef did not have the spice I would expect. The fish taco was pretty good and little deep fried nuggets and some yum toppings.
author: Zillah T.

description:
Going here at night versus going here for brunch are two very different experiences, but both are really enjoyable. Though it's a dive bar, there is a surprisingly good amount of space to get your groove on! They have really good music and the drinks are well-made. I've never gotten food here at night, but it's offered! I love the crowd, music, and atmosphere. For brunch, it's a little more tamed. They have bottomless mimosas and a wide variety of food options. The chicken wings were terrible, but everything else was pretty good. One of my favorite places on Polk for sure!

Pros:
- Great environment
- Love the music
- Decently-priced, well-mixed drinks

Cons:
- Can get really crowded

Recommendations:
- TACHOS. Tater tot nachos... obviously get them.
author: Meygan N.

description:
Don't come here buzzed.  Be freaking drunk as hell, and you will have a good time.

Me?  I was stone cold sober.  I sat at the bar and meticulously ate my basket of chicken wings (very delicious, I must say) one by one as frat boy after frat boy pushed, shoved and rubbed up on me, and bimbo after bimbo stumbled through the door (most of them wearing eye-gouging skin tight sequin loincloth monstrosities) and contributed to the general screeching and screaming that punctured the atmosphere.

Cheers!
author: Jess H.

description:
It has been over a year without the ability to write a review... Of course, my first one will be for good ol' Bullitt. Or as everyone likes to call it, "my living room." This places happens to be across the street from my house. Because of this, I have an excessive (embarrassing) amount of check-ins for this fine establishment. Not to mention the fact that I jock the truffle fries.

All jokes aside. Bullitt is clean (minus the bathroom), fun, and has good food for a bar. It wouldn't hurt for them to staff it a bit more, especially on busy days. 4 stars for my home away from home :)
author: Gianna D.

description: Came here on my last leg of my SF trip. It's a brilliant little hole in the wall but on a main street. They have a great Happy Hour. They have this AMAZING dish with tater tots but made them nachos. Hence the magicness your palate will feel and the name totchos. They had $4 well drinks for 4 of us with an appetizer it came to about $30 with all the drinks. What's also awesome is that you can actually just order a 40oz. You read correctly a 40OZ If I was local I would definitely make this a hang out spot with friends. It also looks like a great place to watch sports too if you are into that. I do want to try more of the items on the menu. Hopefully when I visit SF again I will be able to.
author: Pooja B.

description: Love this place for its simplicity- come chill, sports on TV and always friendly smiles on the servers' faces. Great food as well. The place can get crowded sometimes but it's definitely worth it, it's all part of the ambiance..
author: H G.

description:
This review is solely for the Tot-chos.  
Whoever created this is just genius! So good and quite addictive! A must with libations at Bullitt!
author: Chelsea V.

description: I came here on Halloween - and it was packed! Definitely a good vibe, and the bar tenders poured stiff drinks. The atmosphere seemed pretty standard, with bar stools, bench seating against the walls, and few TVs hung around. I'd definitely come back on a more low key evening to see what their average night is like and to order food!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Fried chicken.

Tot-chos (tator tot nachos)!

Waitress danced (just randomly while she was waiting for our drinks... I think she thought nobody was watching!).

Will be back!
author: Michelle K.

description: Met a cute girl. She was staring at me but she's from Chicago. I guess they do that there. She works for Yelp, so this is an inside job? Roll tide.'
author: Stewart S.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar especially on a Saturday or Sunday morning when my hangover calls for bottomless mimosas and a sympathetic bartender...shout out to Memo!
author: Selena R.

description: Wings absolutely destroyed my stomach. Last week the waitress took three requests to bring water, last night the bartender was a bit rude, or at the least, unwelcoming. It's salvation is the low prices...if you can take the pain.
author: Mike J.

description:
I always enjoy grabbing some drinks at Bullitt. Honestly, the place doesn't have much of an architectural edge or anything that makes it stick out from other bars. What I think makes this place great is the music they play and the easy going attitude the bartenders have. 

If you don't like crowded bars you probably won't like Bullitt. It can get pretty rowdy and packed, but that's fine by me...it makes the experience all the more interesting. It's up there on the list of my favorite Polk St bars.
author: Devin N.

description:
I really loved this place! I was working in the area that week, and walked right by a sign that said "2-for-1 Margaritas," and $1 tacos. Okay, I don't really drink that often, but when I do, I simply love margaritas. So, I went in, and the bartender - Masaye - was extremely warm and welcoming, and made me feel right at home.

I had some errands to run, so came back, and ordered the delicious chicken and fish tacos. But, the margaritas, I have to say, were EXCELLENT! And, I am really particular about my margaritas.

So, come by sometime on a Tuesday when Masaye is pouring these, as you will be really delighted! Can't wait to try out all of the various other barfood offerings and main menu delights, too.
author: Lea S.

description: We happened to find this place looking for some food before the football game and I am so glad that we did. Today is Sunday so there are bottomless mimosas! Always a plus!! The atmosphere is laid back w an awesome playlist provided by the bartender. The food is good. The home fries are cooked perfectly. I will definitely be back here if I'm ever in San Fran again.
author: Angela M.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. I guess my feelings about this place really depend on my mood that night and what time of night I go. This is by far the most crowded bar in the Upper Polk area. If you come after 10:30 PM on a Fri or Sat night, good luck getting inside. I'm not sure how anyone can keep up a conversation here when the music is blasting off the speakers, let alone get a drink. Think Tipsy Pig, but different location and smaller! I guess people tend to go where the crowds are, or some people do. For their drinks, I stick to beer since I don't think their cocktails are particularly good. Again, not sure why people enjoy this place when the drinks aren't even that good.

Now, for the food, that's another story. If you come here between 7-9 pm, it's a much quieter place and a very different atmosphere. You have friends or couples dining here or coming here to grab a beer. You can actually have a conversation while enjoying one of their many grilled cheese sandwiches or super salads. I had a bacon, brie and apple panini here once and it was amazing. I was really surprised too since I didn't think the food at a bar would be better than the drinks.
author: Sophia H.

description:
I'm convinced that I probably should give Bullitt another try, based on the reviews I see from other people. Came here on Wednesday night with a bunch of friends and occupied a small section of the bar no problem. Crowd was totally what I expected; Marina kids. Hipsters. Blah. Anyway. Vibe was pretty chill although, it was damn busy for a Wednesday night. Oh, they were slingin' .25 cent wings.

Fernet and Maker's Mark on tap. That's a situation...which totally happened. Went to the bathroom and opened the door to find some guy passed out with his pants around his ankles while sitting on the toilet. Blah.

Crowd, not so much. Service, legit. I'll be back for lunch or something off-peak hours.
author: Trav M.

description:
Usually what I look for in a bar is a place with solid drinks and decent food. This place has great drinks and the food is ACTUALLY great. I came to bulleit for taco Tuesday and got 1$ tacos and a few drinks and was very satisfied. I didn't have to fight for a place to sit either. I highly recommend the chicken and carne asada tacos. The location is also great if you plan on checking out a few more bars after. Staff is professional and friendly! 
If u want a casual place during the week I highly recommend!
author: Maria W.

description:
I've wanted to try the brunch at Bullitt for some time now so my friend and I attempted to venture in today only to find that it was packed and all the seats were taken. Ok, fine, I understand that tables get scarce during brunch around the city but my friend and I had to look around aimlessly for some time before hunting down a member of the waitstaff and asking if we had to wait for a table or if there was any kind of waitlist. He quickly said "yeah just wait" and brushed us off, leaving us in the middle of the walkway. 

We waited for a while before the bartender asked if we wanted mimosas while waiting so we said yes. However, when we decided to leave because it didn't look like anyone at the tables were budging, he gave us the dirtiest look when we told him we'd rather close out the tab and pay for our first mimosas rather than continue with bottomless. 

To top it off, the waitress with the Skrillex cut ran into me without so much of an apology before returning just to tell us to move out of the walkway and find somewhere else to wait. 

Completely rude employees and terrible customer service. Sucks because I really wanted to give those tachos a try.
author: Brittany L.

description: Love Bullit as a boozy brunch location. It's a good compromise between a bar and restaurant if you're looking to do some day drinking. Some improvements to the menu are needed. More often than not I find myself disappointed with my breakfast. No matter - still a fan.
author: Kate T.

description:
Cool bar always packed.  Basically marina girls and marina guys looking at one another and drinking enough so that they don't feel so guilty with their decisions the following morning.  They do have stiff drinks and there is a menu (I've never eaten there) but always see about 85% of people eating so they must be doing something right.

I would say if you are looking to hook up...this is the spot!
author: Jeremy E.

description: I highly recommend the spinach salad with an added chicken breast for a hearty delightful meal
author: Adrienne L.

description:
AHHHHHH NO ME GUSTAAHHH

Yea, not really a fan. I just don't get it either. It's suuuper tiny and crowded, very dark so you can't see anyone, and just has an awkward setup where you are constantly brushing up on people walking by.

And the benches on the side are kind of annoying. People just perch there behind you like lurks.

I don't know, I mean it's a typical bar and I'll go if everyone is going but I'd prefer to go elsewhere in SF.
author: Issa A.

description:
Came in on Wednesday April 16th,  2014 to a semi-full restaurant and quickly found a table with a view of the Giants-Dodgers Game around 7 PM. My server, Krystle H, was quick to approach with a menu and a drink order.

I ordered a Miller Light for $4.50 (tad pricey for 12 oz beer); Cobb Salad for $10.95 which was gigantic and 10 wings at $0.25 each which were great sized for the price point.

The food and beverages came out quick and the server couldnt have been nicer. Overall it's a great place and I'd recommend to anyone.
author: Brian D.

description: This review is for the bar, specifically on weekends.  Way too crowded.  And damn near impossible to get a drink at the bar with any sort of efficiency.  Some crowd control would make this much more enjoyable.
author: Kunal K.

description: I love Bullitt. Memo and Dra are the brunch dream team! The new manager is rude though so I don't come in when she's working. She has horrible taste in music too.
author: Mahta P.

description:
How could I ever hate on a place that has such great daily deals and basically treats me like a friend?!  Bullitt, you will always have a special place in my heart. Yes, you may be way too crowded on weekends, but at least you don't judge me when I'm at my best... As a wise Asian man once said, "Bullitt is best!"

Shout-out to Rafael and bouncer guy for being awesome.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Overall, a solid place to go grab a drink and something small to eat. Laid back place in a fun area of the city on Polk with fairly easy parking.

Pros:
- bartenders are cool
- crowd seemed pretty chill
- Sierra Nevada on tap
- Totchos (tater tot nachos): So simple but so brilliant and delicious

Cons:
- besides Sierra Nevada only a few other beers available on tap
- sliders (2 for $3): Cheap but you get what you pay for
- waitress: After she gave us our menus and we ordered the totchos she didn't come by again. We sat there with empty beers and an empty plate of food while we watched her play on her iPhone across the room. Had to go up to the bar to order more food and beer and ended up settling with the bartender and giving him the tip since he did all the work.
author: Frank J.

description:
One star for naming your bar after a Steve McQueen flick set in SF.  One star for tot-chos, (perfect bar food) one star for Maker's on tap, one star for Fernet on tap, and one star for Mark, the mustachioed bartender.  We were here last night using a coupon, and we had just seen the Drinking Made Easy show that featured Bullitt (bought the coupon before seeing the show) so we had no excuse not to go on a rainy Tuesday.

Bullitt is part upscale local dive where you can kick back and conversate with the bartender, one part fancy drinks place, (Mark is a fine mixologist, as evidenced by his Maker's, Fernet, and pear brandy concoction that is an off-menu masterpiece) and one part comfort food bar.  I love Manhattans and Sazeracs, and the Sazerac led to this unnamed concoction, (featured on said Zane Lamprey TV show above) and then that led to another.  And that led to tot-chos to soak up some of that booze and buy me some time before we had to head home.  The lady had the jalapeño margarita, and then a pink grapefruit martini (?) - my memory may or may not be hazy at this point, but I do believe she had a couple of these as well.  The crew next to us was lazily sipping away at a few bottles of Miller High Life, so you can just chill here and have a few cheap beers during happy hour too.

It's probably my favorite watering hole in the area - whether you're in the mood for a 40 in a bag and a prophylactic, a killer Sazerac, Fernet and Maker's on tap, or you're already buzzed and coming for some grub, Bullitt would even lure the great Steve McQueen to the 'hood.
author: Joe B.

description:
Still drunk from lastnight's festivities and wanna keep the party going?  Head to bullit.  

Bottomless mimosas on Saturdays and Sundays for brunch.  Great hangover food too since you know your body will need it after a few hours.  

My favorite part about this place is the heavy hand with champagne on mimosas.  You know how some places you get a mimosa and it's TOO orange?  Have no fear, not a problem here!! The mimosas come out almost lemonade-colored.  More like champagne with a splash or orange juice than anything else =)

Great party atmosphere, music always bumping.  Def stay away if you planned on being sober for the day or don't feel like putting up with a crowd.  
This is def my go-to spot to start a good day drinking weekend!
author: Mary A.

description: I was pretty surprised that this place was fairly packed on a Wednesday night. But the totchos are worth all the hype, y'all. Holy moly. Talk about a bar comfort food menu. It's worth it alone to check that out, and I liked that the beer on tap was served in a mason jar, too.
author: Mel G.

description:
First off, Bottomless Mimosas!
Secondly, Tator Tot Nochoes!

Not a good place if you have a hangover, but definitely a fun place to be on a Saturday in the late morning. Everyone seems to be in great spirits in this high energy location.

Bar atmosphere (a little dark on the inside) but there is a large window in the front.
author: Frances M.

description:
Bullitt has many characters. You could visit it three times a day and wouldn't even guess it is the same place.

Weekdays: Very chill atmosphere serving a variety of American staples. The uber-customizable mac n cheese plates and ingenious tochos (tater tot nachos) are what you should be aiming for. And you get quite a lot of bang for your buck.

Weeknights: My favorite time to frequent this bar. Look for beer specials and you'll come out with one heck of a deal. On Wednesdays, you get 2 for 1 beers. I didn't even know that existed, so when the bartender told us this, I got emotional and almost teared up.

Weekends: It gets really crowded here. Maybe the most crowded bar north of McTeagues and Vertigo. They play top 40 tracks with an electronic twist. Don't expect a seat if you come here after 8 pm. No room to dance, so people sometimes make use of the tables as a battleground.

Brunch: Bottomless mimosas and lots of fried food. What's not to love?
author: Nick A.

description:
This place is awesome, every city should have one!  

Was staying in the city with a friend and he took a group of us here one Saturday morning.  We sat at the long high table at the front of the bar around 11am and as soon as we ordered the place started filling up.  

Bottomless mimosas are $15/person but you can literally sit there and drink them for 4 hours.  I got the truffle mac n cheese which was to die for and friends got the wake and bake grilled cheese, bacon ancho breakfast burrito, and the bullitt burger and were equally as thrilled with their choices.  Seems like you can't go wrong here.

Our waitress was the nicest person and she kept bringing around that pitcher of mimosas at the perfect time so that our glasses were never empty.

The atmosphere was like one big afternoon party and we loved every second of it.  Back in LA my friend and I have been trying to find a place that can compare with Bullitt...still looking.
author: Madeline H.

description:
Where else in SF can you go to create your own mac and cheese, share tot-chos (think nachos, but with tater tots), or scarf a grilled cheese? I don't know.  But Bullitt has it all!

The ladies and I had spend a lovely brunch here last Saturday and couldn't have been more pleased!  I mean, with $15 AYCD mimosas and a menu armed with all the comfort foods from when you still watched power rangers, how can you go wrong? And the best part?  There's NO time limit on your morning fun!  Unlike the infamous Lime, you can drink mimosas until 3:00p.m.!  

Now be warned, this place is not the biggest, so I suggest going early-ish or calling in before you go.

So happy that I've found my new favorite brunch spot! :)
author: Kristen D.

description: Good good great drinks, Doritos nachos ,truffle tots, fried pickles, good beer had a lot of fun here tastebuds on 10. Yum diddly uptious.. will come back for sure!
author: Angela B.

description:
Bullitt, I love you? 

This may be my favorite bar in the city, definitely my favorite in my neighborhood. Not only are the bartenders all just a fun time (Erica, you're gorgeous and fun and I love you), but 90% of the time they will turn on the UNCE when I ask them to...even if its at 10am on a Sunday (we compromise and it usually gets turned on around noon). 

I love their food, I dream about their mac & cheese options, and they have Fernet on tap, enough said. On Tuesdays they have 2 for 1 margs, that are strong and delicous, and obviously on weekends they have bottomless mimosas and a delicious brunch menu. 

I have to say when I first went here and heard about "Totchos" I was hesitant, I mean I've never been a tater tot fan. But these are mind blowing...MIND BLOWING!!! So delicious, and not only that Bullitt also has sweet potatoe tots and truffle tots, all delicious and unique ideas for a staple food we've all grown up on. This has definitely restored my desire for tots. 

Yes, the weekend nights are a shitshow, but if you're willing to lose yourself within the back of Bullitt, you'll find yourself dancing on the wall seats to great music, meeting wonderful new friends, and having one of the best nights of your life. OMG, Bullitt, I can't get enough of you.
author: Dawn O.

description:
tip: MUST GO WITH FRIENDS

otherwise, you'll just get run over by the tons and tons of people jam packed into the bar, which is more like a hall way than anything else.

Surprisingly there is a lot of dancing as people stood on benches against the wall.  Drinks were OK. A bit too loud to talk. but a fun time if you go with a group of friends. Would not want to go with only one or two other friends. The crowd there is late-20s/early 30s and hammered. 

music (on a saturday night): top 40s
author: Alice Z.

description:
Just when I think I keep coming back for the drinks and hazy memories, I'm reminded about how freaking amazing the menu is. I could throw a dart at the menu from 10 feet away and be absolutely stoked on whatever I hit. Brunch, ballin' burgers, bitchin' sandwiches, mac and cheese. You get it, right?

Often times, I cannot even decide for myself what to eat, but the staff is very helpful with making a decision for me. My server on Saturday led me to Granny's Old Fashion Fried Chicken sandwich, and she hit the nail right on the head.

Come early for some drinks, stay long enough to grab a bite and Lyft home in your drunken, full-bellied euphoria.
author: Tyler H.

description: It was ok, I didnt hear the person say they were closed and they squirted me with water. Wont be back.
author: Brittini S.

description: Literally the greatest bar in the city, the greatest bar in California and possibly the greatest bar in this great country that we call America. 25 cent wing Wednesdays are a gift from god. Bottomless mimosas and brunch every single Saturday and Sunday? Yes please. Thank you, I'll come again.
author: Jesse D.

description:
I freaking LOVE Bullitt. I've honestly NEVER had a bad time here.

First time coming here, my friends and I discovered there was an upstairs. Once up the stairs, we were greeted with a KEG. Yes, A KEG!!!!!! Second time coming here, it was right after bay to breakers, and people were dancing in their penguin costumes on the bar. AHHHHH. Many more times later, I discovered their BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS and TATER TOTS. God what is not to like about Bullitt???

Great time guaranteed here!!!!
author: Liz W.

description:
I have had a great time every single time I've visited Bullitt! They have specials every day of the week, from the burger + beer on Mondays to the 40 & a condom special on Thursday night (but that could have been a 1-night thing.. you know).  Yes, it certainly get crowded sometimes and it may be difficult to maneuver your way to the bathroom but it says something about the popularity of Bullitt. 

Simply put: the drinks are strong, the tater-tot nachos satisfy the drunchies and the atmosphere is great!
author: Gianina B.

description: Upon arrival at this neighborhood bar we were greeted by a rather combative waitress demanding a credit card be kept on file during our already paid for groupon brunch which we found rather off putting.   The generous mimosa refills, as others have mentioned, were a nice distraction from the otherwise not so great food leading to our 2 rather than 1 star review.
author: David R.

description:
Been to Bullitt a few times now, and overall it's been a good time. I've only gone at night, so it's a usual club atmosphere. Good music and nice bartenders. Only thing is that there is extreme overcrowding and people tend to get pushy as they consume more alcohol. If you don't worry about personal space, this is your kinda place! Lol. 

Other than the overcrowding, it's usually a lot of fun to go here!
author: Nakul B.

description:
Bottomless mimosas, bumpin' EDM tunes, and delicious hangover food - what more could anyone want for a Sunday brunch?!

The place is a tight squeeze with its limited seating, but the servers and bartenders are all super friendly and cordial that make the visit worth the experience. It's ideal to arrive early or make reservations especially if you're coming with a large group. 

Food-wise, great portions! Ordered the breakfast burrito that was nicely prepared but could've done without the excess sour cream. The tater tots and breakfast potatoes were amazing.
author: Donna M.

description:
None of us had ever been to Bullitt but my girl's friend was having her Birthday celebration here and rented out the entire 2nd floor to party. DOWNSTAIRS WAS BETTER. No offense Birthday girl, but the DJ spinning at your private party sucked. I was trying to make it through the 1st hour of the night but my girl and I met this sweet, legit bartender which redeemed this night for us! *Shout out to Evonne: You're fucking tight girl!* 

After Bullitt closed the upstairs, we moved downstairs to party. Uh, 1000 times better! Better music, better people. We got some dancing and singing in. Not a bad night but definitely could've been better.
author: Qui C.

description:
Whoever thought of the idea to combine fresh crispy tater tots with Guacamole, REAL cheese, sour cream, olives, jalapeno and salsa together was a straight up genius. 

Bullitt has a really nice ambiance. There are a decent amount of seats around the bar but once that fills up, it can be a bit difficult to get around. They usually have a 2 for 1 margarita deal which is nice.

The one thing I really noticed was that it took forever to flag down a waiter just to order food and to get our bill. Since it was so busy that day, you really have to look for them just to get your attention.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I actually enjoy Bullitt the most at around 7PM when I'm hungry for dinner. The food is surprisingly good for a bar and the menu has lots to offer. A variety of proteins for their burgers, as well as big, hearty salads. I actually got a bonus when I ordered a cobb salad with the bacon on the side - I got a few strips of bacon on the side AND crumbled bacon in the salad. Instead of complain about the inability to follow directions, I will just accept it as my good luck. 

I also love all the options for sides - mac and cheese, sweet potato fries, tatchos, tater tots, french fries...the list goes on, really. 

I also enjoy their specialty drinks. Affordable and special - these drinks may get you tipsy faster than you think. Although, I must say, the drinks are not always consistent - sometimes they can be a little spicier than others. 

The one downside is when it does fill up - this place gets really hot and humid, which is disgusting. And, the tables and seats are all really close together, so it gets especially tight in here when it is busy.
author: NickJess S.

description:
I'm all tore up... in more ways than one. 

1. I was all tore up the next morning after drinking a 40 oz bottle of Olde English from a brown paper bag (served with a condom) followed by the remaining 20oz of an associate's 40. This combined with numerous beers at other establishments both before and aprés.

2. I'm financially tore up by paying $9 for a 40 of Olde English. Seriously?! Seriously. 

3. I'm tore up about whether to drop 3 stars on this place for being sort of a generic yet overpriced bar that serves up cocktails of medium quality, or whether to add a fourth star on for offering Maker's Mark and Fernet, both ON TAP. 

4. I'm definitely NOT tore up about the fact that the condom that was served with the 40 was not used that night... especially since it was boys' night out.

Shit, that last one deserves a 4th star right there.
author: Don B.

description:
I went out drinking last night. And I regret it today.

(My head wants me to stop there, but I'm going to continue. For your sake. Don't say I never did anything for you.)

My night ended at Bullitt. Not because it was too late, but because they have 40s of OE on their menu. Ostensibly because they hate me. Now, I ain't drank a 40 since I've been old enough to drink (not caught up in what the fuck these people think),* but sometimes things happen. And I ordered one. And I regret it today. 
 
They actually serve it in a paper bag. With a condom. Seriously. And I can respect the hilarity of that, but the novelty wears off after the first 20 ounces of malt liquor. At that point, you're just drinking it because you ordered it, and you have to finish it. And I did. And I regret it today.

But honestly, where do you get off charging $9 for a 40? I can't respect the 300+% markup.

Also, I'm not sure if it's just their air freshener, but the bathroom smells like freshly smoked marijuana. Or, what I imagine that might smell like.
_________

*Apologies to Slug, of Atmosphere.
author: Peter D.

description:
I've been here twice now- but I couldn't remember the dang name of the place! And I'm not what compels me to give this place 4 stars, but I'm doing it. There's just something about Bullitt that I really, really like. 

Maybe it's the low-lighting, sexy atmosphere. Maybe it's the fact that the layout is so long and awkward you just can't help but make bodily contact (I'm not sure I like that phrasing- I may need to edit later) with a handsome stranger. Whatever it is- I like it.

The crowd reminds me of a watered-down Marina crowd. Not nearly as pretentious but still young and fun! I'm sure I'll be back! :)
author: Annalise F.

description:
4.5 star

FOOD:
1.) Tachos =  What's worth getting is this! Omg. Tots and nachos?! Fully loaded with olives, cheese, sour cream?! So good... 

2.) Bullitt Burger = Ah, it was assemble yourself. It was fine. I don't like assembling my own food if I'm going to go out to pay for the service. Anyhow the meat was good though. Need to put own condiments too. Ketchup bottles empty on table. 

3.) 25c Wings on Wed = omg! So cheap! An the wings weren't dinky kinds, it was fleshy with worthy amount of meat. mmm... Okay this kinda makes this place deserving of an extra half star. ALMOST 4.5 star



SERVICE:
It's okay. Bc it's not a real restaurant. Just a bar with food. Ordered at bar, but food runner brought it out. 


ATMOSPHERE:
Casual bar, chill, I like it. Good crowd, and on a different note, this place gets cracking n super crowded during the weekend nights with pretty good music bumping.
author: Angela L.

description:
Really bummed that I ate before coming here because the food was good! But that didn't stop me from eating until I couldn't breathe (: 

We ordered the party platter with the truffle tater tots, corn dogs, and regular chicken strips. The truffle tater tots were good, because really, in my world anything with some sort of truffle flavor is a-ok. The corn dogs were made with boar sausage. I'd say I'm pretty open to trying new things, but I just really wasn't a huge fan of this. It tasted very meatloaf-y. It wasn't terrible though because I still ate the whole thing anyway. The chicken strips were yummy too. 

I told myself I must come back here! For a bar, they have good selection of food. I also want to try the tot-chos and possibly get a forty if I'm feelin craaazy!
author: Malyssa C.

description:
Decent menu for a bar.  I popped in here for the first time tonight after an intense workout at TRX Training Center.  Ok, so not a great place to get a bite to eat after working out, but a friend was there and I was invited to join.

I ordered the French Connection grilled cheese sandwich which was comprised of Swiss cheese, thin slices of ham and grilled onions.  The entree came with a little green salad and a cup of tomato soup.  The sandwich wasn't bad but it seemed to be missing something.  The slices of bread were huge...reminded me of Texas toast.  It wasn't a bad meal for $8 plus tax.

I washed that down with their blackberry caipirinha.  Caipirinha is my favorite cocktail.  The tanginess that the backberries added was great, but there were just too many seeds.

It was pretty busy/crowded tonight with a fair amount of good looking people.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Had a fabulous brunch experience here with some gfs. Food was great (truffle tots, Wake and bacon sandwich and soft scramble). Our server, Brittany, was amazing. 

Attentive, friendly and quick. If our bottomless mimosas or waters were empty, she filled them. Always came to the table with a smile, a refreshing and rare quality this day with service. Love her, love this place. Well done!
author: Liz O.

description: Stopped by for a drink on a Saturday afternoon impromptu bar crawl - drinks were pricey / nothing special about the place, but did seem like fun / nice service.  A-OK.
author: Laura R.

description:
Ooohhh. Russian Hill. Isn't this, like, an expensive part of SF?* That's why there's Maker's on tap and NINE DOLLAR 40s OF OLDE E SERVED IN BROWN PAPER BAGS. Really? That's never acceptable and you know...

"Hey, the waitress is pretty cute."

Anyway, yeah, overpriced malt liquor in trendy/expensive parts of town really chap my hide. It's such a gimmick. Just rely on the strength of your shelf, bottles and bartenders to make your bar awesome. From the looks of the menu, the cocktail selection is pretty inventive. There's really no need to upsell a bottle of malt liquor with a condom. I mean...

"Heehee. She looked at me again and touched my shoulder when she took my order. ((waves)) Hiiii. Heehee."

(sip) Like this goblet of Chimay. Yeah, I might be paying a $1 more for it than I would at another bar, but this goblet is what I am talking about. At a Steve McQueen (underneath your radar screen) inspired bar, let the cool come to you and keep it classy. The tables, walls and layout of the bar seem to agree with me. This is an attractive space. Obviously, the owners put some time, thought and effort in making it a cool destination bar. Ugh. I think the gimmick might make me want to lowe..

"Whoa. She's listening to my stories and saying that I am funny. This is the best bar EVAR!!!111!1"

You know, I didn't even really notice the 40.

*I suppose that's akin to asking if Jenna Jameson stars in the slutty part of her latest feature. It's all pretty slutty. Noted.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Mutha effin' Tater Tots! -- I had to say it.

How do you make a dive bar stand out? By servin' up some damn good food!

How about some Tatter Tot-chos to be exact; a sinful twist for tatter tot lovers out there looking to have a fiesta in their mouths! Mounds of sour cream, guac, and pico de gio toppled over a bed of delicious tatter tots and a flood of melted cheddar cheese. Make it an entree or add as a side for only +$2. Just fyi, a clogged artery or two is imminent. 

What's alcohol without some wings, amiright!? And the wings at Bullitt aren't messing around. Big, plump, juicy, beefy-- err.. chickeny wings! Get em' in Buffalo or Sweet Carolina Mustard BBQ (no half halfs which was a bummer).

And the sliders? Don't even get me started (I'm getting started). 2 for a mere 3 bucks! Your chose of the French Dip, BLT, or the Bullitt signature. I opted for the Bullitt and although they don't come with any fixings, the patty was so juicy, I should have just ordered a whole burger (but I was already feeling the wrath of the Tot-chos..).

Feeling a little fancy? They also serve French Onion Soup! At a bar, you say?? I know right!

AND omg, Bullitt serves Forties!? Sweet, it's like I'm sevente-- err.. twenty-one again!
author: Albert L.

description: Memo was a great addition to our brunch. Great bartender and even better music selection. We will definitely be back. Had the Lucy's omelet but can also highly recommend the breakfast sandwich and chicken and waffles.
author: Doug C.

description:
I think I need a Bullitt Intervention.

I wouldn't be surprised if my friends are probably masterminding that as I type this review. Let's put it this way, if you haven't been to Bullitt, you suck. Where else do you see frat guys who discovered Electronica, drink 40's in a brown paper bag with a condom inside, and make it rain with napkins? That's right, no where, but Bullitt.

I am giving you guys 5 stars because I've been coming here since you guys started. I celebrated my birthday upstairs and been here for countless other events. I could never do Polk without making a stop at Bullitt. Whether it's 6am drinking mimosas and watching the World Cup, making a quick stop to have lunch and watch a football game, or ending the night drinking and dancing here. 

Bullit's amazing. I love everything about it (ok maybe not so much how crowded it gets), and especially it's staff. Bullit/Tonic are like a second home to me. If I had to make a special request, please expand and bring the scorpion bowls to Bullitt! Oh and a special thank you to Nesia, Luke, Kimi, Nesia's lil sis Ivanna, Jared, and all the others who I don't know your names. Keep the work up, i'm saving a special place in my heart for you guys.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
The last time I went there, people were having sex in the hallway between the two bathrooms.  Bet you haven't read that in a review yet.

I've been to Bullitt a few times, and have decided to like it, despite the questionable activities that occasionally grace the rear hallway (all puns intended).  The tot selection is impressive, delicious, and comes in massive portions.  Additionally, tots are quite possibly the perfect bar food.  Coupled with the Fernet and Maker's taps, tasty burgers, and friendly, even if slow and overburdened, servers, you have a winner.

The two big bummers here, which you may have surmised from the location and above ranting, are the prices and customers.  A Maker's Manhattan checks in at $9, while a bottled PBR comes out to about $4.  Additionally, about half of the other patrons just seem to be assholes.  Each time I've been, there's someone being rude to a server or the bartender, a table full of people too drunk to be in public, and a table of obnoxiously loud/rude bros.

Get your tots, take it easy on the Manhattans, look for coupons, and use a condom.  :).
author: Troy M.

description:
Me and my husband came here last weekend for a birthday party.  My friend had rented out the room upstairs for her birthday.  The bar is longer then it is wide and gets really really crowded.  Literally you're touching the person on either side of you. 
Even though it's crowded they have great music and I like the fact that they serve food here as well.  
I think because I was upstairs I didn't feel like it was cramp like downstairs.  Because I don't live in San Francisco, I probably would not dirve all the way from San Jose just to come to this bar.  Overall this is a cool bar and the staff here are friendly. 
FYI, there are a ton of single guys that come here.
author: Rosetta C.

description:
Tater tots.  Seriously guys, insanely delicious tater tots. Did I mention tater tots? Sweet potato, regular, truffle, tat-chos.  Mac n' cheese, sliders, grilled cheese.  It's a haven of deliciously bad-for-you bar food that hits the spot.

However, let's talk about Bullitt for what it's great for: booze & fun.  This is one of my favorite bars and it never disappoints.  Even on a slow Polk Street night, Bullitt is rocking.  Oh, and they have Makers Mark & Fernet on tap.  Need I say more?

See you at the bar!
author: Jennica S.

description:
Gone here a few times for drinks

Pros:
great service
great music
good drinks

Cons:
loud music (not always a bad thing)
small area
author: Dara S.

description:
i think i gave them a pretty bad review before, and now i'm wavering around a 3.5, so i'll round up.  i came on cinco de mayo.  not too crowded, but there was a chatty crowd.  my friends and i ordered margaritas (2 for 1)!  they were pretty fucking strong.

anyway, i think the main reason i'm updating my review is because
1) service / waitress was super friendly.  we ended up giving her a bag of cherries that my friend had purchased earlier because she said she liked cherries
2) their walnut / strawberry salad - whatever it's called - was SO amazing.  i'm usually not the type to go for fruit-walnut salads, but this one was incredible.  the portion was pretty big / bigger than what you would expect an $8.50 salad to be at a bar. i would come back here just for this salad!!

their tater tot nacho thing was amazing, too.  AND you can order it at like 10 pm.  so good.  but still, THE SALAD.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I can say one of the best place in SF to hangout and have a drink and enjoy the songs and atmosphere with best crews.looking forward to come back and have another drink
author: Ashkan N.

description:
They have Makers Mark on Tap!!!  Amazing.

Which gives the joint immediate cred...  They have fernet on tap also...

The menu selection is pretty limited...  Pretty much only burgers...  some interesting varieties of burgers though.  I had my standard fare (cheddar burger) which was very good.  The bun was really good too, which is often a rarity.  So they got it right.

It's a bit dark inside and the TV over the bar is really high up and might hurt your neck after a while...  But a good spot overall.
author: Matt C.

description:
I'm impressed, when our friend said he wanted to grab a burger all the way in Noe Valley we were kinda hesitant mainly because we were starving by that time & fear of the lack of parking spaces available. But nonetheless we still went because he swears they have bomb tots. 

Bullitt isn't a fancy gourmet burger joint, but more so a bar. It your usual bar set up with seating at the counter & a few small tables along the side. But don't be mislead by the small space, their food here is AMAZING!! 

I had their angus burger with tot-chos (tater tot nachos) . Although its yummy all together.. The fact that the tots break apart kinda took away from the nacho feel. Out of all the tot offerings I've tried, the best by far is the sweet potato tots! 

Definately give this place a shot! The sign is kind of hidden behind the tree in front, but once you find it you'll never forget this place!
author: Jess s.

description:
Kickass old school 90s jams through the speakers (think SWV, House of Pain, Boyz II Men). Maker's Mark on tap. Great service from a server who was nice to my unsober friends. Mac and cheese bar. Garlic tater tots.

A word to the wise, shared by my friend with insider knowledge: order your mac & cheese with a side of tots (vs. with the tots mixed in) for optimum mac-to-tot ratio.
author: Laura G.

description:
Oh, Bullitt. You do me so good.

Went on a Sunday for (bottomless mimosa) brunch.  Came at 10:45, and the benedict did not disappoint, yet again. Mimosas ended at 3pm. Stayed till 6pm. Danced and drank the day away, and not once did the waitress ask or allude to us leaving.  The bartender sent over shots.  He played some techno. A good time was had by all.  Work did not happen the next day.
author: Laura C.

description:
Happy Hour consists of 25 cent chicken wings and 2-for-1 beers. 3pm-7pm.

If you value your taste buds, do not order the atomic flavored chicken wing. Unless you feel like doing something stupid. Or have a mouth of steel. My lips and tongue were on fire for a good 30 minutes..FIRE. And I am not a noob to spicy cuisine, if that's what you're thinking. The flavor of the wing is good if you could get over the excruciating pain. They should start offering milk on tap....The buffalo and bbq wings are yummy too.

Anyway, the tachos were delicious! Tater tots fried to perfection, topped with nacho cheese, guac, sour cream, salsa, olives, jalapenos, etc.

Very interesting choice of music. Top 40s mixed with a whole bunch of randomness.
author: Moraia W.

description:
PROS:
- Pretty hopping on a Wednesday night
- Food served til 1:30AM, and a good variety
- A nice place to relax and have a nightcap with friends/co-workers during the week
- Intimate settling, relatively young crowd (mid 20s/ early 30s)

CONS:
- The sliders were severely under-cooked, maybe medium-rare by default
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This bar sponsored my wife's softball team, so natch, we went there for some pre-gaming, pre-game. I told this was a team member's neighborhood bar, so I was envisioning something kind of divey. It is not divey. 

Classy, but not pretentious or overly expensive. They have a decent selection of beers. I love me some Trumer, so I'm always happy when a bar has it on tap. And they have a fantastic Monday night special: $10 for a burger and any beer. The burgers are gourmet, not just plain old hamburgers. They come with tatter-tots, not fries, which is cool. (Hooray, reliving childhood!) 

Also, our waitress, whose name I can't recall, was fantastic at remembering who ordered what, and how to split the check, considering we had most of a softball team there eating and drinking.
author: Tom F.

description:
Shhhhhhhhh! Don't tell North Beach I've been cheating on her with Russian Hill!

Even if I don't meet my future husband here, at least I know I can order a basket of sweet potato tater tots to ease my lonely heart. Add a cold beer (or a vodka soda) and I may just be in Bar Heaven.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Truly amazed at this place, been here twice now, once for a delicious brunch with a group of friends. We had an absolute blast and the food and service were too notch. The second and more recent visit was for wing Wednesday for 25 cent wings! I was expecting cheap little wings with no meat on them for 25 cents a piece but man was I wrong. The wings were full of meat and different sauce options, I went for buffalo and a sweet habanero I believe it was. I got the atomic hot sauce on the side, wayyyyyyy too hot don't do it! This place has great deals and I'll definitely be going back.
author: Zino M.

description:
Vapid Marina people
Nice enough wait staff
More bourbon and totchos please
author: Joshua W.

description: Absolutely LOVE their 25 cent wing Wednesdays, such a great deal. Wide selection of beers, service is pretty good, and the female bartender is friendly. Would definitely recommend as a great place to grab a snack and/or beer with friends
author: Alex S.

description:
Had the tot-chos (nachos made with tater tots instead of chips), truffle tots, and Sierra Nevadas.  Great snack!

Will definitely have to come back again - they have bottomless mimosas til 3pm on weekends.
author: Theresa N.

description:
I can always count on having a great time at Bullitt. It's gets super crowded, but not the gross kind. A fun crowd and awesome bartenders. We always seem start and/or end the night here.

And who can beat their free cab service?! JC is da bomb! He even picks us up from the sand dunes...(aka the sunset)
author: Giana M.

description: After just taking a late flight into SF and checking- in we wanted to grab a drink somewhere local, fun, where we didn't have to get too ready. A friend recommended us to check out Bullit so we did.   The place was packed when we got there but had no problems getting in.  As we made our way to the bar we were greeted by a bartender with an Australian accent, she was wonderful!  So if you head to Bullit hook up Ivana, totally courteous, quick with service, and she takes good care of her customers.  One thing I loved best about this place was everyone in there was into just having a good time, I didn't see anyone on their cell phones. SAD to say but that is very rare here in LA. Bullit! Definitely somewhere I'd go back to. I heard they get pretty crazy during football games too..a good crazy that is.
author: Tiffany R.

description: New to the neighborhood was looking to grab some eats with a few friends on a weekend afternoon. After checking the ever trusted yelp decided like this place sounded worthwhile and was glad I did. Nice casual atmosphere, server was helpful, good music and drinks, and the food was a bit more creative than the usual greasy bar fare. Enjoyed the specialty Tots, Macs, and Burger sections. Ended up having the cobb salad which was delicious and plentifully portioned. Hubbs had one of the specialty burgers and the tachos, thats right, nacho tots. Ingenious. He also had the infamous 40 served in a paper bag along with a special surprise which gave the table a good laugh. It was tasty and not super over-priced which can always be scary in this city. I hope to come back for Tacho Tuesdays or maybe check out the late night scene sometime, although I hear it can be pretty packed.
author: Nicole Z.

description:
Holy crap this place is SO much better than Bar Johnny (it's predecessor). 

The walls are warm and welcoming, the TVs are strategically places and there's ample seating. Oh, and the bathrooms are CLEAN! As a chick, you have no idea how awesome it is to walk into a crowded bar (during the World Cup Final), elbow your way to the restrooms in the back, and find relief when you realize nothing smells like urine. GLORIOUS!

Oh, and the beer is nice and cold. Ahhh. Doesn't get better than that!
author: Shachi B.

description: So so crowded and small. Nothing really special or distinctive about this place. Decent music!
author: Alexandra W.

description: Was here on a Saturday night for a friend's bachelorette party, its a cool space (and maybe the food is better) but I just had drinks. It was so crowded though and the people got rougher as the night went on. I'll probably make my way back sometime after another Nick's Taco binge
author: Analisa S.

description: Nice people and great drinks. I have been there for brunch, dinner and just for drinks too. The bartenders and waitresses are very friendly and the food is great. Recommend the bloody marys.
author: Sri S.

description: So if you happen to get the munchies late at night and in the mood for a friendly place with good tunes, this is the place. Not sure what it's like earlier in the night but when I went I didn't expect them to be still serving food. Well, they did. The bartender was very friendly, the chicken tenders were amazing and the vibe was just perfect.
author: Johnny A.

description:
I was pulled into this place because a friend told me that they had whiskey on tap. I've never heard of that concept before so I thought, "why not?"

The bar is small but the staff is really friendly. Great for Happy Hour or game nights, although don't go after 9pm most nights if you're looking for food because of how crowded it gets. But if you do get there in time for food, ORDER TOTCHOS! Always order that before anything else, and I recommend any Mac 'n Cheese dishes they have. Always great!
author: Mathurin K.

description:
I know, I get pretty generous with my four stars--BUT this place is solid.  Where else can you get bottomless mimosas for $15 (without a required entrée purchase)?  OK fine....Del'Uva in North Beach...but I digress...

Fun scene, friendly waitstaff, great people watching.  Haven't had the food...but I'll be honest, I'd rather drink my calories.  Cheap shots of J-Mo.  Bathroom wall dispenser where you can buy condoms and/or a 5-hour Energy!  

There is an upstairs that can be rented out for private parties.  All in all, the music is bangin', the scene is wild, and you're guaranteed a good time at Bullitt.  If not, stumble down any which way on Polk street, and you'll be sure to find somewhere to whet your whistle.  

OH and 40 ouncers served in paper bags...need I say more??!
author: Christina H.

description:
I had an awful experience here and would not recommend this bar to anyone. The bartender was very rude and short with us. After ordering a round of drinks, we decided to order some appetizers but could not decide which ones. The bartender must have had some issues or was having a bad day, but she poured out our drinks (which we already paid for) and called the bouncer over to have us kicked out because we were taking too long to order (seriously). 

We were not demanding her attention or anything, just looking over the menu. She was standing over us and rushing us for about 30 seconds before she snapped. We tried to speak with the manager but he "wasn't around". The staff treated us like dirt and the whole experience was infuriating and embarrassing.
author: Tommy P.

description: I really enjoyed my experience here...it was tough to figure out what to order since most things sounded really good.  I eventually decided on the Burger and Tachos and those were all good choices.  The burger was a good burger with some juicy and tasty meat.  The "Tachos" were tater-tots with the treatment of nachos so they were covered with cheese, sour cream and salsa - this was a unique and tasty treat...trashy comfort food and perfect for a Friday night starting off a weekend.
author: Ken G.

description:
I didn't get food here, just came for a couple drinks, but this place was PACKED.  I guess that's to be expected of a popular bar on a Friday night, but still, finding a place to sit down took forever.  My friends and I ended up just waiting around by a table to grab it when the other group left.  Even besides trying to find seating, just moving around the bar was an adventure in itself (and this was while sober).  Trying to get from the front where we were sitting over to the bathroom in the back was basically a journey of squeezing past the many other people who couldn't find a place to sit down; not the most pleasant experience.  
On the positive side, they do have a nice ambience with decent music and a couple tv's to watch sports on.
I've only been here twice, and fairly briefly both times, so I'll try to write another review when I get another chance to come back here.
author: Keith C.

description:
Regular Tots, Sweet Potato Tots, Tots smothered in cheese or whatever. 

Loud house music,  great bartender, doorman, crowd.

Lots of good looking people...

I guess the only complaint I have is waiting for the bathroom, or getting from one side of the bar to the other.  Its got a narrow elongated look to it.

Bonus, upstairs is like a hedonistic pleasure palace. Dangerous...
author: leahnora r.

description: Not sure what was more on the edge, the fire code violations resulting from this insanely crowded place or the man in the car trunk on the ride after. The latter was more fun.
author: Zak R.

description:
I am probably Bullitt's biggest fan in the universe. This place is the bomb dot com, and you're truly missing out on SF's bar scene if you've never been here. I love Bullitt with all my heart for a variety of reasons:

1) It's located right near a bunch of other barts right on Polk Street (Greens Sports, Rouge, the Buccaneer, Tonic, etc) - awesome location and is convenient if you live in the Polk St area!
2) Bartenders are super nice and so much fun. 
3) It's one of the only casual bars in SF that plays EDM (the bartender/DJ is awesome - I requested Kaskade and Dada Life and he gladly agreed to my request)
4) The drinks are reasonably priced and there is Makers on tap! So rad. I've never seen this before.
5) The food is amazing - some nights (I think Tuesdays) are $5 for the entire menu all night. My favorite item on the menu is the mac n cheese, hands down. You have to get it -- it'll melt in your mouth. It's oozing with cheesy goodness... it's clearly a recipe for a heart attack but it's just so freaking amazing. 
6) A hidden gem here is the upstairs room. I had two of my birthday parties here - you just have to pay a flat fee to rent it out ahead of time and they'll have a bartender up there. It's super fun and can hold about 40-50 people easily and it basically feels like a private party!
7) It's a versatile place. I've come here for happy hour, champagne brunch, dinner, just to go out on weekends, and also after EDM concerts in the city. You can come here for just about any event and you'll always have a great time.
8) Good crowd. Not douchey.

Bullitt does get packed on weekends, but this place is truly so much fun and by far my favorite place in the city and my go-to on a weekly (and sometimes daily) basis. I love you Bullitt!
author: Priya G.

description:
This place is trendy and cool on Polk street. I like the hanging lights from the bar- yes lighting can change my review of a place. 

The prices are cheap here and the bathroom is clean. The food I thought was very fried and greasy, but I mean it is a bar. 

Not a bad place one of the best I have been to on Polk.
author: Aneliese R.

description: Great place to go for some fair priced drinks and delicious bar food.  Buffalo wings are fantastic and also try the spicy chipotle wings.  Younger crowd which leads to an energetic environment.  Perfect place to go watch a game!
author: Matthew H.

description: Great location on Polk street and awesome burgers. Their burgers are definitely above average. I'd take a Bullitt burger over Polkers across the street any day (and Polkers makes a good burger). And a plus: you can drink alcohol.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I wasn't a Bar Johnny regular but I was definitely a fan, especially of their burgers. After not visiting for a while I was surprised to see Bullitt in its place. Slightly skeptical but still hopeful, I meandered in with Phil H. for some drinks and grub. 

We sat down at a community table where others were already dining. The dude next to me was chowing down on what appeared to be tater tots smothered in cheese, guacamole, and sour cream. "What is THAT?!" I asked him, completely awe struck. They were tot-chos, like nachos, but tot-chos. I almost fell out of my chair with excitement. 

I ordered the turkey burger with a side of tot-chos. As soon as it arrived I gorged myself on the tots, took a few bites of my burger, and was epically full in what seemed like seconds.
