Disappointed that I couldn't get the last few bites of cheesy, potato-y goodness down my stomach, I resigned myself to finishing off my blackberry-somethin' cocktail, and sat there in a fuzzy food coma. Mmmmmmmm, so nice. 

Next time, it's just the tot-chos, screw the burger.
author: Julia N.

description: Wing Wednesday (25 cent wings) were decent, they were served kinda cold. One drink minimum to get the wing special. Service was above average
author: Scott H.

description:
Anyplace that has Maker's on tap is a place I'm going to be a fan of! 

This place is seriously a good time - we've come in a couple of times with friends, and have gorged on tots and imbibed in drinks. Did I mention they have Maker's on tap?? YES! Most of my favorite drink friends start with burbon =)

It's loud and the ratio of hipsters to dorks (such as myself) is pretty high. I don't mind hob-knobbing it with the skinny-jean set as long as they don't knock over my Maker's and Coke ;)

Service is off and on - but I would expect as much when it gets crazy busy in there!

My favorite has to be the tot-choes...it's such a strange and unusual concoction - but somehow it works!!! Other favorites include the truffle tots, and their burgers. Don't eat the garlic fries if you're on a date - the mouth funk after will guarantee you're not going to be getting lucky!
author: Christy L.

description:
I had heard great things about Bullitt's brunch so when we popped in for dinner, I was hoping the same would ring true for their dinner menu. I was immediately in love when I read through their menu: tater tot bar, grilled cheese bar, mac & cheese bar and a burger menu to die for. You can order a regular burger, a bison burger, chicken or a veggie burger (my choice) and choose 1 of 15 or so ways to have it doctored up. When our food arrived, I was not disappointed. On my first visit, I ended up with the veggie burger and a side of sweet potato tater tots (great all the way around!) and my second run-in with Bullitt brought me face-to-face with an Italian-style grilled cheese that has made me a grown-up grilled cheese convert. Grilled basil, mozzarella and tomato with a side of tomato soup? What's not to like?! 

I've been with people that have had the bison burger, regular burger (done up a few different ways), salads, fries, tater tots, tot-chos (tater tots prepared like nachos) and everyone has been more than happy when we've departed. The best part is that it's soooo reasonably priced. You can grab a meal for around $10 (if that)! The drinks are also great and for anyone that's interested, they have Maker's Mark and Fernet on tap! I'm excited to give this place a whirl for brunch -- definitely an awesome local spot that's going to be a new go-to.
author: Shannon E.

description: The food was good, but the service was mediocre. After sitting for a few minutes at a table I had to go get my own menu and after a bit I attracted a server. After I got my check for 16 bucks I gave the server a 20 and got no change. I was going to tell her to keep the change anyway, but I prefer to have a choice in the matter.
author: William C.

description:
The spot to be on America's biggest partying holidays, Halloween and New Year's Eve! 

I spent those respective holidays here and the music have been great, the drinks very reasonably priced and the crowd just AWESOME! 

Even though my group of friends took up a space about 2 ft x 2 ft, we had a GREAT time! WILL BE COMING BACK! 

Fun facts:
Halloween: I was able to buy 40 oz Mickey's in a paper bag
NYE: CHAMPAGNE bottles with champagne glasses!
author: A W.

description:
What a great place for happy hour! Their drinks are reasonably priced but what really caught my eye was their tater tot and mac & cheese selections. Who remembers tater tots from elementary school hot lunches? They get a full make over here at Bullitt. There are a few different tot choices including Totchos, which are basically nachos with all the toppings minus the tortilla chips and replaced with tater tots. DROOL! Tatchos are a perfectly sinful compliment to a nice cold beer. The Mission Mac & Cheese is also a delicious eat. It's cheesy, rich mac & cheese with tater tots, bacon, fried onions and topped with a fried egg.

All in all, I would recommend Bullitt if you're ok with indulging yourself to some oh so good but oh so bad food.
author: Melissa P.

description: It's my first time to note on yelp. This is a good place if you want a casual dinner/drink! We ordered daily special, which is tater tots with cheese. It's really good. The atmosphere and the music is good too.
author: Jinhui X.

description:
The good: 
The cheesy-tots are bomb, I like the ambiance, good versatile music and a decent combination between sit down and bar.
Good cocktail menu (I love the blood and sand) and friendly service.

The bad:
Go on weekdays, this place gets crowded in weekends really fast and it becomes extremely uncomfortable. 
Also, the food quality is not consistent, last night the burger was just not made well and it was a shame as I had much better experiences in the past.

Overall, I recommend this place as a mid-week dinner with drinks for friends or a date.
author: Assaf B.

description: This is a fun bar.  The crowd here is young and it was great for the night.  I haven't tried this place out for dinner but if you're visiting San Francisco and are looking for a good night out, consider Bullitt.
author: AK N.

description: The truffle tots are life changing.  And my mimosa glass was never empty.  If that doesn't sum up the perfect brunch spot in SF, I don't know what does.
author: Jessie H.

description: We went here for a Thrillist deal offering a burger, and bottomless bourbon and tots. It's a full bar, and I honestly can't remember too much about the alcohol - meaning I had a lot. Food was great, and the tots were excellent. Even though it was madness because of the deal, we were taken care of. I wish there was more to the theme, but it's better than being cheesy, I guess.
author: Cat N.

description:
Went there on Santacon.  Basically the entire place was packed with drunk santas.  The atmosphere was pretty fun.

Tot-chos were so bad, but so good...  Sometimes I just crave fried food topped with a lot of cheese and sauces - You know what I mean!
author: Michelle W.

description:
The space is small and very tight.  A good place to start or end a night - I wouldnt want to be here longer than an hour because it gets super packed.  It has a slightly 'bro' atmosphere but its not even close to Marina status.

I would have given this place 3 stars, but the chick who decked a guy for grabbing ass was inspiring.  (By inspiring, I mean madly entertaining).
author: Aasim K.

description:
This brunch review is dated by a few months; perhaps I'd put it out of my head until passing by a few times over the weekend. 

Bullitt appears to have all the elements of a good brunch, but executed none of them well on my visit. Fried chicken and waffles both failed from being overcooked. The mac plus tater tots also disappointed, managing to satisfy my craving for neither. TVs aren't optimal for watching games due to their placement. No bottomless drink specials for my friend while watching football and she couldn't have coffee either, though the server suggested it could be brought in from the outside.
author: Mike H.

description:
This is my current favorite scene on Polk.  My girl friends and I come here often enough to be recognized, and we will continue to drop in while it's hot.  It is one of the first stops on our Thursday night routine.  Most of what makes it an ideal watering hole has already been noted within other reviews.  You could humor me and read on anyway.

The food is delicious and not for the overly health-conscious. I crave the truffle tater tots and the mac & cheese with mushrooms and meat whenever I'm there, so I do my best to arrive with a half-empty stomach.  One night that I was there, the kitchen was completely out of tater tots, and I had one drink too many as a consequence. 

The bartenders are fun to watch, and their pours seem to be on the slightly heavy side (to me).  I believe that during the last few times I've been here, the same music playlist was playing.  The music goes well with the scene on the bartender side of the bar.  It's like a choreographed scene put to music, as the bartenders move with efficiency from one end of the bar to the other, pull bottles off the shelves, pour, shake, pour, spritz... 

Now for the best thing about this place... Even on Tuesday nights, it is crawling with eye-candy for women.  It is a bad choice of spots for a first date with a man who is not, let's just say, a part of the "elite" groups of male hotties and cuties that you can find here.  They arrive in clusters, and once the cluster has picked a spot in the place to occupy, the eye-contact game is on.

A guy friend of mine call this place a "Todd & Amy" bar.  He thinks every guy there looks like his name is Todd, and every girl looks like her name is Amy.  I see what he's saying... but don't necessarily agree.
author: Jennie Y.

description:
not a drinker but definitely down for any type of yummy (vegetarian) appetizers/snacks! i was drawn to bullitt because it has a TATER TOT BAR - SAY WHAT?! my cousin and i wanted to try the amazing grilled cheese and mac and cheese options as well, but we took the cue from fellow yelpers to try the totchos, and neighboring patrons to try the sweet potato tots. both were good, but the totchos definitely take the cake! if you are ever super hungry and can spare the bajillion calories, get the totchos! 

we went on $5 monday so we got both super duper big entrees for just $10, but next time i think we will just stick to one, or wait until we can get a group of friends to go. love the laidback ambiance, and the service was great!
author: Julia H.

description:
I had a gift certificate to Bullitt that I wanted to use before leaving SF (won it through a Blue Angel Vodka SF trivia contest...yay vodka and yay trivia.)  Came in early evening on Easter Sunday - nice that they were open on a holiday.  Bar was actually packed, tons of folks watching the basketball game that was on, and seating seemed really well arranged to see the (many) screens.

We grabbed a table at the back and ordered a couple of drinks, the Black Tea Twist with honey vodka and  something tequila-y, the name escapes me and I didn't make a mental note because it didn't taste that great.  I had high hopes for the Black Tea Twist but it tasted like soap.  Our server was super-nice, efficient, and took our gift cert without a hitch.  The couple next to us ordered the grilled cheese which actually looked pretty amazing, but we were headed out to dinner at Nopa so we did not partake.  Overall Bullitt is a decent spot, but not somewhere I'd walk way out of my way for.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
I've got my love to give and its not to this place. 
The location is awesome and the ambiance is ok. 

As far as food goes it is horrible even for bar food. Another major downside is that the bathrooms are a dump and I recommend not even attempting to use them. 

The upstairs private area needs major improvements. It is stuffy and smelly. The carpets are damp and the lighting is nonexistent. 

This place is falling apart.
author: Dee C.

description: YUM!  One word - Tot-chos!  (tater tot nachos!)  The jalepeno poppers were also good.  They actually had a kick which I appreciate :)  The burger was just ok but they also have a mac and cheese bar that I would recommend trying out.  The drinks were good and pretty strong.  Our waitress was also friendly.  I recommend getting the sampler and including at least the tot-chos and sweet potato tots.  It did get packed so get there early if you can
author: Amanda K.

description:
I dropped in for lunch to go today. I had been wandering up and down Polk trying to decide what I wanted when I came across Bullitt on my way home. So I popped in to grab a burger to go because I've had food from there before and it's always tasty. 

I stepped into through the doorway and waited for a bit. They weren't busy and I could've helped myself to a seat but I felt silly bringing in my starbucks. So trying not to be rude I decided to stand and wait for the waitress, I figured "why not" they weren't busy so I assumed someone would help me. No such luck. The waitresses saw me, in fact I felt a little intimidated by the stink eye I received from across the room. One even passed me a few times and cleaned up a table that customers had just left. So I continued to stand there for a few minutes, hoping one of them would get the hint that I needed help but they seemed more concerned with talking to a friend sitting at the bar. 

Eventually I took a seat at the bar and the bartender immediately took my order. He was extremely helpful and very nice! In fact another bartender who came in a few minutes later also asked if I needed help! Eventually my food arrived, hot and ready to go in a nice plastic bag to help me carry it. 

I love their burgers and fries. However, if it wasn't for the outstanding service from the bartender on duty this review would have been less than stellar.

Maybe the waitresses should pay a little more attention to their customers instead of chatting on duty?
author: Mauri A.

description: I recently visited Bullitt with a bachelorette group. Had no issues with making a reservation thru their email system, and we didn't have to wait for our table when we arrived. (Another bonus!) We loved it! This place has a dive bar feel to it, and I just love that! Super chill and laid back. The menu was awesome...great comfort food! The truffle tater tots were to die for! Prices were super reasonable. No one had any complaints. I will definitely re-visit when I go back to the City.
author: Meagan L.

description:
How have I not seen anyone mention the 40oz BRASS MONKEYS! 

WINNING!!!!
author: Ruby R.

description: I've been to Bullitt a few times in the past year and visited a few times when it was called something else. It hasn't changed much over the past year or two. I'd go there more often if it weren't teeming with blonde lululemon drunkness douchebaggery. Good wings. Really good mac n cheese. Chimay for $5. Filet mignon for $13. It'd be a cool spot without its usual crowd.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
based upon how often my friends are in this place, you'd think I would have loved it the second I walked in. Sadly, I didn't. The set up is dark and swanky (in a good way) but there are multiple tv's with sports on. I love lounges, I love sports, but I'm not a fan when they meet. Had they some old 90's music videos on the tube, I'd bump the rating up to 4 stars. 

Price is reasonable for the standard drinking fair, but their house cocktails were all $10 plus. I ordered a whiskey sour and  have little to no idea what they served me. It had sweet and sour mix sure, but beyond that I couldn't tell you the ingredients. 

I'm undoubtedly going to end up there again so hopefully my experience will be a bit better.
author: Tony C.

description:
After a good drink or two at Martuni's, my boyfriend and I decided to grab a bite at Bullitt. Tip: Parking is HORRIBLE on a Saturday night regardless of how early it was. It was barely 9pm and it took over 20 minutes to dive into a parking space several blocks away. I guess it's more of a place to hang out as a local. We mainly came here for their food (truffle tots) and haven't heard much about the drinks. The place was a bit small, but we managed to find a seat.

Ordered the sampler platter for $9.95. It's a choice of three from their large selection of appetizers for such an amazing deal! The portions came out to be just right of each item. Ordering individual appetizers would have been overload for two people. We ordered the truffle tots, mac&cheese, and buffalo chicken fingers.

-The truffle tots were to die for! It was extra crispy with a hint of truffle oil. Mmmm, perfect on its own without any dipping sauce. Wow, I'm craving tots as I'm typing about this!
-The mac&cheese was delicious. Rich and cheesy pasta shells left strings of cheese hanging off my chin each bite.
-I was a little disappointed by the buffalo chicken fingers. I love love love buffalo sauce. I get it on pizzas, pastas, paninis, salad, etc... (Yeah, I over do it).  The batter was crispy on the chicken and drenched in a sauce that was too vinegary and spicy for me to enjoy. I can't complain since it's not your typical Wingstop where they specialize in chicken fingers.

I saw a filet mignon dinner with a side of mashed potatoes for $12.95. I wonder how legit that is?

DEFINITELY coming back here for the truffle oil tots though.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
A very intimate spot, but a fun place on Polk. The music is usually great and the ambiance fun. A great local spot. 

I have yet tried their tater tots but will update once I do.
author: Tif L.

description:
Great little place to catch a game. Tater Tots and Grilled-cheese selections are the perfect complement to anything being televised on the 4 big-screens. 

It gets a little mental a night. The 20-something's are definitely out in full force and the music requires you to yell across the table. 

Definitely a good time if that's what you're in a mood for. 

Service is great. Everyone is amazingly friendly and responsive.
author: Bryan T.

description:
Hold the phone- this place is a rockin bar. Despite a painful show of the Jets beating the Patriots I still had a good time.  

The bartenders and waiters were a blast. They all went out of their way, even with a rowdy bunch, to make sure glasses were filled and everyone was smiling. 

Icing on the cake-- the food was phenomenal (all though, like i said, my glass was never empty). We had a great group splitting buff chic salad, sliders, and SWEET POTATO tatter tots. Little slice o' heaven right there. 

FYI: Makers Mark on tap.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Absolutely love this place. Great daily specials and a very friendly staff - their Sunday brunch is fantastic.
author: Braunson C.

description:
Came here for happy hour last week...ironic since there are no happy hour prices but  the prices here are pretty decent.  $5 Chimays are always a plus in my book.  But what I absolutely loved and I mean LOVE about this place is that I found one of my favorite bartenders here and the waitress was AWESOME!  

It also didn't hurt that I fell head over heels with the truffle tots..oh how I love truffle oil and tots...we had 2 orders.  We also tried the grilled cheese sandwich which was absolutely to die for and I don't even really like cheese.  It came with a homemade tomato bisque and green salad (not iceberg).  The only thing I didn't like was the fried pickles...the batter was not good and it was a pickle spear.  Otherwise I am keeping this on my list of places to go to...especially since I want to try the other menu items!
author: Allison T.

description: Burgers, totchos (like nachos... but tater tots instead of chips), 40s, and Maker's Mark on tap. Do I really need to say anything else?
author: Alison B.

description:
Awesome food, service, and price!

Amy was our server and she was very friendly and always had a smile and made sure we had everything we wanted. Food came out  fast.

Had Felit  and friend had burger. excellent!

only 4 stars due to how loud it was
author: Shelley E.

description:
I came here last Friday to eat some dinner with a friend. The bar had a really nice atmosphere and my burger with tater tots was really good. They had a nice selection of beers too. 

Service was slow though and it's a little on the pricey side.
author: Yoni D.

description: This place is like a fraternity from the music to the sloppy drunk people to the guys aggressively hitting on girls. It's crowded but bartenders are pretty good about getting drinks out in a timely manner.
author: Amy C.

description: It's a fun bar if you're looking for a low-key place to go. I came here on a Tuesday night for some tacos, tachos, and margaritas. The beef and chicken taco were pretty good, I wasn't a fan of their fish taco. It could have been the fish? Not sure..but it was a $1 taco so can't really complain there. The tachos were good, but definitely really heavy. I think I enjoy the idea of tachos more than the actual dish. Also some crispy tater tots with a side of cheese to dip them in would have been great!! The margaritas were the best thing about that night, tasty and strong!
author: Emmie Y.

description: I always have a good time here! Good food, strong drinks, great company! Their tots are amazing, my favorite are their truffle tots. I've never had their tachos (tots + nachos) although my friends seem to love it. The people who work at Bullitt are also very friendly and attentive. My friends and I have a favorite employee - James. He always makes it a point to say hello when he sees us and is very attentive about keeping our table area clear (to make room for more drinks and tots, duh). Bottom line is go here if you are looking for a fun and casual environment to have drinks/food!
author: Jessica W.

description:
Bullitt is a staple on polk street. Whenever my friends and I can't decide where to eat this place never let's us down. With Mark holding down the bar you are always in good hands.

Pros:
Amazing burgers (bison meat as well), tots, and salads.

Cons:
Food often takes a while to cook, it's always slam-packed after 7pm on any popular night (tues, thurs, fri, sat).
author: Jason M.

description:
I have to give these folks props merely for doing what Ike's cannot.  That is how you put a Mozzarella Cheese Stick on a sandwich.  I got the Godfather burger here.  Cheese, marinara sauce and a cheese stick that was piping fresh (not limp and lukewarm).  Boy was that burger a slice of heaven.  I also got my tots doused in truffle oil.  I would probably marry a guy just for having lips that tasted perpetually of truffle oil.  That would be some expensive lip balm or his lips would have to be mushrooms.  Perhaps that wouldn't be such a great idea.  I did find the tots to be a little less crisp than I like.

Some warnings: this place is slender, so it can get a little crowded to eat at when it is fancying itself as more of a bar than a restaurant.  However, when drinking, why would you not want to be where Tots can easily be delivered to your mouth?
author: Jeremy G.

description: I went there for brunch to redeem a livingsocial voucher that friend purchased for me. Around 12:30pm it was so lough not even by the people but by the music which happens all the time and I still don't get it. I ordered BBQ pulled-back ribs sandwich with mozzarella sticks and side order of beer battered portobello mushrooms. I also ordered coffee and the witness brought the coffee w/o milk nor sugar so I had to ask for milk and then I had to ask for spoon and had sugar on me so I did ask her for it but I thought it was standard when once ordered coffee it comes hot with milk, sugar and spoon...well...not at this place. The coffee was cold. The food was fine/good for $9 but service needs to be improved. They have bottomless mimosas so she was busy but I will not return there.
author: Magda G.

description:
Totchos were pretty darn tasty! The boy and I shared the bison burger and shared a plate of tots with the table and we were stuffed!  I will definitely go back for more.  

The only thing lacking was the service.  Our waitress was inattentive and unavailable and we needed to flag down another server to get our settings, but hey, the food was good and that will definitely bring me back!
author: Dana L.

description: OK so my friend Andrei Z. got a sweet ass deal from Thrillist for all-you-can-drink-bourbon for an hour and a half so we had to go.  The deal also included a burger, two apps and unlimited tater tots so it was on! We got the wings as one of the appetizers and I have to say, they were pretty damn good.  Large wings buffalo style and really meaty.  The tater tots were nice and crunchy on the outside and still tender inside.  Great bar food!  We also had old fashioneds as our bourbon drink of choice to begin with and those were pretty solid too.  The burger was just OK, however.  Overall a pretty good experience but it's hard not be happy with the $15 deal we got.
author: Gene X.

description:
Came here on a Friday for happy hour with a few other teachers (teachers need to unwind too!) and it was chill spot.  I'm not sure of the price ranges because one of the teachers treated us to drinks since it was our first week at their school.  Bartender was nice. 

would definitely come back and try some of their food!
author: Jodi P.

description:
I admit that I can be a little judgmental sometimes. I went there 3 or 4 weeks ago on a Saturday afternoon and when I saw the crowd, I was expecting a bad experience surrounded by obnoxious Marina people.

I went ahead and ordered food. I mean why not. The Filet Mignon is listed for $13...... WHAT? come on, it can be a filet Mignon right? If it is, it has to be 2 ounces right? I gave it a shot.... medium rare. It was really good. Nice size, probably 5 ounces. Mashed potatoes and veggies. Got a Chimay with that and still paid less than $20.

I'd go again, I should go over the first impression and accept the fact that this is a place with overpriced drinks and under-priced tasty food.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Comfy bar with friendly bartenders and good drinks, but I think it's kind of expensive (specialty cocktails in the $9-$10 range).  The specialty cocktails are quite good, but they're a little on the sweet side for my taste.  

The jalapeno margarita was too spicy for my friend, but I thought it was just right.  I had a martini-style drink with vodka and chambord.  It was tasty, but maybe a little too sweet for my liking.  The same was true for the blackberry caipirinha.  If you're not drinking wine or beer and you don't like sweet cocktails, maybe stick with an old standard (gin & tonic, martini, etc.).

We went on a Monday and it wasn't crowded, so it was comfortable for catching up with a friend and chatting.  I can't vouch for how it is on a Thursday-Friday-Saturday.  It's probably pretty crowded, which wouldn't be my scene at all. 

We tried the appetizer sampler platter (we chose fried mozzarella, sweet potato fries and chicken fingers) and they were mediocre.  I would suggest trying something else (like one of the sandwiches or a burger).  Appetizers don't appear to be their strong suit.

If you like Maker's Mark and Fernet, you'll love this place because they have them on tap!  I also saw Olde English 40 oz. offered in a paper bag.  I have no idea who would want that, but I guess it appeals to the hipster PBR crowd.
author: Kimberly B.

description: Bartender was nice. But it is very small so it gets crowded and is hard to order drinks on weekends. Like their apple salad with chicken.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Had a living social coupon and live in the area, so I decided to check this place out. 

First impressions: cool atmosphere, modern feel, lots of mimosas, great tvs, decent deer selection on tap.

Then we sat down and ordered food... Very disappointed. I got the MAC & Cheese with sausage and onions: it was the smallest serving I've ever been served and it was 8$!! This may be acceptable if the grub was of high quality, but it was average at best. Worst of all the waitress offered no warning to the size and mocked me when inquiring on its size after it was served. 

Overall, this place looks great at face value, but once experienced leaves much to be desired and a lot to be frustrated about. Will not be returning.
author: Jason C.

description: This is the bar my iphone5 decided to commit suicide by plunging into the toilet. Yes I celebrated my 28th birthday here and had way too many Old Fashioneds. But it's not the bar's fault that I'm a clumsy idiot! I like this bar a lot. My friends and I had a great time! I love that they play house music which is always a plus for me since I like it. Parking is just really abysmal and a handful of my friends grumbled about it, but I did give them fair warning that parking is shit in the area. Other than that it was a successful birthday celebration here!
author: Rochelle I.

description:
Before I pass out into the food sleeper hold that this place has put me in, I had to review it due to the awesomeness it seems to bleed.

1. Playing Michael Jackson and my favorite James Brown song within 10 minutes. EXCELLENT first impression! 

2. Super hot waitress. That's all...she was hot, thus a yelp star.

3. Tot chos - Can't EVER go wrong when guacamole and American cheese is put on top of something. I was honestly expecting it to be a appetizer type thing( I went with a buddy) and it was a huge plate of tater tots with the above glorious toppings, plus salsa, sour cream and jalapenos. These alone would have been enough, but I was on a mission...and I had a groupon, so I had no choice but to pig out.

4. Beer selection - so-so. The mason jars they come in are cool, but I think I would have preferred a bottle or at least a normal frosty glass.

5. Great burger selection - I got the bleu cheese and bacon burger. The waitress didn't ask how I wanted it cooked, but see #2. The burger was no Pearls Deluxe, but come on - it's like comparing the US Marines to the Salvation Army - no competition. The sweet potato fries were ok, but kind of flimsy.

After sharing a plate of totchos, a burger with sweet potato fries and two beers, I was stuuuuuuuuuuuffed. This place is now in the Hall of Awesome for me. Granted this was my first trip, and I haven't been there at night (I shall) but either way, they made a great impression.
author: Nic K.

description:
I used to come to this spot when it was Bar Johnny for chicken and waffles. I have been here twice since it changed into Bullitt and the first time was forgettable, but my last experience was great! 

They have totally revamped this place...from the decor to the menu it has a new feel. I have only been here for brunch but I am excited to make this one of my regular spots. 

I love how customizable the menu is. They have the tater tot bar, mac & cheese bar, burger bar, slider bar and even a full bar with makers and fernet on tap! $15 for bottomless mimosas and I'm golden. 

I ordered mac & cheese with bacon, it did lack flavor a little but I added some buffalo sauce to it and made it pretty damn amazing. I also ordered the pulled pork sliders which were so tender and delicious. 

Our server was on the top of her game.. 5+ stars for service, my mimosa and water glass was never empty and she was super personable and spunky. I can't wait to come back here. Love it!
author: Katie H.

description: Now, to go along with the Makers Mark on tap, they've got Fernet on tap as well! Do these guys know San Francisco drink culture or what?!?!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Reliably good tatertots and sliders. Our go-to neighborhood burger spot. Also almost always order a Guinness here. The pour, though not the best, isn't bad.

Best when empty-ish. Too much of a scene when it is packed with Marina types.
author: Nicole Sooah C.

description: I'm actually sitting here with a drink right now. At least half the people here are on drugs. If I was 21 and on exctasy then I would be having a blast, but I'm not. Club music and drugs at 6:30 on a Sunday...I don't get it. I am sooo uncomfortable right now.
author: Brianne Y.

description:
they had a heavy pour on my jamo/rox and they have a tater tots menu so...

3 stars for you, Bullitt.

:)
author: Lauren B.

description: I like the decor, but it gets to cramped most times and you feel like you're in a sardine can. Wing wednesday much like Dr. Teeth is Aces though.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description:
I had no clue that Bulitt even served food.  Every time I've passed it (usually on a Friday or Saturday night) it has been so packed to the brim that I'm scared to even set foot inside.  It's one of the loudest most happening bar on the block!  

My fiance and I had lunch here on a sunny Sunday morning and to my surprise there were already tons of people getting wasted bright and early!  It was loud and bustling and we ended up sitting at the edge of a large table with some other patrons, who happened to be already blasted.  I could hear the girl in the group screaming, all red in the face, the entire time, it was super classy for a Sunday morning.  Besides all that the restaurant was a bit dark, especially when its super nice out - just gives you an eerie feeling.  

The food however was a plus, I found it very enjoyable.  While the menu is stacked with terribly greasy bar foods there are a few menu items that really caught my eye.  I love chicken and waffles!   My fiance had the tomato soup and a grilled cheese which looked good.  He claimed the tomato soup was so thick that it tasted like pasta sauce, haha.  The tatchos seemed pretty interesting as well, but I couldn't bring myself to eat it!  

We had fun, had a couple drinks and headed back out into daylight.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I really wanted to dislike Bullitt. It took over the space vacated by one of my favorite burger joints, Bar Johnny. Plus I was a little put off by the theme (Old English 40's served in a paper bag with a condom? What is this, Kozy Kar?!?) But one bite of the Bullitt burger and I put my preconceived ideas behind me.

First off, when you order the burger you have a ton of options - beef, turkey, grilled chicken, your choice of cheese, then a plethora of sides to choose from: fries, tater tots, onion rings, mac n cheese, just to name a few. Did I mention that you get your burger and a side for $6.95? Quite a bargain considering the amount of food and overall quality of the burger.

We sat at the communal table up front which was a great way to people watch and a nice way to meet some new friends. The restaurant was jumping on a Tuesday evening - clearly the word is out about the affordable menu at Bullitt. Did I mention that they have Fernet AND Maker's Mark on tap? While I'll miss the Bar Johnny burger there is definitely a place in my heart for Bullitt. Good stuff.
author: phil h.

description:
A friend took me here after work for drinks since she had been the previous weekend at night and it was packed with people watching the Stanford football game and having a jolly old time.  At 5:30 pm on this Friday, however, it felt more like a quiet sit down restaurant/bar with people talking in hushed voices.  It was a weird ambiance to try to relax and have a drink in. Plus, they had no happy hour deals! A bar that doesn't have any happy hour deals either a) thinks it's too good to give people any sort of discount or b) missed the memo that everyone else, including the $3 pitchers at their neighbor Cresta's, has realized that this is what people are looking for at 5:30 after work. Either way, we realized this was not the place we wanted to have a drink at so went next door. 

Maybe I'll return on gamenight.
author: Eliot C.

description: Prepare for a scene, but great fun watching all the folks' antics.  Good drinks, and can't miss with totchos!
author: jeremy d.

description: The bar foods were top notch. Mac N Cheese and tator tots are the bomb. The Mac N Cheese is a must try. It'll sit in your belly for hours, but it's worth it. The sliders were not great, but I was told the burgers are the bomb. Wish they had a better beer selection.
author: John H.

description: This was a fun place to go after work. We all got 40's served in a brown paper bag and drank way too much. Nothing but the best. Overall, would go back again.
author: David Lyle M.

description:
Unlimited champagne brunch. Tots galore. 

Bacon & Bleu tots will rock your world but not as much as the mac 'n cheese tots. Imagine deliciously creamy and cheesy homemade shells and cheese sprinkled with scallions, plopped onto a scoop of tater tots. Sinfully delicious. Best creation ever.

Crazy spicy turkey burgers. Nicely flavored and moist fried chicken. Not so good waffles. Zucchini fries seem like a good idea, but they are not...thick tempura batter does not make for a nice zucchini fry. 

This place gets crowded and they only take reservations for parties of 8 or more. Come early.

Oh, Makers & Fernet on tap and if you're feeling particularly frisky, they serve 40s of OE in brown bags.
author: Karena Q.

description:
Checked out this place last Friday.

Parking was very challenging as expected, but did luck out eventually with a very close spot.  But I did circle for 5-10 minutes.

Food was good, and since I had Guinness, the drinks were good as well.  Cute girls working as well as customers, so that's always a plus for me.

Nice big screen TV, but that was a bit irrelevant for me as there was no significant game going on... but I can see how nice it would be for a game.

It's a bit small place, so seating will also be challenging depending on when you arrive.  Luckily, we came early and had a good seat.  Overall, had a great time!
author: Eric P.

description:
The verdict is still out on this Bar Johnny replacement. 

I'm a semi-dedicated Steve McQueen fan, so was excited to see what a bar that took their name from one of his classic films was all about. I mean Bullitt still defines car chases, and being shot around Russian Hill, well any San Franciscan has a duty to show some respect (http://www.rjsmith.com/bullitt-locations.html). 

So going in this week, I was a bit underwhelmed. There wasn't really any sense of time or place here, nor any real homage to the movies. Well, the menu had a pretty fun burger list, with each type named after a film, but really that's not much to go on.

This isn't really Bullitt's fault, I guess, but then again I know if I ran a bar I'd believe in a concept and hold fast. There are no less than five plasma TVs plastered around the area, so you just can't miss whatever sports game is on. Trouble is, if you're looking for style and ambiance, you're perhaps hoping for cool films to be shown. Something to honor and indicate why Bullitt matters, at least. 

On the positive, they have an honest-to-goodness Fernet tap, which is unheard of, I think, and kind of douchey in a good way. They also have perhaps the best - and I am being serious here - mozzarella sticks in town. I don't know they put in the breading, and maybe it's a higher grade of cheese, but I could have eaten the entire plate of them. The communal closeness of all the tables is also fun, especially when you get to watch dudes in suits try and flirt with the girls at the next table ("Yeah, I work at Chuck Schwab. I can pull some.") 

Would Frank Bullitt hang out here? Probably not. To quote the film, "You sell whatever you want, but don't sell it here tonight." But that doesn't mean you and I won't.
author: Nish N.

description:
Bullitt in 16:

Good burgers (Street is better)
Good vibe.
Cute girls.
Good boy's night out bar.
Service inconsistent.
author: Scott W.

description:
Sleek, dark woods. Low light, modern fixtures. Large TVs. 

The combination of the above makes Bullitt a bar you could feel comfortable taking a low key date to, but also a place where you could catch a soccer game with your buddies. 

On our weeknight visit, most of the clientele were dressed in business attire. It looked like they may have stopped by for an after work drink....and then never left. My friend and I who were visiting SF from Seattle and had no idea of where we were, arrived at the conclusion that we were in a yuppie bar, but a far less annoying version. 

Beers are priced a bit higher than I would normally expect. I believe it was $4 or $4.50 for a bottle of pbr, which is straight up lunacy to this girl.
author: Emily T.

description:
Enough This place.  I keep coming back..  Great food.   Period. After today, screw it.  Friday and they open at 3.  Nope!,,  this isn't the first time they arbitrarily change their times.       I planned my lunch around this, only to have a locked door in my face.

Screw it.    I keep coming in here with drunks puking...   Erratic hours...  Industry Mondays?   Huh?          Bottomless mimosas?     I don't even drink them, but shit......  After noon on a Saturday, every other person packing this place has been on them for 3 hours.    

Really so sad.   The food and staff is great.   Again....I waited until Friday at 3 and they still couldn't get it right.

Bye bye, Bullitt.  I know you won't miss me, what with your heards 
 of drunks.  But I'll miss you.....
author: julie M.

description:
The bar food here is pretty quality. I've eaten here at least a couple times and was pleasantly surprised. Jason M. introduced me to this place about a year ago. I constantly will go on a night out with the boys. The only issue is that the flow of the bar is terrible, you're constantly getting smooshed at peak times. 

Overall a thumbs up.
author: Michael S.

description:
I came here for a birthday party last month.  I generally stay away from that part of town because I'm a princess and I like to drive and there is virtually no parking in the area...but because I love my friend I came to her party.  She rented out the upstairs which scores lots of bonus points for having a stripper pole in the center of the room.  Upstairs it was cozy, there is seating and a bar and someone put out fans at some point and you can look down at the bar below you.  I think had I come here regular, my rating might be different because it took about 15 mins for me to actually get through the throngs of drinkers to the outside.

I did enjoy myself though.  I'd rent out the upstairs.  I'd totally dig my friends abusing the stripper pole.
author: Sonya T.

description: Bullit is one of my favorite bars.  There is nothing too special about this place, but there does not need to be.  Amazing bartenders, amazing service, the people truly create the experience and atmosphere.  I highly recommend the 40's in a paper bag for football games, and the bottomless mimosas on Sunday!  The habanero wings and tater tots are incredible, and we've never been able to order just one!  A huge shout out to this bar always being great, as we've frequented Bullit often.
author: Daniel G.

description:
You know you've been to Bullitt when you wake up with a condom in your purse (unused) and you have a fatty headache from drinking 40's out of a paper bag all night. ....bullitt serves 40's, in a paper bag, with a condom....if you don't knoooowww, now ya know!

This is a super chill cozy little bar that serves pretty decent bar food (go for the wings or the burger), the bartenders are attentive and friendly and the vibe is hip, fun and non pretentious like it's sister bar (Tonic). 

Win for Russian Hill! 

p.s. they have Fernet on tap!!!!!
author: Kristy M.

description:
Bullitt features energetic and quality music that reflects the crowd quite well. I have been to Bullitt on multiple occasions since moving to the city and even when the bar is jam packed (Friday & Saturday nights) the service is exceptional. A great place to end your night, or start it up!

Where else can you get a 40 in a brown bag? hahaha
author: Travis P.

description: I don't know..there's a million other bars around this area where I would rather spend my money. This is the kind of bar you go when you absolutely need to let the world know you gotta get laid. Sorry, but the truth hurts.
author: Alexia R.

description: i don't know if it's the sweaty overcrowded dance floor filled with 20-somethings ready to have a good time, the constant flow of hip-hop, wing wednesdays, the friendly staff, the selection of tator tots or the convenient location - but, bullitt always keeps me coming back.
author: Mandy A.

description:
2.5 stars, based on many visits over time.

When Bullitt first opened, it was AMAZING. The burgers we solid and the plethora of fried foods were great! My favorite was the homemade mozzarella sticks, and the truffle mac was also fantastic.

Drinks are drinks, although I find it ridiculous to pay $9 for a 40 of OE.

The space is good, and it is cool that they have the secret upstairs room. I like the Bullitt is THERE- it's good to know you can fall back on this place.

HOWEVER
The kitchen is now SOOO hit or miss, with wayyyy too many misses. I have had to send back a lot of stuff, and I don't normally send things back unless they are improperly cooked or not what was promised on the menu. Bullitt is the only place I've ever had to send stuff back because it was DISGUSTING.
1. Ordered a burger medium rare- it came out RAW. Like, barely cooked on the outside, and freezing cold in the middle. If I ate it, I would probably have been in danger of getting salmonella or something.
2. Truffle mac, once may favorite, came out gloppy, sticky, and with no truffle oil. Completely unappetizing.
3. "Homemade" cheese sticks? Now the same frozen ones you get at Denny's. Undercooked, to top it all off.
4. Table service is mediocre at best, and at times quite dingy veering on neglectful and rude. Bartenders are always helpful.

Now, the bad doesn't happen all the time, but it happens too often. It's happening more often now. And when it's bad, it's REALLY bad.

I'm off the Bullitt train now, but it was fun while it lasted. 

If you want a drink in this area, head to the Buc. If you're hungry, go across the street to Polkers.
author: Katie H.

description:
The Pros: nice brunch spot to meet with friends, excellent bottomless mimosas, delicious tater tots -- much better than the kind you had as a kid (try the blue cheese & bacon). Friends said the eggs Benedict was outstanding, and I thought the side salad was great. Decent prices. Large TVs showing current sports games. Saturday morning was busy, with a young crowd, and weekend parking on Polk is acceptable. Two bathrooms (go to the one in the back), in-house ATM is convenient.

The Cons: Service was a bit slow, albeit the place was busy with people drunk by noon. Had to flag down the waitstaff several times to get drinks for a party of 9. Asked for water 3 times before it was brought to the table. The grilled cheese sando was nothing spectacular, too much bread in the bread-to-cheese ratio, but the tomato soup made up for it.

All-in-all: A nice place to meet or bring out-of-town folks to. The menu is nice for brunch, and has something for everyone. Great brunch/lunch/sports spot. Bottomless mimosas, again, are always awesome. You will run into grade A quality d-bags, but spending time with people you like definitely makes up for it. I'd go back for the tater tots.
author: Claire P.

description:
I have never actually been to Bullitt but tried to reserve it for a party.  We had been in contact with their party planner for many weeks and had it reserved for a party in a month.  We went to check the space out and found out from the bartender that it was no longer being used for parties because of a fire that happened several weeks prior.  I understand that fires can't be helped but we had spoken to the party planner post-fire and she never mentioned that there was a possibility the space wouldn't be available.  Anyway, we called the party planner and she was hardly apologetic and not accommodating at all.  I completely understand that accidents happen and things cannot be helped.  What bothers me is how the situation was handled.  A simple e-mail or phone call would have been lovely.  We were left a month before a party without a space.  And we had printed out invitations professionally that had to be completely re-done.  

I am sure the bar is pretty fun and that's exactly why we chose to have a party there.  I say, don't plan a party here!
author: Dana G.

description:
Out of Bud Light two Sundays in a row. 
Get your shit together Duncan!
author: Ryan M.

description:
A gang of us took advantage of the 2 people for $29 Thrillist deal (non-stop tots and bourbon drinks plus 2 burgers and 2 apps) and it was incredible. SO MUCH FOOD! And yummy! Great staff too! Such a bummer that the deal sold out so fast...would've loved to make it another time perhaps with another circle of friends. I will definitely be on the lookout for other offers...and even drop in without a deal if in the 'hood.  This space is terrific for all sorts of folks. (Have to admit...I was expecting it to be a little douchier based on the macho presentation it got on Thrillist) 
I'd suggest a smaller size on the tots for that deal though. The platters of tots were a tad overwhelming. I would've liked to sample more of the available flavors since they all sound so awesome. Serving them in the size bowl of the Mac n Tots would suffice, I'd think.
author: Bob S.

description:
Fuck the haters, this place is great!  The drinks are bold and creative (I say bold because there's one in particular that's love or hate) and I got a literal blast out of the olde-english-in-a-bag.  We were able to reserve a large table for our group and generally had a good time.  The waitstaff were very friendly but a little harried and hard to get hold of.  Good random snack foods as well.

It really should have some sort of Bullitt motif, after all, the bar is actually named for the movie.
author: Scott S.

description:
Danger in a brown paper bag. This is what I was served in Bullitt by my work buddies on my arrival in SF. Let me divulge further; 40 malt liquor in a brown paper bag, served with a condom, for $9. A condom? Really? Having already imbued far to much booze earlier in the evening, I spent more time enjoying the darkened, trendy surroundings and surveying the contemporary cocktail list than actual drinking the mammoth bottle of beer, that I'll admit was good, but just too big. Service was with a smile and the waitress dealt with us efficiently. 

This is a good bar, I'd be happy to frequent again.
author: Leon C.

description:
Great service at bar and a good french martini.  But their food is SOO unhealthy tasting...yowsers. We had the beet salad which had strawberries, bacon bits, feta cheese and tons and tons of dressing (kinda defeats the point of eating salad). The jalapeno sticks were ooozing with cheese and deep fried. I had a bite and that was enough... 

I imagine this is a great place to go after drinking and to soak up the alcohol.
author: Natalie S.

description:
The scene on Thursday night: 
Bar is packed, groups of dudes abound, Olympics are on the flatscreens, great tunes courtesy of a well executed Pandora playlist (yah!) are playing. 

It's so crowded in fact,  I didn't even find my friends hiding in the back of the bar at first. They even have classic bar food. Big points for the sweet potato fries. Would definitely consider returning solely to grub on burger and/or other menu selections that looked equally tasty. 

Drinks - we all had beer/wine. But they have a solid selection of mixed drinks. They even have 40 oz. Olde English in a paper bag. For a price of course. 

I did get the feeling that the ratio was heavily in favor of the ladies and that were I willing (sorry dudes, I'm taken) I could've met plenty a cute guy there.
author: Lara M.

description:
So, this used to be Bar Johnny but it has a slightly different vibe. It's sort of like a classed down version - but not in a bad way. The decor hasn't really changed, sort of a chill but classy feel. I say "classed down" because it's just a little sportier feeling. I don't remember Bar Johnny having big screen TVs where Bullet does and BJ certainly didn't have OE 40's in a paper bag or tater tots on the menu! 

The food was pretty good - more bar food than BJ's offered. Do not order the mozzerella sticks though! I didn't think you could mess up mozz sticks, but these might have been the worst I ever had. Tots were tasty, mac and cheese pretty good, and sweet potato fries yummy as well. 

Overall a cool spot in Russian Hill, it was pretty packed on a Friday night so I imagine it's here to stay.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Finally, there's a place on Polk St. to watch the game AND get some good grub!

Big screen tvs, a great beer selection and a killer new menu (far from Bar Johnny's selection) are just a few of the things the guys from Tonic have done to improve upon this great location.

Although there are plenty of temptations to entice you - wings, burgers, tater tots, mac & cheese, sweet potato fries, truffle fries, zuccini sticks, etc - there are plenty of healthy options too. The roasted beet & goat cheese salad is first on my list! 

I plan to be @ Bullitt a lot this football season so plenty of salads to choose from is key... to balancing out the Chimay.
author: Lauren C.

description:
New management, now run by a**holes.

Used to frequent the bar for the truffle fries when it was Bar Johnny, but will not be back for two reasons.

1: Treated extremely rudely/girlfriend felt threatened by owner on New Years' Eve. Why pay to get treated like shit? 

2: Truffle fries not as truffle-y as they used to be. Cut corners and business will suffer.
author: Brett H.

description:
I bought my first group-on for Bullitt which was a burger and unlimited tater tots and bourbon for two.  I had promised I'd take le chez, however, due to extreme lagging and it expiring on 12/31, i took along the phuse120 and hoots mcgoots.  I had never heard of Bullitt and was expecting a sit-in restaurant.  Instead, because it was on a Thursday, I arrived to a packed bar.  It was so packed that we were only able to get seating outside.  There were three of us but only seating for two so took turns sitting.  However, a party leaving inside kindly notified us when they were about to leave.  I was expecting a gourmet burger, however, adjusted my scale to rate barfood.  I ordered the Dr. Strangelove which was jack, bacon and chipotle ranch along with a side of totchos and a burbon on the rocks.  We also ordered endless truffle tots.  Our waitress was very nice, however, due to bar being at maximum capacity, felt a little pressured in ordering as she was over our backs waiting.  So pressured that they, being bourbon noobs, were unable to come up with a drink and instead, stuttered something that wasn't burbon at all.  The waitress did not even charge us for our blunders.  The place was very jolly with the adjacent table, who also had the group-on, were downing as much bourbon as they could as the deal ended at 7 p.m. 

The food arrived fairly quickly and served as the perfect complement to Ricky Rubio's coming out party on TNT against the Heat.  My burger was delicious, full of grease and fat, and the slightly burned/charred patty brought that feel good bar food feeling.  When you eat at a bar, it is less for the actual taste then just filling your stomach.  However, the totchos stole the show.  They are basically nacho tots, drenched in cheeses, picca de gallo, guac and sour cream.  It was so damn savory.  My friends enjoyed their food thoroughly and I was able to try their mac-n-cheese, also fucken money.  The truffle tots tasted no different than safeway freezer tots and in many ways, are the perfect bar food, more so than peanuts.  Whether you dip them in ranch or ketchup, there is no incorrect way of eating them.  After we scarfed down our truffle tots, we ordered another batch of sweet potato tots.  These tasted kinda strange.  They were heavy and they came with a side of that sauce you get when you order a King of Thai #31.  Our waitress was very patient and timely with the food and drinks and despite how busy it was, was able to shoot the shit with us in all things RUBIO.
author: Brian V.

description:
Well above average bar food. Haven't ordered food at night, but during the afternoon the burgers (beef and turkey) have been delicious. If I'm in the mood next time we stop in maybe I'll order the mac and cheese.

Drinks are pretty much what you'd expect anywhere. Maker's and Fernet on tap. The specialty cocktails I've tried all tended to be a little on the sweet side so I like to stick with classics here.  Limited but  respectable selection of draft beers. 

Good atmosphere to throw back a few drinks. On a slower night this is a great place to sit at the bar and chat with whoever you came with or other patrons. Friendly crowd.
author: Emily C.

description: I was very disappointed with the customer service I experienced here at bullshiit whoops I mean bullit. The blonde waitress was very unprofessional the most unprofessional waitress I have ever seen in my entire 30 years of Resturant management
author: James C.

description:
Why 5 stars?  

Well.....
1) good, reliable food, CHEAP
2) a tap selection that will only become more impressive with the rumored additions of FERNET and Makers Mark
3) Brass Monkeys in a paper bag
4) The Essential Bottomless Mimosa to facilitate your hangover as you watch the 10 AM Pats kickoff (yes, they have the package)
5) Choco Tacos

That equals five.
author: Kasey D.

description:
I'm ALL IN!  Great place to watch a game & grab some eats or just chill with friends.  Good music, drink selection (Lots of beers + Maker's Mark & Fernett are on tap!), not too bright, AND they serve awesome, cheap, food...UNTIL 1:30AM EVERY NIGHT!  The only thing they don't have is dice.  Get on that Bullitt! 

The food, I love it.  Burger and a side for under $10 at dinner?  Can't go wrong, but these burgers are quality.  The apps and sides are great, too.  I usually go for the Godfather (basil, prosciutto, mozzarella) with a turkey burger or The Good The Bad & The Ugly (onion rings, bbq sauce, etc) with a chicken breast.
author: Luke W.

description:
Bison. Turkey. Chicken. Veggie.

So many good burger options. You loyal readers know that once I saw the veggie was housemade, I had to have it.

A good burger made great by everything that came with. And by with it I mean grilled onions, BBQ sauce and a side salad, all for a very reasonable $7 and change.

Most people inside were devouring drinks instead of burgers, and all seemed pleased with whatever their pleasure. Yours truly included.
author: Jason B.

description:
I'm on the fence about Bullitt.  At first I was digging it for its smoky dark decor and underground vibe but then it hit me -- I felt like I was inside a sewer.  Is this good?  I don't know how I feel about it when I feel like a Ninja Turtle would blend in effortlessly in here.

Bullitt seems to be a good place to crash with your friends when you've exhausted all the enthusiasm out of your partying and dancing feet.  You'll find rows of people squatting while the equivalent of a little house party goes on it the mini dance floor in the back.  I watched people complain about the speed of their food and bartender. 

Overall the party and place looked like it was in a state of struggle.  I can appreciate it for what it is, but think it needs some fine tuning to bring out the fun.
author: niero g.

description: Came in the other night for Wing Wednesday (25 cent wings, served all night), and was stoked on the quality of the food and solid service.  I've heard it's a great party spot on the weekends, so I'm definitely going to see what all the fuss is about.  Oh, and every Monday night any drink or any food item is $5?  ALL NIGHT??  Insane.
author: Kyle O.

description: Totchos are a must have! Crowd is very... Marina, so not my style... And the Guinness are small but they do have Makers Mark on tap and strong drinks.
author: Dominique D.

description:
Dear Bullitt,

Why are you soo intent on treating with less respect than your other patrons. is there some misconceived notion that my money is not as good as your preferred patrons? Is my skin too dark and therefor your feel as though you have to squeeze every penny out of me and give me inferior service? I didnt think this bar was in the south but i when i come here for some reason your employees treat me as though i come from the wrong side of the mason dixon line. ok, if that is your m.o. ill spend my hard earned money in establishments who dont pre judge how much desposable income i actually have.


so my review for bullitt has gone from bad to worse..... so like i said before....they told ME that it was only 3 mimosas for $15...however everybody else that i knows goes here for bottomless mimosas. so for some reason i am only allowed 3????? really...what is so different about me that i only get three??? do you think that i cant handle my champagne like the rest of your preferred patrons?

another reason why there review gets less stars...i went here on saturday and i asked for a margarita....now most bartenders understand that a margarita is simple drink. nothing too fancy. but why did the server bring me a pink concoction with pink fruit floating around in it? in my experiences margaritas are green. so i take one sip and it was horrible. some one else at my table saw the stank face at first sip. so i kindly tell the waitress....
"i ordered a margarita what is this?"
"its the raspberry margarita"
"i orderd a margarita"
"yes but the bartender wanted you to try this one"
"i want a margarita"
....
waitress "oh try this one"
me "i want a margarita. please bring me a margarita"


so the bartender is trying to upsell me to a $9 nasty drink that i dont want. thats a good way to lose your tip buddy. if you want to upsell lme upsell me but dont bring me the wrong drink twice in hopes of me paying more. good thing i was there with a group of people or my next line would have been "i am sorry that you are trying to pad your bottom line but giving me drinks i dont want. i wanted to order a few rounds of drinks but because you keep forcing disgusting drinks in my direction i will take my money to another establishment that understands you give the customer what they want and dont try to screw them over" please note...everybody else at the table got exactly what they wanted including lower priced beers and well drinks.....hummmmmm getting treated different again here i see....i wonder why especially because i am paying for two people.... if am not welcome round des parts pluss believe i wont be cummin bak hurr no mor

anyways. if that is how they want to treat me...i dont really need to go here...especially not with 5 bars on the same block. ill go somewhere where i am treated as equally as everyone else in the bar.
author: Ashley H.

description:
So, it's a little hazy...

I went to Bullit for an engagement party upstairs and IT WAS PACKED! It was insane trying to get through the crowd, but we eventually did and made our way upstairs. The party itself was great--cool people, ring pops all over the tables (I'm a big fan), but a couple things caught my attention. There was a bar upstairs, but I guess the bartender left for a while when I got there. I hadn't seen the bartender at all while I was there so I was wondering if there even was one. In my hazy state, after waiting for about 5-10 minutes for someone to come back, I just took one of the display beers off of the bar. Whoops! Not my finest of moments or decisions...sorry Bullitt! I'll hit you back for that soon! Anyway, the music was pretty good but one of the speakers in the room we were in went a little nuts and was buzzing, too loud, and just terrible. I think my ears are still ringing from that. Eventually it got fixed and after hanging out upstairs a bit longer, I ventured downstairs. All of a sudden, there were napkins flying everywhere, the music was bumping, it was insanely packed, you couldn't avoid being pushed, the energy was great, everybody was dancing, drinking 40's and having a good time! I heard the 40's come with a condom in the bag which is hysterical. Hey, sex is great, safe sex is even better, so way to go, Bullit-- making magic happen, one 40/condom combo at a time.

I will be back.
author: Holly G.

description: I've had some great times at this place.  They have an amazing brunch and really good cocktails. If you have a chance, the chicken and waffles are a must. My server was a very nice girl whose name I can't seem to remember. Maybe started with a M.  My cute bartender was a tall gentleman from the east coast.  He made excellent margaritas and always seemed to be on top of the ball when I needed a refill.  Do you ever feel like San Francisco is too small at times.  I swear there is this little ugly bartender following me around the city.  He did a great job serving me at Calibri, but was rather loud when he showed up at Bullit and smelled something awful.  Oh well, you can't win them all:( and it surely isn't Bullits fault.  Sometimes the slime of society can detour one from what is truly inspirational.  Margaritas, great brunch, and sexy service.  Cheers to bullit
author: Neil T.

description:
EDIT:  Its been invaded by the Marin/ Russian/Nob hill Crowd.  Bring a body condomo to not infect your self.  
Oh and watch out for D-bags trying to start a fight....it is a plenty.

Ugh....i was really hoping it would stay just slightly under the radar a few more weeks.  

Good bye Bullitt. Thank you for the memories.


Service was great.  Bartenders are attentive.  Had the tempura portabello mushrooms but they were slightly over cooked. 

But overall a good crowd, with a high ratio of women to men. 

For now a great little new spot to chill and people watch.
author: Spanky M.

description:
Polk Street is my new favorite place as are Bullitt and Tonic too! I loathe the marina bars so was excited to find some good spots to quench my thirst so close to home. 

This place is total awesome-ness.  The bartenders and servers are complete superstars across the board and some of the friendliest folk in town.  Im relatively new to the city and these people make you feel like you've been a regular for years  Even the other patrons there are great, I've met some really fun people at this spot. ( Alot can be said for a bar and the kind of crowd they attract).

The food is yummy for bar food and they even have great vegetarian options too!  The beet and goat cheese salad is the bomb and the veg burger is bananas!  The fernet on tap is a force to be reckoned with, watch out it creeps up on you...
author: meagan M.

description:
This place is great! Simply put - 

Great food (weekend brunch is the best, esp the bottomless mimosas), their Mac n Cheese is decent, but I am a real snob and only like homemade Mac. But the real reason I go here = tator tots, enough said! 

Service - great, friendly people, attentive, and laid back. 

TV's for sports, good for groups, and they have Makers on tap... 

Can get a little crowded, so get their early to claim your spot! 

Perfect Sunday Funday place!
author: Brian C.

description: Mimosa sat/sun brunch with the girls. My meal wasn't something  I remembered being overly good or bad. This place gets busy on Sundays. Good spot for group of friends.
author: Jess O.

description: The epitome of the drunk brunch. Good spot for watching some NFL with a medium-sized group, getting some food but mainly a ton of mimosas, and wasting away an afternoon.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I was only in SF for 4 days on this last trip, and we accidentally went to Bullitt three times. For dinner I had an amazing burger with avocado and sprouts, and, as a side, my sister, who knows me so well, ordered me mac and cheese. I typically don't allow myself to eat macaroni and cheese (in public) because it is without a doubt my biggest weakness, and I'll give it all up for mac and cheese once I get started. But I was on vacation, and it was already on the plate! it was really way above average. Creamy style, topped with scallions (a pro move). AND, it's offered as a side dish to a burger!!! 
The other nights we were just here for drinks, which were good. But it was crowded, and the space is super narrow. 

It's a great place, and I have no real complaints. I just think 3 stars is my cap for a neighborhood yuppie hangout.  I'm obviously going to go back though.
author: Emily M.

description: Came here for unlimited mimosas on a Saturday with a bunch of friends.  We stayed several hours - the waitress was awesome and the food was decent.  Apparently my friend Dhiren comes here at least once a week.
author: John R.

description: Sipping on a bullitt fix and a Rodney strong.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Bullitt is my new favorite neighborhood spot. Love that I don't have to go all the way down to the TL on Polk to have a good time - just stroll 3 blocks and meet up close to home.

What led me here was these totchos I was reading about because food is necessary when you're having a good time. I came at 10 and found a nice spot to sit at the front. This place is definitely small and narrow so sitting down is your best bet. We got drinks pretty easily, and they played good music. Overall had a really good time even though we ordered 3 plates of totchos and it was clearly too much for 5 people. Some of my friends thought one of the male bartenders was hot. 

I will be back again. And seriously, not enough bathrooms in there.
author: Jeanne C.

description: A great place to get some bar food and watch a game, but everyone knows that so be prepared for a packed house.  The tater tots are amazing!  The sweet potato ones are some the best I've ever had.  Marshall is an excellent bartender who served us up some amazing Manhattans and kept the food coming.  Did I black out here on a Tuesday afternoon?  Yes.
author: Corey V.

description: Came here with a bunch of friends and we ordered multiple things off the menu, including the tot nachos and the grilled cheese sandwich. Those were probably the best. The other things we had were okay. Our drinks were super strong, too. It's a pretty tight squeeze and can get packed, but it's a cool little bar to hang out in and grab a quick bite.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Bullitt is one of the most dynamic bars I've been to in the city. 

If you are looking for a place to have a casual drink during the week and converse with your friends, it has got that.  But if you are looking for a place to rage face and dance late night on the weekends, its got that too..

They offer a fun and music-filled champagne brunch all weekend long. Bottomless mimosas. Great food. You ever heard of TACHOS?? Do yourself a favor and go visit Bullitt.

Dollar Tacos on Mondays?
25 cent wing Wednesdays?

I would be one of the first to agree that Bullitt is not meant for everyone. However if you like tasty food, dancing to loud music and a very personable bar staff then Bullitt is your kind of place. 

See you there!
author: Grahame S.

description:
I went there last Saturday night for a friend's 30th birthday party.  We got there a bit early at 9:15pm, even before any others arrived.  But, the bar was already hopping.  It's a very narrow space with hardly any room between the back tables and the bar stools.  Basically, everybody has to squeeze through a meat grinder to get in and out of the place.  I suppose that's an attraction for the more handsy people looking for a freebie.  

We returned at 10pm after grabbing some fro-yo down the street at Tuttimelon and the place was really rocking.  The British Open was on the big TV, a surprise for a sports bar.  Some odd golf fans came in with Argyle sweats and sucking on a ghetto-looking 40 in a paper bag.  Anyways, our party was at a reserved room upstairs, which was a very good thing.  But, to reach it, we had to go through a labyrinth of ATMs, bathrooms with annoyed ladies waiting outside, and some tight stairs.  

The upstairs space seemed nice if not small.  It fit about 20 of us standing up and there were some modern looking lamps.  $4 beers, not too bad for a cozy and private function in SF.  When we left around 11:30pm, the whole place was crammed to the brim.  We could barely work our way out sideways.  So, even though we didn't hang at the bar, it seemed like a great place for another night out.
author: Michael C.

description:
Fun crowded 20 something bar. 

Good place to meet people.

The $8 fourty water is a bit steep but makes for a fun night.

A great first stop and on a bar crawl
author: James B.

description:
Was there for the un-official opening night this past Wednesday. By chance, I ran into some friends that convinced me to step into the place after I had just completed ordering burgers from Polkers.

The previous place, Bar Johnny, did not impress me as a great dining experience after a less then filling brunch episode. And I was thinking it was just a re-branding to get people to check out the "newest thing." So, I was hesitant at first to order from the Bullitt menu, especially as I just ordered some burger from across the street.

WOW! Was I wrong. The Bullitt burger menu is really good. I ordered the mushroom swiss beef burger with a side of steamed veggies. The veggies were for my wife, as I pilfered tater tots and jalapeno poppers from my friends to accompany my burger.

I don't know if any of you have had bad beef burger experiences, where the meat can taste putrid. IF you have, you know how it will cancel any future plans of visiting the restaurant. That was not the case with Bullitt.

The burger I had at Bullitt was the freshest beef burger experience I've had since going to The Supper Club in the late 90's. It brought back memories of my grandmothers burgers and when an establishment can evoke that out of me, you've done a good job.

The poppers and tots were also fresh. There was no sense that they came from a frozen bag and reheated. The poppers were spicy and the tots had a great crispness to them.

BEER? Yes, I was surprised to see a diverse selection but I guess that can be expected when your owners also run the bar, Tonic, which is further down Polk Street. The plan for Bullitt is to bring in more flat screen TVs for sports viewing and provide a good clean casual food dining experience.

I think they've got a great gameplan and will be checking them out again tonight with some friends to see what they think.
author: Peter M.

description:
The one time I visited Bar Johnny, I really liked it. Good food, great selection of beers on tap and a friendly staff. Last night when I went to Bullitt, I immediately regretted it. The place was jam-packed with drunk-asses, which is normally not a problem for me... but the crowd was aggressive, rude and only there to posture and act cool. Not a good vibe. To boot, the music was lousy, the service was weak and the beer selection was mediocre at best.

I don't doubt this is a great place for young twenty-somethings to hang out and meet people -- if that's what you want, check it out. But I'm looking for bars that offer a fun place to enjoy some good drinks  and relax -- Bullitt is a complete misfire.
author: Andy S.

description: Pretty good food and drinks.  A girl threw up all over the floor while we were there and it was hilarious.  Also, there's Maker's Mark on tap, which I've never seen before.  Neato.
author: David P.

description:
Fun, trendy, good food, good music, new and they have awesome signature drinks.  Order the brass monkey!  Its a drink to complete any night.

Rock out bullet!

(ps dont' come here its getting too popular)
author: James R.

description:
They make their mimosas with a double shot of rufilin, so you'll black out. 


But they play good music.
author: ashly g.

description: Great spot. Lots of people. They need a better sound system.
author: Kyle C.

description: I went on an off-night and it was about half full. Despite not being filled to capacity, people were constantly bumping into me. If they were really busy I wouldn't even give it a second thought, but they weren't. Maybe this place needs a larger floor plan. Other than that the music was super loud and it was only around 5pm. The drinks were excellent. Probably won't be back. PS, I didn't try the tater tots.
author: John R.

description:
Maybe if I was already trashed this place might have gotten more stars.

The service was slow and inattentive. Took almost 15 minutes for my friend to get her wine and even longer for me to get my water refilled.

My salad was served in a bowl that made it impossible to eat the salad with out it falling all over me whenever I put my fork in it.

1 star for the tator tots, but really $6.95 for a basket for tator tots? That's crazy. Most of the food was priced fairly decent, but I still can't believe that I paid that much for tator tots.

Even though the restaurant changed names, the bathroom didn't change at all. Still reminds me of the elephants at the zoo.  

I miss Bar Johnny, their menu and their drinks. Bullitt will become a late night stop for me on my way home from the bars.
author: sierra s.

description: Enormous servings of inexpensive yummy comfort food that you can get super late on a weeknight and delicous mixed drinks.  I can't even subtract a star for the marina crowd that packs this place.  Don't these people have serious jobs that they have to go to early the next morning?!
author: Poppy C.

description: 4 stars for the waitress who went out of her way to make sure that our experience was  as good as can be expected when the chick at the table next to you is hammered and spilling all of your drinks every 10 seconds! That and she made sure our glasses were ALWAYS full and the food was exactly what I wanted.... covered in cheese. I would go back, for sure. Lets be honest, if nothing else you should go for the cute guy at the door!
author: Shanna T.

description: LOVE! LOVE LOVE LOVE! yes, this place can be crowded at times, and I so wish they would expand, but the tatchos make it so worth it! One of my favorite spots in SF for sure! I had a coupon here, and the service was phenomenal. Tip - most servers get shafted on coupons because people dont tip on regular price. Tip before hand and you will be happy and so will your server!
author: Stephanie S.

description: FANTASTIC Tater Tots!! Friendly staff, but pretty loud as the music is loud. Still worth checking out because of the Truffle Oil and Sweet Potato Tater Tots!!
author: Kristin W.

description:
Two words: mozzarella sticks.
Two more words: tater tots.

A few more words: Was the last stop of the night, so don't remember too terribly much, but would definitely come back for the aforementioned :)
author: Allison B.

description:
Not an exaggeration when I say that this is the worst bar I've ever been to in my entire life.  ever, ever, ever.  I wouldn't even give it one star if Yelp didn't make me...

We walked quite a distance to check out this bar, based on multiple glowing Yelp reviews and even a great recommendation from the friend we were staying with (we out-of-towners didn't know any better).  We were looking for a good bar with good food.  Not too much to ask for, right?  wrong.  Got all the way there, walked in, couldn't find a seat at a table.  No worries, we sat at the bar with no complaints.  

First, the bartender.  Seriously dude, how hard is it to at least FAKE being nice?  You're a bartender, your job is to serve drinks, and you should have known that going into the job.  When we asked for a food and drink menu, he looked at us like we had just killed his puppy.  Wow, sorry for asking!

So we looked over the food menu for a few minutes, waiting on him to come back to take our order.  Took a while, but he came back.  We ordered two beers, a burger - medium well, two buffalo chicken sliders, and the regular mac and cheese.
