Meanwhile, the place starts to get busier.  And busier.  So much so, that my entire right side is squeezed up against a pack of dudes standing around by the bar.  Really?  Please give me at least an inch of space so I can drink my beer and eat my food without you hanging all over me.  

Our food finally comes out and the burger - charred to a crisp!  Not even CLOSE to medium well.  Does their cook know what that means?   The mac and cheese - okay, but pretty bland.  I was expecting more after reading all the reviews.  The sliders - nothing special, and the chicken wasn't tender at all.  By this time I was so frustrated that I couldn't even lift my arm to use my fork because of these jerks next to me.

So we kept trying to get the bartender's attention so that we could get a beer refill, but he was too busy texting on his phone.  Finally, the second bartender, who didn't have our tab, came over and helped us out instead.

To top it off, they were blaring this horrible techno mix music that was so loud we could hardly hear each other's voices when trying to have a conversation.

We paid the bill, literally squeezed our way out of there and sighed with relief once outside.  Terrible experience, and I'm shocked at how many good reviews this place gets.  It might not have been so bad if the service was better, but our bartender quickly pegged us as tourists and didn't care to help us at all.
author: Andrea P.

description:
I've been to bullitt a handful of times, my review is a summary of these moments. I have to preface this review is mostly on the bar since I have not eaten there yet. With this in mind, I did see they have a grilled cheese menu, which excites me, more to come with that...

Bullitt is like a car in the used dealerships lot. It's shiny, still has that new car smell, comes with all the bells and whistles (whiskey and fernet on tap, 40s in a paper bag... etc), so you think this car is awesome. Then you take it home and the following week have to get new brakes. 

It's on Polk st. but similar to Tonic has a slightly Marina scene... which really doesn't bode well for the barbell/hallway shape of the bar. It gets crowded quick and don't expect anyone to move out of the way so you can meet your friends who have a table in the back. 

Saving grace: apparently the upstairs can be rented out for 100 bucks and you can bring your own music and 40 (or was it 30) of your nearest and dearest.. that could be worth another trip!
author: Hailey P.

description: Hey Bullitt! Could you give us some crowd control please? As a member of the "north polk" bar scene, its the perfect gateway in between the marina and lower polk scene. A little bro-y, but a slightly younger crowd than the marina. Level of douche can vary depending on the night. Drinks are about as weak/lame as your trashy college dive bar. That said, on the rare occasion when the crowds thin out (which is only happens really early or really late), it can be a fun place to get sloppy and just dance.
author: Joanne S.

description: It's truly genius to offer tater tots as a side. It was more like tater tots with a side of sliders. Amazing.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Six friends, twelve martinis, one perfect window side table, six comfort meals and four run ins with friends passing by.  

We collectively decided it was going to be martini night.  Although our service was spotty, we managed to quickly down a few martinis before ordering our "comfort fad food" dishes.  I went with the classic fried chicken, husband ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich, friends went with sliders, grilled cheese with tomato soup, and more sliders.  All came with fun sides: tater tots, mozzarella sticks,
mac & cheese .. quickly my memory flashed to my high school cafeteria days, minus the braces and Guess jeans.

The food was exactly what I expected: hearty, filling and greasy.  Nothing was overtly amazing or disappointing.  The highlight of the night, however, was while munching down, four different friends who just happened to be walking past the Bullitt window, recognized us and joined our conversation.  

Our dinner at Bullitt was the quintessential San Francisco night.
author: Bridget W.

description: Bourbon.  On tap.  Endless tater tots.  Lovely bartenders/servers, who aren't too busy to have a quick convo while working the bar or their customers.  Granted I went on a slow day, which was just fine with me.  I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Edward W.

description: I like it here. It's perfect for all occasions. Awkward dinner with your ex's sister and her fiance, brunch & bottomless mimosas with your bestie on Easter (or any other Sunday), a happy hour drink or 5 or a stop on your Polk St. bar crawl. For food, there are many choices including burgers, tator tots, salads and mac & cheese. Everything is served with a smile too.
author: Sara P.

description: How can you go wrong with 10 bucks for a burger and a beer? I'm a fan!  Drinks are good here and the bartender fixes them up right. For me that a commodity. We did the tater tot thing...totally worth it.
author: Patrick W.

description: Hellloooo Sunday Funday!!! Walked into this place on a glorious Sunday morning for brunch and were welcomed with an upbeat vibe, bumpin' music, chill people and overflowing bottomless mimosas. I was one happy girl. I will be back.
author: Jessica V.

description: This could be my favorite bar in the city, and from the looks of it, many other people share my opinion. It's packed on weekends, it's packed on weekdays, it's packed during the day and it's packed at night. This place even gets a crowd for brunch. That crowd does accentuate the one drawback this place has: space. If you can get over being body to body most of your stay, then I guarantee you will enjoy your time. The music and atmosphere are both great, and after a certain point they start serving their forties in brown paper bags with condoms (why not?). If this place could expand a few feet on every side I would bump up its 4.5 to a 5, but even so I can recommend it without reservation
author: Taylor C.

description: This review comes from only one visit to this bar, so it could have just been an off night.  However, I found this place to be crowded with rude people who are overly drunk.  Seriously this is douchebag central.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Great food, especially for bar food. Great bartenders. Great place to chill on a weekend during the day (when it's not overly crowded). On a Friday or Saturday night it's almost impossible to move or get to the bar to grab a drink. I enjoy this place MUCH more when there aren't a lot of people taking up the prime bar space.
author: Ashley D.

description: I've never had a bad time at Bullitt. 2 of 3 visits have resulted in a Brown Bag 40 being donkey kicked across the bar by a friend, and also a flaming shot spilling and napalming another friend. Both incidents were made more funny by the loose atmosphere Bullit.
author: Leroy S.

description: This review is based on the service here, which is awful. I didn't even get a chance to try anything because I was literally refused. My friends wanted to take me here for my bachelorette night. We went to dinner and they wanted to take me to Bullit for drinks. I hadn't had any drinks yet and my friends suggested we start out with a girly shooter. I go to the bartender and ask if they can do a sex on the beach shooter. The bartender literally said to me, "no, I wouldn't even make you a sex on the beach full sized drink. That's insulting" AND LITERALLY WALKED AWAY FROM ME. That is the rudest thing a server has done. Last time I checked this was a full bar and I pay you for drinks- not your judgement or your opinion. If they didnt have the actual stuff to make that drink, its good customer service to tell that person they cant do that and to offer them something else. To judge someone for ordering a specific drink is stuck up and rude. We just left and it put a damper on my special night. I will definitely never go back.
author: Brittany P.

description: My namesake! Had to check it out. Cool vibe and mellow joint. Only had the wings which were pretty tasty, but will come back for the burgers which looked pretty good.
author: David B.

description:
DELICIOUS burgers. Mac & Cheese (w/bacon!). Tater Tots. Sweet Potato Fries. 

Need I say more?  Yum!!!
author: Katherine N.

description: Came here to try somewhere new. Small & not very loud, even at late luch. The sweet potato tots were good, wish we got the tot'chos though. I had a salad with feta, strawberries, & balsamic dressing. Burgers looked good. Bloody Mary's very good. We were very lucky to find street parking as it was a beautiful Sunday afternoon.
author: Kym T.

description: I came here to drink Trumer Pils and OD on truffle tater tots (which, I admit, are basically exceptional here). And then I left.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Fun bar with a more extensive food menu than I would have ever thought. I've now been for brunch and dinner, and was impressed with each (granted my expectations for their food weren't too high). 

They do have a tater tot bar and burger bar on their menu... but they also have good salad options. Oo the cocktails were also delicious, and service wasn't bad. All in all a good brunch or weekday dinner spot.
author: Caitlin B.

description: This place literally is a "Woohoo! As good as it gets!"....always a quality jumpoff
author: Carl N.

description:
Been meaning to try Bullitt out since it opened, and I just made it in.  I am not a supporter of that $9 OE on the menu, but to each his own.  I am a fan of the wings here.  They had a buffalo sauce that was so tasty, with the perfect amount of heat for the wings.  Followed that up with a burger that was also a delight.  Can't remember if we ended up going with the one with prosciutto or the one with basil, but maybe they are even the same thing.  

The downsides: the salad I had was just not that good.  The tomatoes were inedible, but I guess the real question is why did we order a salad at a bar?  And I don't have an answer.  Our server must have been having a terrible night or something, she seemed annoyed that we didn't have our dinner order ready within 30 seconds of having our menus, and kept up that charade the whole time.  Definitely hit or miss dishes here, but I'll come back and give it another go to find them out.
author: William B.

description: Sure the service was close to awful.  Of course the place was packed with frat boy types. After a few beers those negatives were canceled out. And then when i got my order of TACHOS five stars were earned.  IT IS WHAT IT SOUNDS LIKE TATER TOTS + NACHOS = TACHOS they are real and they are fantastic.....stop reading and go... now.
author: douglas B.

description:
I liked this place, I felt like I really liked it while I was there.  Thinking back, I didn't like it quite as much but still think I'd go again.  I went on a weekend with a group of people so we got the big table in the back and I was pretty happy with the amount of space we had considering how small the bar is and how unaccommodating it is for groups.  

Bar food here = FANTASTIC.  The burgers were money and so were the sweet potato fries.  We were watching the Olympics and there was a ton of sweet  flat screens which was pretty great.  Service was ehhh, and I think they could be way more fun here but overall, a good night.  I'd say a great option when you're looking for the earlier evening spot to get some food and drinks before going out and getting crazy at the bars.
author: Cinds C.

description: When this place opened, I really loved it! We needed a good burger place in the neighborhood and I was hopeful this would be it. Bullitt has the opportunity to fill the niche but they are falling short. The servers and bartenders could be nicer and the beer menu needs a revamp. They could also use a fresh approach to their cocktails. Tighten it up, Bullitt and you could be 4-stars.
author: Cheyenne C.

description: One of my favorite local hangouts on Polk Street.  Love being able to see the same friendly faces that once tended bar at Tonic. Fernet on tap, mac n cheese, and plenty of tvs for sports! Love the upstairs for private parties.
author: Tiffany L.

description: If you come during the early hours for food, you're in the clear (other than the weird, cramped layout), but unless you like getting drinks spilled on you by imbeciles that are wasted by 10:30 p.m., don't come in the evenings, and definitely not on the weekends.  Way too crowded, way too smelly - in no small part because of their nasty restroom - and full of the most obnoxious people.  I actually had to kick a guy in the shin to get him to stop getting grabby.  This place is where fun goes when it has given up on life.
author: Jordan B.

description: i am a regular at bullit, i always come for $5 mondays taco tuesdays and wing wed. this wed afternoon me and a friend who has never been to your establishment previous to this seat our selves at the table touching the bar in the back corner. the bartender takes our oder just as the giants game is about to start. in the middle of the game the waitress asked if we could share our table, i did not mind this at all, i was more than happy to share my table. about 10 min later a group of 5 awkwardly stares at us while we eat and drink the waitress informs the people she sat at our table that our table we were sitting at was "reserved" and that they have to leave the table in 5 min, she leans over to my to tell us same only that my friend lost his hearing in his right ear at birth. when asked to repeat herself the waitress was very rude and talking to my friend like he was stupid, this was extremely rude, insensitive, vulgar, embarrassing and offensive.keep in mind there was no reserved sign, i was never informed previous to me sitting there if i was informed i would have sat at different table while there was still a chance in the middle of giants game there is no room at your bar so your basically throwing us out. the sad thing is this is the 2nd time i have been mistreated at your establishment. the first time me and a large group were told by a waitress that she was going home and that we had to pay our bill before we could order any more food or drinks, the waitress actually waited to give us our tacos before the bill was paid and was working until i left hours later. i will not accept the way i have been treated here at your establishment i will be talking to staff and keeping in touch until i feel that the situtaion has been properly dealt with please feel free to contact me at
author: yoo s.

description: This bar though very small in size is great. They have fun bartenders and though its loud (what bar isn't) its always been one of my top choices to go and have a few drinks. I've been when its busy and when its not and both times I've really enjoyed the atmosphere. I will continue to frequent this place.
author: Franchesca R.

description: My girlfriends and I visited San Francisco this past weekend and spent Sunday night at Bullitt.  We had such a great time.  It was dead when we got there and made friends with the bartender, Jared.  He made great drinks and had great tunes playing.  By the end of the night we had our own little party started with the friends we invited in from the street.  We were dancing around the bar and had such a wonderful time!  Thank you Jared from the "Texas Girls"  Also, thanks for all the music suggestion's just downloaded lots of Calvin Harris.  :)
author: Carmen H.

description:
Been here twice since the changeover in ownership and I would have given them three stars just for not putting truffle oil on the fires anymore. Went with a group of five for the second go around and found everyone truly satisfied with their burger selections. 

Had great and attentive service both times I went, would actually say the bartenders are downright friendly. I have been looking for a new "home base" bar and I think this could very well be the place.
author: Pierre C.

description:
My girlfriend had her birthday party here, and reserved the private room upstairs.  We've seen it before when it was Bar Jonny's but they redecorated very tastefully.  You kinda get the VIP service, like there is a guy at the bottom of the stairs who checks the guest list, and gives you a band which helps to keep the party to your friends.  There is a private bar, or you can have wait service.  You can bring your own music/iPod and plug into their speakers.  Their drinks are economical, and the food is great bar food for when you are on the drink. ;-)  I personally liked this space because of the lighting, and it is set up logistically well, so you can have an intimate party which is condusive to conversations.  

My gf put down her credit card as a deposit for I think, $300.00 which was really easy for a group of 20 people to drink and match so it was stress free.

Apparently a pole and a photo booth will be installed which def. will add a lil spice to the partay ;-)

TIP:  Tell your friends to bring cash
author: Sheila W.

description:
This place is owned the guys who own Tonic, which is just down the street. 

I prefer not to go to Bullitt at night when it is a crowded bar, but rather during the day to eat a simple, yummy lunch. 

They specialize in salads and hamburgers.  It's a great place to go with a guy to for lunch.  Three big screens, wood paneling with a modern hippie dude vibe - non pretentious. Very mellow ... Get the tater-tots.
author: Kate F.

description: We went here recently after a long afternoon walk around the neighborhood to have a beer and an appetizer.  Small, clean, decent place, located in a stretch of the Russian Hill side of Polk Street featuring numerous other bars and restaurants.  Multiple TV's featuring the Giants game is always positive, and there was ample table and bar space (perhaps the total capacity is around 50 people?).  The drink menu features multiple creative but pricey options in the $10+ range, but I think their best known specialty is the Olde English 800 40oz's which they serve in brown paper bags with condoms- I have been here on maybe 2-3 previous occasions, and it seems like 1/3 of the 20 to 30 something year-old patrons are brown-bagging 8balls each time....They have a limited beer selection, and any local business which doesn't have Anchor Steam on tap is missing something from my perspective....but Sierra Nevada is not a bad alternative.  I have sampled the mozzarella sticks on several occasions, and they are indeed ordinary but yummy, and they had a few other interesting things on the menu including something that looked like tater-tot nachos moving by to another table.  I've had good service at the bar in the past, but not-so-good table service most recently as the waitress seemed more interested in socializing with other patrons like a humanized mobile-Facebook app rather than attending to us until I left our table to order at the bar- at which point she sprinted over to take our order.  In summary, I will probably come back, as this spot is about a 5-block walk from where we live, but by no means would I go out of my way from across town to come here.  A drink, an appetizer, and two innings of baseball is the Bullitt formula for me, for anything more I would go elsewhere....
author: Andy S.

description:
Indecisive is not the same as indifferent.

I've been in an odd mood as of late. Not all bad per se, just a little off. Maybe its because I just had one of those milestone birthdays. But certain quirks that I may have found amusing not so long ago are now qualities I might consider irksome. In the same vein, qualities I may have not considered in the past are now draws for me. Case in point: Bullitt. 

The first memorable time I popped in there was for a late brunch. When I say late I mean past 2pm. I have a tendency to really lag if I have a Sunday off and I believe we got there around 3 ish. There is a  brunch menu but even if you are a lagger there are a couple brunchy selections offered through later in the day. Upon first glance I was disappointed there was no homage to its namesake. Really nothing? Although I found this a little discouraging we went ahead with our recovery grubbing. Yes, the burgers are super tasty but on my first go around I went the grilled cheese route. These options are not to be missed and come with a cup of tomato soup and mixed greens. While my sandwich could have used more basil, the buttery squishiness of the bread with its thick slab of cheese and tomato were a delicious bit of comforting heaven. My dining companion's burger was so tasty he didn't bother to put it back in its basket after the first bite and the cheese sticks on the side were large the size of large Lincoln logs. Feeling saucy, I ordered the deep fried HoHos....

Yes deep fried HoHos....score one for Bullitt

The next time I popped in was during prime Saturday night bar time. I went with one of my female friends and while the crowd wasn't Hot Mess Marina, it was difficult to maintain conversation without screeching in an ear. Luck of the draw provided us with a sweet table but I was perturbed by the group of guys next to us wishing the old man of the group a Happy 26th Birthday while another nearby group bemoaned a 19 year old friend who had just gotten her fake ID taken away and therefore couldn't join them. Throw in the fact that the little Mason jar of Sierra Nevada I got was $5.50 (making me instantly wish I had ordered a Guinness instead) and I wasn't exactly thrilled. The taps of Maker's Mark and Fernet were a welcome sight if I were still more of a liquor drinker. The 40oz in the brown bag with condom? Hmm....there's a fine line between kitschy and douchey and I applaud those who dare tread the line. However, I also know that I can recreate this $9 purchase for $2.25 down the road and get the condom for free.  

Next time I ventured in was for a fairly large sporting event in the middle of the week and a burger. My partner in crime for the Saturday night excursion once again met me here as we settled in for a game and gossip.This time the crowd was a healthy mix of Upper Polk and blue collar men all gathering for the same. My burger, the Dr. Strangelove, was juicy slab of meat, goopy love at first bite. My dining/ drinking companion helped me polish off the pile of crunchy tater tots riding shotgun with my burger as we played catch up. Once again the crowd, though not engaging in inner group mingling, happily coexisted and shared the comfy space. Also on a happy note, there is hardly a bad seat in Bullitt for sports watching which will make this place even more of a destination for football season. Still the service was mixed in terms of quality adding to my quandry of what sort of star rating to go with.

Yeah a three feels right. Perfect enough to be indecisive but not enough to say I'm indifferent.
author: Veronica G.

description: i had an ok time when my friends went there on Saturday. I was extremely surprised with their choice of music, was pretty good. the bday boy said it was too packed for his liking, which is why this is a 3. i say this is btw 3/4 because it was great crowd and music.
author: Viola C.

description: I've been here a few times and I will say its a solid addition to the Polk St pub crawl.  What makes Bullitt stand out is that they take credit cards (sorry Royal Oak) and they have TATER TOTS.  They dress they up with blue cheese and bacon , truffles or tachos.  Perhaps I could get my own bag of Ore Ida tots and eat these 'deep fried deer poop (glee reference) at home but where's the fun in that?
author: Sarah C.

description: The Mac-N-Cheese should be renamed Crack-N-Cheese.  I don't know what is in it, but there is literally an orgasm in my mouth with each bite.  Not only that, but they deliver to the bar next door when they are jammed packed and there's no place to sit (which is quite often).  The bartenders are always nice and friendly too.  The guy at the door remembered me after only one visit (I guess I make a good first impression on people, though probably because I ordered an obscene amount of Mac-N-Cheese).  Their burgers are huge and the menu has a great variety to it.  Certainly a high point of my argument for going to Polk Street for drinking as opposed to some of the other areas in town.
author: Michael G.

description: Great vibe and good food.  The totchos are great for hangovers... I was there Saturday during fleet week and the service was a little lack luster, but overall not too bad.  I'll go back for another brass monkey soon enough.
author: Alec M.

description:
terrible service.  We got our drinks spilled all over us and broken glass sprayed all around us by a restaurant work
Ler.  Went home with my clothes soaked.
author: Connie C.

description: Delish tater tots and appetizer platter. Went with friends on a Wednesday during prime HH time. Also got a chicken sandwich with jack and mushrooms, pretty standard but nothing out of this world. Standard selection of beer, wine, and some fun cocktails. Nice spot for groups, unpretentious, and not over the top. Not ideal for HH since there aren't really specials, but it doesn't get too packed!
author: Tejal D.

description: Great burgers and atmosphere.  Oh, and they have Fernet on tap.  AWESOME!!
author: Jason E.

description: I am in the customer service Biz 100 percent, and when you over charge someone $25 bucks than talk hella smack that's fighting words for me. The Manager who claims she is gods gift to the facility is a joke. When you claim someone paid for something they didnt than bitch about it that's wack. If your a manager than manage that place, dont tell customers to go F themselves like you did.. The bouncer was nice but everyone else was like whatever. Dr Teeth in the Mission is very well run in the Mission and the managers and owners know watsup, if only they could act this way there Polk st location. Customer service is what its all about when it comes to problems etc... If you wanna run a Biz hire good people not arogant pricks like the manager who wears a beenie at the Polk st location....
author: SFkid O.
Beth P.

description:
Went there the other day to watch an NBA game and had a great time there. The place was crowded but we were lucky to grab a seat right away since another couple was leaving. We grabbed the seat and everything on the menu looked delicious. I got the wings which were good, not great, but some of the better wings I had in the city. My girlfriend got the beet salad with cheese and bacon. A little too much cheese but a very big salad.

The drinks were good too. I went with the unlimited mimosas and the waitress was very good at ensuring my glass was always full. My g/f got one of their specialty drinks which was a spicy margarita. It came in a big glass and tasted really good. Could have been a little spicier but it was still good. Would definitely go back.

They also sell forties of Old English in brown bags.
author: Jon W.

description: I came here on a Sunday for brunch and I want to give a shout out to the great bartender, Dave who gave us excellent service. We were there for the bottomless mimosas and food and he was super accommodating with helping my friend customize her order. I've been to a few places in SF where you get "bottomless drinks" but really your glass stays empty half the time and you have to flag down the waitress - not here. Our glasses kept getting filled up without ever having to ask as well as our waters and we weren't rushed at all. The food was pretty good, nothing to crazy and not exactly the BEST brunch food in the city, but if you're looking for a good place to grab a bite and watch a game on a Sunday morning, this is a good spot. I'll give a good review any time I get treated that well!
author: Sandy G.

description: Friendly, helpful staff that speaks Spanish, Romanian, and English. Good burgers, good prices, good booze.  If only it were in my neighborhood...
author: Ted L.

description: Good for single ladies on the prowl, lots to look at. Has the advantages of a restaurant and a bar making it a fun social atmosphere. Truffle french fries are to die for!
author: Rebecca R.

description: Our table was wobbily and the fries sucked.  The wine was wine, but overpriced.  If you can't get these simple things right, you shouldn't be in this business.  Maybe they should rename it "Bullshitt."
author: e w.

description: the women servers are so damn nice and hospitable!?  really nice, like happy tavern barmaids that try to bring joy to each table.  ok-good cocktails from bartenders that generally remember your picky drink.  i always turn into lampwick when I'm here, i know it's all so bad but i keep returning.
author: Noel J.

description: The bartender with the handlebar mustache is beautiful and super friendly.. the crowd is usually pretty good in there too... but this is really more of a review of that bartenders sweet mustache . he's lovely.
author: Bc L.

description: Formerly Bar Johnnie and formerly good food too apparently. Hopped in for dinner; overly battered and seemingly low-quality wings and an average "house made" veggie burger. Saving grace-flat screens and a good Hendricks and soda. Come here for drinks, go to Street (block away) for a better burger.
author: Raigen P.

description: i think this place is going to become our regular spot for happy hour with the coworkers. the big table in the back is perfect for our rowdy bunch and we can stay out of everybody else's way with our drunken debauchery. the servers have always been friendly and the bartenders have been accommodating. plus, any place that has truffle tater tots and jalapeno bacon mac n' cheese with a fried egg and fried onions holds a place very near and dear to my heart.
author: Regina C.

description: Not a huge fan as this place is pretty pricey. Good stuff but pricey. Like a $9 buck 40oz OE in a bag? wtf? I mean  I think it comes with a condom too for class sake but for realz? There is also Fernet and Makers on tap which was cool but it's not like it added much for something just being siphoned from a bottle (not carbonated or anything). The bartenders are kind and they have a section of their menu that is dedicated to tater tots. The tatchos (tater tot nachos) I think are the best bang for your buck. All in all it's a solid place with a classy look (minus the OE) but at the same time I think I know of classier places.
author: Greg G.

description: Awesome place for saturday bruch with friends.  Tachos and bottomless mimosas - do it.
author: Rob E.

description: The novelty of the brass monkey wears off as soon as you order it and realize it's 9 bucks.  It's like putting gourmet rotisserie rosemary lemon chicken on a waffle instead of the fried variety.  Totally honk.  The service was great, however, and the food menu is complete with tots, poppers, and a $13 filet mignon.  How they taste doesn't really matter after you've finished the brass monkey.
author: Victoria G.

description: Not sure why so many people like this joint. The food is just average and the drinks are nothing special. If I had the choice I rather be at Harry's bar. I'm also not a big fan of how hipster this place and its customers TRY to be. Kinda funny but yea not when I'm eating and trying to have a freaking beer. You don't gotta lie to kick it.
author: Jess C.

description: Fernet and Makers on tap, and they also sell Old English 40's. They get a lot of street cred in my book just for this. My only problem is: 3 draft beers later, I've racked up a tab of 16.50. THREE BEERS. I should have price checked the OE and made a data-based decisions. That said, not a bad place to hang out with friends on a Monday evening.
author: Adam D.

description:
It's sticky, and there's mildew everywhere. Ick!
And the day guy behind the bar is a zombie.
author: Ame W.

description: Its ok. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. I miss Bar Johnny. That place was legit.
author: Johanna W.

description: Good atmosphere for drinks with friends. Also, I went to a birthday party in the private area upstairs and it was pretty neat. I only give it 2 stars because the food is really heavy and unhealthy. If you are the type of person who likes things fried, breaded and covered in cheese, go here. If you are like me and get acid reflux from the thought of the above mentioned, stink to the drinks. Plus, it gets so crowded you cannot really chat with people.
author: Amy M.

description: It's baconburgers and tatertots covered in cheese and guacamole. Why are you still reading this? Go!
author: Sean F.

description:
This is our go-to bar now. They have a couple of good bartenders. One of them looks like a cool, Mr. Clean! They have Maker's Mark and Fernet on tap too! You can even order a "40" in a paper bag. 

The burgers were pretty de-lish!

The only down side is the server staff is a little slow. We were constantly looking for our next drink and the check.
author: Mel C.

description: I'm not going to lie, it seemed exactly like Bar Johnny, but just with a few minor tweaks. But the staff was super nice, the signature drinks were tasty and the bar food...well it tasted like bar food...but it is a bar, so there wasn't a surprise there.
author: Rose K.

description: Chill atmosphere in the Polk-Gulch area. Not so college-y. Bartenders should be a little bit more on top of things. I asked for Effen vodka and the woman said they didn't have it even though I was staring right at the non-empty bottle. I didn't want to argue with her. Maybe she was having a rough night. I got Stoli instead. Not a bad replacement. Sit near the window. Makes for good people watching in and outside of the bar.
author: Farah S.

description: Ordered an ice tea which wasn't much larger than a shot glass and was gone in 2 sips. The beet salad came out and what a DISASTER. SOOOOO over dressed and drenched in balsamic. The candied nuts were unrecognizable as anything edible. Basically ate the beets and the 2 strawberries and walked out $11 poorer and still hungry. GROSS!
author: Wendy W.

description:
$9 for a 40oz. of Olde English!?!?!? Seen many SF bars pull off preposterous crap for some nostalgic, hip experience. It is usually in the form of PBR happy hour and free microwaved appetizers. Which is good. Drink for cheap and do not go broke doing it. In this case for the extra $6 bucks you get a paper bag to complete the look. WTF!

Besides that Bullitt is a work in progress when it comes to space, service and onion rings. Space is from the old Bar Johnny so you either sit at the bar or high table tops. Hopefully they get some new furniture in, felt rather cramped in the bar. Place is self seating and on a busy Saturday night a table was easy to find. Service was OK but very slow at times. And when we asked for napkins for a group of us we got one napkin. One napkin? For people eating burgers with BBQ oozing out the sides just leave a napkin dispenser. Menu setup is nice. Pick your meat of either beer of bison. And then the style of sandwich. Tons of great choices using everything from bacon to sprouts to prosciutto. Burgers were tasty and their medium is on the rarer side. Wide variety of side choices but be wary when picking onion rings you get a whole three of them. Not asking for them to rain from the heavens. But do not skimp on the onion rings. 5 is acceptable number but 3 is not!

Hope the kinks or whatever gets worked out here since this place needs to find its identity and really get rid of the $9 40oz. You know it is malt liquor! For my burger experiences stick to your local haunt or Barney's for a similar price point.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Fernet and Makers Mark on TAP?   I think I found the new love of my life.  Okay so the place is literally exactly the same as Bar Johnny, which was just another bar on Polk.    

Good spot to get a bite and drink ... lots of hotties attend this place too which is always a plus.  

One of my less creative reviews, but i saw it was unfinished, so if you dont like it EAT me
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description: Service was really slow and the burgers were tiny. The 15 all you can drink mimosas would have been worth it if they were filled up. This may be a good bar but don't come here for brunch.
author: Kim H.

description: Had an EPIC brunch there. Food was great, bloody mary's were superb and then they we went on to bottomless mimosas. They used to be $9; the new ownership upped them to $15 but its still a good deal. I wish they had more stars for service.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Fun hang out spot with decent bar food! 

http://www.lipglossculture.com/2011/street-pop-san-francisco-local-favorites-where-to-shop-eat-and-party/4/
author: Katie G.

description: $15 bottomless mimosas on Sundays, good burgers and grilled cheese! Fun place to watch the games and the skylights make it feel like outside still! I will be back next Sunday!
author: Jenny I.

description: This is a fantastic bar for a Sunday funday.  I love the bottomless mimosas until 3pm, the food is pretty good for bar food, and the crowd is fun!  I also like coming here on weeknights to meet up with friends.  Weekend nights get too packed and there's too much douchebaggery at that time for my liking.
author: Katherine K.

description: Somewhat pretentious, but good for happy hour or early drinks.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This place was awesome. My sis lives pretty close and recommended it. It's on Polk St, so close to a lot of other good bars. Fast and friendly bartenders and it had a good-looking and friendly crowd. Also had the USC football game going, so that was a plus. 

However, besides a good vibe and aforementioned items, the thing that sets Bullitt apart is the menu. After I've been drinking for several hours, being able to order another drink AND a grilled cheese at the same place is AWESOME. I only had the grilled cheese but it was terrific and the other food looked great too.

I'll be stopping back when I swing through SF.
author: David M.

description: Just got attacked by a girl at this bar without provoking her, she was obviously drunk and belligerent and was ghetto (she kep calling me the N word and I am white!). Staff tried to calm the situation down by kicking her out and pouring me well drinks but the drunk girl was still around and persistent to harass me (how was she still in the bar is beyond me), they did no kick her out and kept her for her $. I have a ripped $100+ shirt and busted lip for no reason other than because this drunken girl wanted to attack me ( I did nothing to provoke her but my appearance must have offended her), and no respect or sympathy from bullit staff, a mere dismissal that this happens all the time was their goto answer.. and this was a favorite bar of mine for the past year or so..THIS IS NOT OK!!!! The bar has been degrading over the years and this is the final straw that broke my will to got there again. Poor security staff, in fact terrible security staff and mediocre bar service should not cut it in this city, how is this bar still around? Disappointed in you Bullit management, I expected better.. fix this and help me help you build a better reputation... i am very uset with what just happened and your lack of oversight.
author: Cem T.

description: Hot boston bartender, no douchebags, amazing cheese related eats, delicious drinks, key sporting events on the television, and a great soundtrack. Can't ask for much more.
author: Danielle M.

description: It's ok during the week - can be chill and has decent food - However it's become super trashy and B&T on the weeeknds
author: Pan P.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have come to Bullitt for many occassions.  Its a great place for drinks although it does get very crowded on the weekends.  I highly suggest stopping in for lunch  The food is far better than offerings at the burger place across the street.  Prices are reasonable and the options are plenty
author: Kristin M.

description: Best hamburger I've had in SF.  The Cool Hand Luke, with swiss, prosciutto, fried egg, grilled onions.  Scrumptious.
author: Jesse H.

description: Okay, Tot-chos!  Tater Tots with cheese, sour cream,  guacamole, olives and peppers.  Get the defibrillator!  Also, whats up with glamorizing a mass murderer - The Charles Manson Burger  - Come on.  Why not the Dahmer burger made from, well you get it.  For bar food its okay and nice strong cocktails.
author: Toby W.

description: Well, I like the idea that they stay open until 1:00 am.  I ordered some food to go and they told me it would take 11 minutes. That's wierd, huh?  It took more then 20 minutes.  I do like the food, its very basic and cheaper then Polkers that is across the street.   Hot bartender babes too.
author: tammy l.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night for dinner/drinks, and I checked reviews on Yelp but still wasn't sure what to expect.  Overall, I was pleasantly surprised.

I don't know why people have been complaining about the food.  It's not gourmet, but for bar food it's pretty fantastic.  Our table got an assortment of burgers, salads, and probably every kind of fries possible (I would definitely recommend the curly fries).  The grilled chicken on my salad was delish.  I wouldn't come here just for dinner, but like I said, it's pretty great bar food.

The decor is really nice, but the beers are still cheap, making it very conducive to being packed and so service was a little slow.  But after a point in the night, I suppose that's expected.

Overall, I say go into your experience with a grain of salt and you'll have fun.
author: J C.

description: STAY AWAY!!! Crazies are employed here! I was there last week and saw a bartender punch a patron in the face over the bar. The line for the bathroom also gets to be out of control. So go here if you want to get assaulted
author: Blake W.

description: Wow! AMAZING Burgers. I had the Godfather Burger which has mozzarella, prosciutto, and basil. Then you get to choose which kind of side you want. I chose the Mac and Cheese and let me tell you, this is no easy mac. It was so creamy and cheesy and delicious. Also my hoegaarden beer washed everything down nicely. I would definitely go back especially because it was so inexpensive.
author: Jamie E.

description: The chicken wing, mac and cheese and tater tot combo just made my night!  It was only $9 bucks at 1am to purchase this plate of happiness.  Everything on the menu is under 10 bucks!  The bartenders were awesome.  Quick and super cool.  This is a great new spot.  I used to love bar johnny and whatever the new owners are doing, they managed to keep the same great vibe and food while updating the atmosphere.  Keep it up guys.  You have a new fan.
author: Sean M.

description: Great design, service and food, bullitt has 4 big screen tvs, great to watch sports. For lunch they have reasonable prices.
author: Ekin G.

description:
I went here twice in one weekend and had the same experience both times. The first time I was a bit sad to see the guys installing multiple TVs, as the elegant decor from the former Bar Johnny's begs to NOT be turned into yet another Polk Street sports bar.

On both visits the burgers were amazing. The Lolita is highly recommended. However, the service was horrible both times. I had to ask for menus, ask for beers, ask for the check, ask for my credit card to be run, etc. on both occasions. I realize the guys from Tonic are ironing out some opening weekend kinks, but they seem entirely uninterested in providing good customer service. The table wasn't even wiped down before we sat down and our dirty dishes were never cleared. 

I'll give the place another shot since I live in the neighborhood and the burgers are fantastic, but the hopefully the service improves soon or they will lose a lot of customers as there are plenty of other bars in the area. I hope they turn it around soon.
author: Amanda B.

description: Been back several times since the first review - consistently like it.  Great place for a few quiet ones after work, Mark is one of the cooler bartenders/GMs out there.  Can't comment on it after 8:00 - you're on your own there ...
author: Cy L.

description: Walked in for a quick drink. Left 4 hours later with heavy buzz, well fed.  Bennie the owner is an awesome dude. He deserves this success. Will be back with friends in tow next time.
author: Steve G.

description: Rented the upstairs bar for a friends Birthday party. The space was a little small for the max amount of 60 people they allow but for our group of 40 it was perfect! When you rent the upstairs, you get your own bartender and free range of the space. They were very accommodating allowing us to decorate and play our own music. Our bartender Alex was super chill and fast,  as was the bar back Dre. Corey, who helps arrange the party was very easy to reach and answer any questions. The food is also amazing! Loved the Sampler Platter. Everyone who came had a great time. Thanks!
author: e w.

description: Love it! Good vegetarian food close to home, burgers are amazing, and I'm officially addicted to sweet potato fries. Good music and Hoegaarden in a mason jar. Definitely a new favorite spot to hang out.
author: Andrew L.

description: Delicious burgers, great hangout, chill spot. It checks all boxes.
author: who k.

description: Avoid this place on the weekends, its turned into Jersey Shore, a victim of its own success. Come during the week way better crowd.
author: George R.

description: LOVED this place when it was Bar Johnny so gave it a shot this weekend for brunch. There was only one guy serving, and while he tried, the service wasn't great at all. Food was just okay - not worth the money. Paid $15 for a "bottomless" mimosa but felt like I was harassing the guy to get it refilled each time. My friends got burgers that were about 2" in diameter. Great mac n' cheese though!
author: Meg M.

description: Cool venue; great burgers....and I love me some burgers! They need to add some more beers to their selection and I'll add the 5th star! Weekend all you can eat brunch is good too.... can you say fresh made waffles..mmmmm
author: John M.

description: These Tater Tot's are mind blowing! Everything tastes pretty good here besides their Beet Salad. The dressing wasn't that wonderful. I'll stick to Taters everytime. This place is popular and gets pretty busy so it does take a while to flag down your waitress for a check. All around - I love it!
author: Shana H.

description: came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. the bar has a very rich feel to it from all the wood furniture. my friend had reserved the back seating area so it was nice to have a place to sit. drinks were standard price for the area. there was a waitress that was walking around helping people get their drinks...a little confusing at first because she just looked like a random girl that was just hanging out in the bar at first. they also have a small food menu. the mac and cheese was pretty bomb. it gets crowded fast on a friday night so i would come here and pre-party and then hit up another spot afterwards.
author: Linda N.

description: I had a coupon for half off through homerun.com.  Little did I know when I got there they have an entire section on their menu dedicated to tater tots!  And another one for macaroni and cheese, and yet another for grilled cheese sandwiches.  My personal heaven!  And, there's plenty more food as well.  The tater tots were amazing, mac and cheese was ok, not super flavorful, and after that, I had no room for anything else.  I'm not thrilled with the beer selection, on tap there was just a few, and the only good one, to me, was Sierra Nevada.  There wasn't too much bottled either.  But, the cocktail collection is impressive, and next time I'll have to try one of their signature cocktails.  The actual place is cool, not huge, but big enough if you're able to grab a spot.  You can see the TV's from any spot in the bar.  The wait staff and bartenders are all really nice and attentive.  There is music playing at a good volume, not so loud that you can't talk or think.  Overall, great place, I'll definitely be back.
author: Stephanie J.

description: This place is a hangover's dream.  We came here for brunch after the Union Street festival and were ready to get some grub on which they did not disappoint.  We had tater tots with blue cheese and bacon - to which I tried to secretly lick the plate when my friends weren't watching.  We also did the appetizer platter with portabello sticks (amazing!), hot wings (emphasize on hot and spicy) and the mac and cheese (creamy goodness).  We also did sliders while trying to fix our wrecked bellies with some protein - the ones with the bacon and onion rings are to die for.  So the food was amazing . . . .however the server was not.  After being told we couldn't do bottomless mimosas because "they were running low on champagne", the mimosas that we did get were basically oj with a tiny splash to give it a little fizz.  One of my friends complained because it very obviously was almost completely alcohol free and had to go up to the bar to deal with it.
author: Arica V.

description: Yelp just erased my long review. Not gonna spend any more time writing. 4 stars.
author: joe c.

description: Woooowwwwww.....I will probably never go into this establishment again!  Not because the bartenders and the rest of the staff weren't nice...no, that's not it at all, they were all friendly and helpful with the service, which I greatly appreciated.  However, no amount of customer service can overcome my experience there last night!  This place was INSANELY packed...not sure if it's always like that or if it's because there was a Polk St. Pub Crawl earlier on that day, but it was absolutely ridiculous!  Don't you have a door man there so they can regulate the number of people there!!!!  I'm not a big fan of SUUUPPPPEERRRR crowded places, but I'll tell you why.....because weird, nasty, inappropriate, disrespectful guys like the ones there last night try to touch you in places that are NOT appropriate all because it's too crowded to see who did it!!!  I was absolutely appalled at what happened to me last night.  I mean, I get it, it's crowded, you accidentally touch my ass I get it, whatever.  Last night, I seriously wish my private area was a Venus Fly Trap so I could've caught the Beef Head who was so inappropriate!  GROSS!!!  Needless to say, my girlfriends and I exited the establishment immediately and went to bar next door....less crowded.  Moral of the story, I don't want or have the need to go somewhere with a 9-1 ratio of men to women, especially when the guys behave the way they do there.
author: Ashley J.

description: loud!  fun place though.  just not great competing with the noise to try to talk.  it's a nice spot though - i'd go back.  i didn't have anything to eat  but the drinks are good (bourbon and ginger at least).
author: Hammer Time H.

description: Of all the bars on Polk, this happens to be my least favorite.  I have always found the prices high and the service poor.  I am more of a dive bar fan in general, so certainly take the review with a grain of salt.
author: Daniel R.

description: I come here too much. The cheeseburgers are by far the best thing they have and they are yum. Other than that the place is too small to accommodate the marina crowd that has spilled over on to Polk street, it gets super hot and you basically end up standing on people's tables and tripping over everyone to get a drink. It's a recipe for freaking out on a bad night and more than a little annoying on a good night.
author: Caedmon P.

description: Good ambiance, good place to watch a game, and a great place to hang out if you're a single girl because the place is 90% men.  The burgers were nothing to write home about and the waitstaff seemed way in over their heads.  I miss the old Bar Johnny burger but this place seemed to be doing really well considering it was packed.
author: Chrissy M.

description: i met an old friend sat night after the giants game at this place, it was my first time, we sat right as they started taking the tables away, the waitress i think her name was kristina was super friendly and quick, my friend and i only had an hour to catch up before his wife showed up, even tho the place was packed we got 4 rounds in with her, the bad part was that they sent her home right when the placed filled up so getting the next round took so long we decided to go next door, would be rad if they kept the staff around a bit longer
author: Big B.

description: amazing food, booze and staff! looooove it all
author: Lauren M.

description: I've never had a bad time at Bullitt. Whenever you walk in, there is a fun familiarity to the place. It has a modern style with an elegant bar, lots of different types of seating, funny bartenders, unobtrusive TVs for the ultimate sporting events, and the owner walks through with his dog. Everyone seems to be engaged at the bar whenever I've visited - a very welcoming and fun spot.
author: Morgan T.

description: Went there on a tuesday night to grab a beer and some dinner, this place was pretty busy for a tuesday. Good for them! I got the beet salad which is amazing and huge and well priced so I  was happy. Service was great, really friendly bartender....I'll definitely come back for the brunch, I love a good waffle! :)
author: jackee p.
